question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question_list.question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?
alternate_answers:
The limerick suggests that composing a morose epicedium (a funeral song or poem) can help brighten one's torpor and tedium. The limerick states:

"To compose a morose epicedium 
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium."

So the answer is that writing a moderately melancholy funeral poem or song can help alleviate boredom and listlessness, according to the limerick.

Compose a morose epicedium.
Craft a sad dirge, not too mournful,
Just medium, not scornful,
To lift your spirits, a musical medium.

question_list.author: Celia Warren
question_list.text:
Oh, don't throw your toys out your pram!
Yes, I treat all your emails as spam.
Hurt your feelings? Don't care;
I don't like you, so there!
Just accept that I don't give a damn!
question_list.question: Why do I treat all your emails as spam?
alternate_answers:
Because I don't like you, so there!
Your feelings? I don't really care.
Just accept that I'm cold,
And your messages, old,
Are as welcome as a grizzly bear.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
His assets are huge. Yes, he's rich.
He complains that his tax bill's a bitch.
But I'd not be surprised
If his worth were disguised
Just in time for his seven-year itch.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Can you guess what this little seed-gripper did?
(Its hind legs are so long, that young dipodid;
It's long-tailed and small-bodied: I
Can tell it's Dipodidae.)
Well, it jumped on my head, the wee nipper did.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
What's wrong with this picture, please tell:
King Tut said, "Embalmers, work well.
'Cause my mummy must last —
AD 10 and far past,
Please wrap me so well I don't smell."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Learn biology terms? What a grind!
But a useful example to mind
Is in flower buds growing
Or animals slowing.
Æstivation explained and defined.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
At the Purvis memorial service,
His assistant, head bowed, seemed quite nervous:
She insisted, out loud,
"He'd no right to this crowd.
We worked hard; the Boss didn't deserve us."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Towns are carpet-bombed. Planes overhead
Aim to cause devastation widespread.
Though I've not heard a boom,
Did a bomb hit Rick's room?
The floor's buried, with no space to tread.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
East Anglia fell to the Danes
And her king suffered martyrdom's pains;
Though historians ravel
Our holiday travel
To Bury St Edmunds remains.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Why's a tablecloth piled on your head?
That's an odd sort of head cover, Fred."
"I've good cause  to defend
It; that chaperon, friend,
Holds my spaniel. She's made it her bed."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
On a railroad, it's well understood,
Double-heading's a practice that's good
When a train's extra long,
Since the trip might go wrong
Using one Little-Engine-that-Could.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Flinderation! Glass litters the floor
Where I smashed poor Aunt Mabel's French door.
I've been searching right hard
For each chip, every shard,
'Cause both Mabel and door are pre-war.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
It's the City of Brotherly Love—
Philadelphia! When push comes to shove,
Ask Rocky Balboa.
He surely won't know a
Metropolis he's prouder of.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
If you pry from a pony a morsel
Of sugar, the horse, then, of course'll
Kick you frontally, Bud,
And you'll land with a thud
On your opposite aspect, the dorsal.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
He poured water and leaves in a crucible —
The leaves, he declared, were infusible.
"Add milk, and you'll see
It's a nice cup of tea!"
When we tasted, that wasn't conclusible.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If a fugitive criminal gent
Should back to his country be sent,
His rapid removal
Will meet with approval.
Extradition achieves this intent.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
It will come as, I think, no surprise
To hear that my friend has square eyes.
His gogglebox stays
Switched on — every day's
Television — till he or it dies.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Engineer? Once I used to be, yes.
The electrical type.  I confess
My designs mostly fizzed;
All my circuitry BZZZZd.
My hair's straight now (was frizzed) — I'm a mess.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I'm a terrible baccarat player,
But I'll play anytime, anywhere.
"One more hand of chemin-
de-fer." Took un bain;
Lost my pants; now I'm totally bare.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
The cane, as I'm sure you must know,
Is the source of most sugar we grow,
Though it's resource-expensive
And labor-intensive.
Beet's the alternative, though.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This dragoman knows how to parse; he
Interprets both Turkish and Farsi.
Yes, his English is good,
But it's well understood
Here in Brooklyn he can't speak Canarsie.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
No, I ain't got no "con-yack", you snobs.
This here gin mill's for workin'-class slobs.
Lemme get to the point:
Get on outta my joint.
And come back when you've done some real jobs.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
So your gums went all puffy and red,
And your molars were pulled from your head?
Grin and bare it; though plastic,
Your smile's still bombastic
With dentures now gleaming instead.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
A sugar from cedar and pine
That scientists find to be fine,
Arabinose plays
A role in their ways
As a medium where cultures may shine.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Rodrigo Diaz de Vivar
Has a story that's slightly bizarre:
Fought both for and 'gainst Moors
In some various wars.
As El Cid, he was known near and far.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A fat cash cow allows you to sell
On and on and keep milking it well.
Human trafficking is
One such high-profit biz,
But its victims experience hell.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
For purposes ideological,
I sought out the deep anagogical
Meaning unseen,
If such we may glean
From a look at the mere cosmological.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
For cushioning carpets, today's
Manufacturers favor the glaze
Of some urethane, mocking
The olden-time bocking:
A coarse woollen drugget or baize.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Destroying a nominee's known
As borking, a practice that's grown.
Opposition attacks
Through political hacks
And the press is how hokum is sown.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I'm aware that I'm on the wrong road,
And I'm speeding—I ought to have slowed,
But I just cannot make
Myself put on the brake:
I'm in cognitive dissonance mode.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The fine fern leaf, beneath, is so much
Like a fuzzy brown mat to the touch;
Almost nothing compares
To those dense felty hairs
Of acrostichoid sori, and such.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
EM forces repel or attract,
And by inverse-square laws interact.
They're proportional to
The charge un times charge deux.
Gee — I think Coulomb's law I've just cracked!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My sweetie has filled the whole room
With a beautiful froth of white bloom,
But a stench fills the air:
He bought Callery pear.
He's anosmic, I have to assume.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Happy birthday! You've just come of age:
Time for play — but a more mature stage.
Now you've turned 21,
You'll have loads of man fun:
You're a big boy, by anyone's gauge.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bulbil's a bulb, only smaller,
A bud on a creeper or crawler—
A deciduous thing
That will blossom to bring
Us a flower when spring is a caller.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
At the tavern, come in—don't be stoic;	
No need for excuses heroic.		
The loud, happy hubbub			
You'll hear in this nightclub
Exhibits high spirits bistroic.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
How'd I lose all my money last year?
Bought a he-cow I wanted to shear.
But my cow don't make wool —
My disprofitable bull
Made my savings account disappear.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Though a cruel man might find it enjoyable
That the barbs of his wit are employable
To stir my black bile,
I'm a man not to rile:
Atrabilious (meaning "annoyable").

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
Kim Le
limerick_list.text:
Antisexual's where I am at
Since my lover and I had a spat.
My affections withholding,
No way am I folding!
It's my way, or sleep with the cat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, loser! That haircut's a joke!"
This had come from a tall glass of Coke.
Caustic soda was not
To be trusted a lot:
It was always a lye when it spoke.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
So you say you've been shunned by the guys
Who you normally drink with? Get wise:
Drink with gals for a spell.
They ignore you? Oh, well.
You can always go drink with the flies.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said the phone voice, "For options, press 1.
Take a seat, since I think there's a ton."
Her convincingness grew:
"If you're wincing, press 2
And say, 'Screw it!'… Press # when you're done."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Abyssinians lived on the Nile,
A people of substance and style.
Where their kingdom was grand
Ethiopians stand—
In a land where survival takes guile.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I know it's not nice to complain,
I find paying my taxes a pain.
My investments were bold
In my youth; now I'm old,
I must deal with the capital gain.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
The embezzler stole money each day
From his workplace  — a boost to his pay.
But he bought a Ferrari
And went on safari.
The dummy! In prison he'll stay.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Heard of Mad Frankie Phelps? What a villain!
He's a consummate expert at killin'.
When he flashes his knife,
Say goodbye to your life
And hello to the hole you'll be fillin'.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The histology student goes, "Why
Does the chromophobe grouping apply?"
So the teacher goes, "Well,
It's a colorless cell,
As it simply refuses to dye."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In our diner, you'll find periodically
That my partner and I sing rhapsodically.
But we sing different tunes
While we're setting out spoons,
So we say we sing countermelodically.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
What are dugouts? One shelters a team
Of ballplayers living their dream,
Or they're holes that are dug
To keep spent soldiers snug,
Or they're boats carved from logs, in a stream.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In the Odyssey, told by a yachtie,
The Cyclops appears a bit snotty:
"In my coffee, I use
Only Ithacan crews
For their mouthfeel, aroma, and body."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
In a limerick, femininization
Causes anapest-busting frustration.
It'd be so much neater
To express "making sweeter
Or softer" as feminization.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For dotard a  synonym, it's
Like old geezer:  a usage that fits.
That old fart is a dotehead.
His empty old-goat head
Has certainly lost all its wits.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Enjoyableness, pleasantly swellish,
Is an affable trait that I relish.
All the time that we spend
With each other, my friend,
Sure is heavenly—not at all hellish.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
If you study this planet's biology
Crossed with broad geographic topology,
Then you're up to your ears
In a specialty. Peers
Call this odd branch of science chorology.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In the stock market I'm a tactician:
"Diversify," that's my position.
I'll give you the scoop:
I will buy a whole group
As a basket, and pay one commission.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Abietic's the acid within
Softwood resins that irritate skin.
Yet my ears are what fear it
When my kid starts to smear it
On the bow of his new violin!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Bacterial soft rot may smell,
And turn plant tissue black; we know well
That a cut or a bruise
Invites putrefied ooze—
Hostile enzymes react on each cell.

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
An aide to the veep leaks a fact.
Online journalists quickly react.
It's a blogasm! Pow!
There's no stopping it now,
Till that flunky's indicted and sacked.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A fertility doctor named Sherm
Got a Madison Avenue firm
To promote and attract
What it was that he lacked—
So he advertised, asking for sperm.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Attached to the plow we've displayed
Is a bull tongue, a very wide blade.
It exhibits its worth
For the tiller of earth
When the crop that he harvests is weighed.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It's just bull, and a trifle absurd,
That the boss of the bossies demurred
When she heard that she now
Is a bossier cow
Since becoming the head of the herd.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
Old sailormen chronicle still
The adventures of Barnacle Bill.
Since his manners were crude,
All the stories are lewd
And they pack a hedonical thrill.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
University bosses, let's splice!
With a UK Committee of Vice-
Chancellors and Principals,
We're bound to convince our pals
In London to treat us all nice.

limerick_list.author: Ross Elliffe
limerick_list.text:
Armageddon: the ultimate fight
When Darkness does battle with Light.
In lightning and thunder,
Old Satan goes under
And Wrong's finally routed by Right.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
With the price of a gallon of gas,
It is finally coming to pass
That Detroit is uneasy.
Long trips leave us queasy—
America's carsick en masse.

limerick_list.author: CherylinNJ
limerick_list.text:
An androgynous person named Pat
Made a lot of folks ask, "What is that?
Is she he or he she
In tan slacks and a tee,
With short hair and a chest semi-flat?"

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
From soft, grey-white cimolite clay
They made pipes in the "Indian" way.
They would fill them with baccy,
Then — this may seem tacky —
They'd smoke them and toss them away.

limerick_list.author: Giri
limerick_list.text:
In my office IT, there's a guy
Who aspired to ascend very high,
But his temper was flighty,
And he dissed someone mighty.
Now he's screwed; his career's end is nigh.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Of no royal was Jane a descendant.
On her looks and her bearing dependent,
She would preen like a queen
In a posh magazine:
Epiphanous, i.e., resplendent.

limerick_list.author: psheil
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An anatomy prof has a jones
For a vertebrate's skeletal zones.
He gets off on the arm,
Which provides him both charm
And a humerus take on its bones.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Doc's response to the scan, instantaneous:
"There's no break, just a bruised-up calcaneus.
Heels can heal very fast;
She won't need a huge cast
Made of plaster—that's needless, extraneous."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The term adenomegaly means
That they're swollen — our glands, sometimes spleens.
A virus or tumor
Will cause this dishumor;
It's not just a matter of genes.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
In a French electrogeny book
I once read: "To a battery, hook
An amphibian's foot.
If it shakes, then you put
The whole leg in a skillet to cook."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Crustiness? Valued in bread,
And when pies are baked right, so it's said.
As your sandwich, I trust,
Has a crisp, crackling crust,
I'll insist you don't eat it in bed.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
This new earthquake-proof building is sound.
If the land starts to shake all around,
Then I know it won't fall.
That's the point, after all.
It withstands unpredictable ground.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For dissolving pyroxylin, Rick's
Got an ether-and-alcohol mix.
It's cosolvents he'll need,
In this case, to succeed—
He's a master of chemical tricks.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The Atlantis's erstwhile space shuttlin'
Has ended forever. Its scuttlin'
Was later than planned
As replacements were canned.
It's too late now to get a rebuttal in.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Once to decorate, one would decore,
Perhaps fix what was seamy before.
Now, it's quite obsolete
(Just the word, not the feat).
It's still done, but now costs a lot more.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
The paper is wrong; I refuse
To believe what I read in the news.
Yeah, it's there—black and white—
But I swear it ain't right;
I would never be driving with booze.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor and DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
It is black over Bill's mother, dear,
And the stack-clouds the mills smother. Drear
Is the wrack, so I will
Wear a mac just until
I get back — oh the hills wuther here.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The alchemist's goal was auriferous,
But his method turned out celluliferous,
So his output (worse luck)
Wasn't gold, but a duck—
From a barnacle—'twas anatiferous.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Can't seem to accomplish detrusion:
Thrust out or thrust down.  A contusion
On a bone in my hip
Means I can't move for zip.
My sex life has reached its conclusion.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
If I want a particular acronym,
I create what is known as a backronym.
Set the acronym first;
Then pick words, nicely nursed,
To create something I'd call a hack-ronym.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
We are stupefied, Gertrude; it shows.
I can not touch my face with your nose.
You're forgetting your name —
Maybe mine is the same?
We are dozzled; my rose, you're a rose.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My case of the clap is so vexin'
I've not been allowed to have sex in
A year; and my doc,
Near the end of his stock,
Is prescribing the drug cephalexin.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Most emmets are English; they oughta
Not never have crossed o'er the water.
The Tamar is there
To keep them back where
They belong 'stead of making me tauter!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Oh, Ludwig van Beethoven, you
Shook up music much more than you knew.
Mozart, Haydn, first-rate —
No one carried their weight
Till Eroica's downbeat crashed through!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
With a ducktail, his image well might
Be a flop in the rain. What a sight!
So he'd fix it with spray
And his quiff would then stay
Nice and stiff for him, all through the night.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
"Your book on Welsh land use has lots
Of mistakes. Look, 'er W'—what's..."
"Erm, an erw is not
An, um, error. It's what
The, er, Welshry called acres or plots."

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The word's dicarboxylic?! We knew
That it means that a compound has two
Carboxylate groups.
Though you jumped through some hoops,
Your charade clues were not coming through!

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
As witnessed by all whom he met,
J.S. Bach was inclined to beget.
He never would shirk
His great organ work—
Thus his wives issued forth with regret.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I apologise: yes, it's a mess.
It's a foul up, I have to confess.
I thought I could bake
A big marble cake:
Shouldn't microwave metal, I guess!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Shredded sails, splintered masts, timbers charred
Are mute witness to damage that's scarred
His proud frigate. He yells,
"One more broadside! If hell's
What they want, point-blank, lads! Hit 'em hard!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Ever wonder how bone may be grown?
Ectostosis (the process) has shown
That we get bone formation,
Called ossification,
Beneath the dense membranous zone.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When others in wartime were stricken,
You came through and were given the Dickin.
It's a medal that shows
You can deal with life's blows
And survive—not too bad for a chicken!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Cleveland Amory managed affairs
By assuming curmudgeonly airs.
While he published dim views
Of the arts and the news,
He'd an animal advocate's cares.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Ammizabad: son of the guy
On whom David had learned to rely:
Benaiah, the chief
Of the troops whose belief
In their God was their strongest ally.

limerick_list.author: Cat
limerick_list.text:
In an afghan you'll oft find a hippie,
Who'll wear one whenever it's nippy.
It's a huge furry coat
That can smell like a goat,
But I want one—or am I just dippy?

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
To expediate means to make haste,
To lay each obstruction to waste,
To affirm wheels are greased,
To get hold-ups released,
To ensure as the winner you're placed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You know nothing of sex, evidently,
And so, Bentley, you're gone, consequently.
You're too rough when in bed.
Get this into your head:
You have got to treat women more gently.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I wanted to email my teacher
But had no computer to reach 'er.
Though it may not be smart
Or state-of-the-art,
By dumb luck my old phone has this feature.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Same birthday? We're thus coetaneous.
Our existences? They're contemporaneous,
But I'd like you to know
That I'm happy to go
Through my life on my own—you're extraneous!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Accounting insolvency means
That your company isn't worth beans.
Biggest failure in town,
You're submerged, goin' down,
Like a fleet of defunct submarines.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I've a twinge in the fauces—that situs.
Could it possibly be diphtheritis?"
"No, the word means 'diphtheria,'
And to those dire bacteria
You're immune, so it's just pharyngitis."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The catalog brimmed with seduction.
"Plastic Surgery IV: Liposuction:
Sucking cash in the guise
Of diminishing thighs
Is the aim of this course of instruction."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Circumambiency clearly is sounding
Like something extremely confounding.
Yet, in actual fact,
It is simply the act
Of encompassing or of surrounding.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To a mermaid from Davy Jones' locker,
This shell's so sublime it might shock her.
With shapes like small bowls,
'Round their edge they've more holes
Than the ear of your average punk rocker.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
James Arness: for two decades his reign
Over Dodge made him TV's John Wayne.
This twenty-year ride
In one role was just tied
By that radio doc, Frasier Crane.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Serpentopia has, all around,
Slithery kings who, when stretched on the ground,
Measure one third a yard.
Though those bigger are barred,
Foot-long rulers are common, I've found.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said the hooker, "Men typically spend
More than 200 bucks on me, friend."
When he offered a dollar,
It caused her to holler,
"Cheap bastard! Do not buck the trend!"

limerick_list.author: therese flanagan
limerick_list.text:
When your thoughts can be told in a tale,
Your ideas are mouthed without fail,
Words form in your head,
And your sayings are said —
You're on an articulable trail.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
An artifact poses a threat
To internal validity. Let
The researcher beware
And take care not to err.
A control group's a much better bet.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Is crocose when two or a few crows,
Cause ruckus?" crowed Ronald. "So, who knows?"
That is just hocus-pocus.
You're naff, Ron. Please focus!
It's saffron (from crocus) based glucose.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In music, my offspring's well-versed,
And this symphony isn't his first.
What my son wrote before
All the critics abhor.
Now they're saying: "This piece is his worst!"

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The army will close-clip my head,
And the loss of my dreadlocks I dread.
Once those knots hit the floor
And I'm hairy no more,
I'll have lost not just locks, but my cred.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Common chord has but one definition
In music's harmonious tradition.
It means "triad": that's three
Tones together. They'll be
The root, third, and fifth in position.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Since the day you departed the scene,
I've been brainsick (diseased in the bean).
I'm demented and mad.
Any sense that I had
In my head's been completely wiped clean.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've developed a diverticuloma,
Says my doc. It arose in the stroma
Of my colon's rear wall.
Although now it is small,
Could it grow and become carcinoma?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The chorus was meant to be choralizing,
But altos and tenors were quarrelizing.
Sopranos and basses
Abandoned their places…
The soloists found it demoralizing.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Laura always wants more.  So she craves
What others have got, and behaves
Like a covetous witch.
That envying bitch
Steals the flowers from relative's graves!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On Thursday my dachshund will play,
While it's Friday that thrills my Shar-Pei.
My setter likes Sunday.
My malamute? Monday.
Each dog, as they say, has his day.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've heard feckless, but what the hell's feck?
To the wise OED I must trek.
"Bulk" or "steal"— it means both,
And it's what? A minced oath?
Should I feck this odd word? What the heck!

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
A wise old bacterium, thriving
In acid, advised on surviving:
"To endure the sulphuric,
Become aciduric:
Enjoy the pH without striving!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cassiterite's kind of an ore.
It is prized round the world, and what's more,
It's our chief source of tin,
Which lies hidden within—
Are you galvanized, or do I bore?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antibias, a lofty ideal,
Can be hard to apply in the real
World of hiring an actor,
Where looks are a factor
We'd hardly expect to conceal.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With his lovelife in constant eclipse,
Acheilia plagues Ernie Phipps.
For him there's no kissing—
His kissers are missing—
The poor guy was born without lips.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Dirty rice is a dish that I eat:
Chicken liver or sausage or meat,
Onions, peppers, and chopped
Or ground giblets.  I opt
To fill up on this spiced Cajun treat.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
When one adds the familiar "as yet",
Then so far nothing's changed—things are set.
It's like someone postponed
Paying back what was loaned,
Which is often the case with a debt.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Tell me, where the blue blazes is Mel?"
"He decided to rest for a spell,
'Cause he said that it's hotter
Than blazes."  "That rotter!
It's pleasant outside!  What the hell?!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Decempedal means something's discrete;
When you measure it, if you don't cheat,
It is just ten feet long.
Maybe not—if that's wrong—
It's "of decapods, beasts with ten feet."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Freshman Chester, in class, likes to pester.
He's a drollist, a joker, a jester.
But our prof's not amused,
And he's flatly refused
To let Chester complete the semester.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Some funds in the earmark arena
For a bridge that would go to Gravina
(That's "Nowhere") were nixed.
Cash instead got roads fixed;
Some had hoped it would help out Katrina.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
When I talked of the plants that I handle,
My hearers sensed terrible scandal:
Since I said I'd seen broomrape,
They felt bound to assume rape
With a broomstick by some wicked vandal.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The waste that gets piped from my toilet
Comes here, where I have to ensoil it.
This watery mess bit
Is known as a cesspit.
(That idyll you dream — this'll spoil it.)

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
With your heart ripped apart by that boy,
You're as low as can be. I'll employ
All my gifts every day,
In a gradual way,
Till your woe, bit by bit, becomes joy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ms Renée of the Salem Ballet
Is addicted to dance. People say:
"Has anyone seen a
More hooked ballerina?
She's found at the barre every day!"

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
If you heat up some beer, just enough,
It'll give off some steam. When that stuff,
Which is vapour, condenses,
You'll find on your senses
The whisky distilled will be rough.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On a deed this odd phrase may appear.
If you hear it, it sounds really queer.
"With husband" it means.
Whether peasants or queens,
Whether senior or teens, it's et vir.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
My lymph glands are swollen; they're bad.
I'm lethargic, but shaking like mad.
Deer fly fever's to blame;
I've just not been the same
Since I kissed that sick rabbit I had.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Surrealists, like Dalì, revered
The appearance of normal gone weird.
Melting clocks, apple face,
Walking cubes, rose in space!
Floating pipe?  "No, it's not," Magritte jeered.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A slash is a handy device
Meaning "over" (divided by). Nice,
But is "12/10"
Perhaps asinine when
"To the left of" would seem more precise?

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
What a bombshell!  My wife up and left!
Of my conjugal bliss I'm bereft.
But it isn't all bad —
In the closet I had
A blonde bombshell with curves and a cleft.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
His befuddling and flim-flamming schmooze'll
Confusticate most. He'd bamboozle
Old Webster to using
Non-words for confusing —
For instance, confustion and -fusal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A hat worn by Dorothy Hamill
Bore a brooch that was made of enamel,
With a Camelus    on it.
She was given this bonnet
'Cause she looked so damn good in a camel.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
If the CINC had a reason to snub ya
And dispatched U.S. forces to club ya,
They'd obey all he says,
'Cause the 43rd prez
Is the highest ranked leader, George "Dubya".

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
He was once a real fat cat, a pharaoh,
Well-heeled in silk shirt and sombrero.
But boom turned to dust,
Now he's doomed, and he's bust —
Down and out, on the metho, a dero.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Using cut-outs once got out of hand,
So the Postmaster said, "We demand
You don't paste stamps you're cutting
On letters to Nutting.
Attention! This practice is banned."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antibrachial region implies
Not your hips, nor your legs, nor your thighs.
If you look down at your arm
And notice the forearm,
You've taken it in with your eyes.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"This new amp," said our head honcho, Minnie,
"Makes sounds that are piercing and tinny.
What our band has produced
Needs a lot more bass boost.
Our lead engineer is a ninny!"

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
The revenge I am plotting on Steven
Is emotionless; I don't believe in
A rage-fueled attempt.
Thus of wrath it's exempt,
For I never get mad, I get even.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"There it sat in a tropical bog,
Croaking songs of romance on a log—
The rarest amphibian
In the whole damned Caribbean,"
Wrote Bob in his blog of a frog.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We had only a couple days there,
And to tour all of London's a bear.
On advice, we tried flightseeing:
The same thing as sightseeing
Except you see sights from the air.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Their marriage, she learned, involved force.
Shattered dreams! He's as prickly as gorse.
Though he acts like a brute,
She can't leave, so stays mute:
He would fight, tooth and nail, a divorce.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
God help them.  Go pour me a scotch.
Something bad's gonna happen.  They'll botch
This big game, which they lead.
They've been cursed since, indeed,
JFK was alive.  Just you watch.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Scree running takes courage and guts.
When a friend and I slipped on our butts
We began to descend.
Then I said, "Mate, our end
Will be death from a thou(ow!)sand cuts".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My neighbor just loved kiddie porn.
He would watch it from midnight to morn.
Though surprised when arrested
He didn't protest it,
But wished that he'd never been born.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
In each beam of the new bridge at Hendon
We're installing a strong cable tendon;
There's no doubt it is best
To use concrete pre-stressed
For constructions we need to depend on.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Use your ice axe to chop out a chunk
Of the glacier's blue ice to be drunk.
And then melt it. It's old
And delightfully cold,
And purer than aquifer junk.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Karl Marx was convinced persecution
Would end with a world revolution.
His communist notions
Stirred other's emotions:
A catalyst, his contribution.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Spinning records did not, as a rule,
Win me nods of approval at school,
But now manning the decks
Earns me oodles of sex,
Because superstar DJs are cool.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand and otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
Declan Patrick MacManus can bellow
To basses, or croon with a cello.
When armed forces aim true
Spike can turn almost blue,
Trust our brutal youth, Elvis Costello.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A cap and a stone form the name
Of a rock which has some claim to fame
By Ilfracombe Harbour
(And not in Ann Arbor).
To miss it is clearly a shame.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stop them sucking your blood? It's no dice:
They hang on for dear life, body lice.
They're nasty, these cooties,
For certain no beauties.
They make you feel lousy — not nice!

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
An electroplate (shortened: EP)
Is an artifact covered (e.g.,
A vase or a kettle)
With a thin coat of metal—
Electrolysis serves as the key.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
There's a theory that cash will down-trickle;
For its value I won't give a nickel —
Conceptually grand
For the few in command,
But the masses below? In a pickle.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq and Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Stack all of the cars in the nation
On high at a single location.
When we measure, oblique,
From horizon to peak,
That's an angle of huge elevation!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A white wine that a French sommelier
Might suggest for before your entrée
With cassis, as a kir,
Or alone, dry and clear,
Is a Burgundy, Aligoté.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I bought epilator cream to take care
Of removing superfluous hair.
Its bottle was blue —
My shampoo's? It was too.
Now I use wigs and glue — my scalp's bare.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Electrology deals with the use
Of a current to stop or reduce
Growth of bothersome hair—
Slide a needle down where
One begins, and then turn on the juice!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An emptor, you're someone who'll shop;
You'll enjoy either purchase or swap.
Though this sale is a tempter,
Think "caveat emptor"—
These knockoffs are shoddy, so stop!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A blame hypocrite, that's what I am,
Since I cuss like I'm somebody's gram!
"Speak your mind!" That's what I'm
Saying all the blame time.
(I say blame to avoid saying damn.)

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Intellectually gifted, that's me.
There's a word for my kind—bel esprit.
I've been witty and glib
Since departing the crib.
(I'm so full of myself, can't you see.)

limerick_list.author: Judah
limerick_list.text:
He's been gone many years, make no doubt,
But his image still lingers about,
In a photograph's limbo,
With one arm akimbo
(The hand on the hip, elbow out).

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
You have lumps on your neck and your head;
They're so painful, you wish you were dead.
This infection exotic
(Actinomycotic)
Is from actinomyces that spread.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An acritan creature deserves
Admiration, though not for its curves,
But for having survived—
Even being long-lived—
With no eyes, with no brains, with no nerves.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A government sometimes may need
To accept or agree or concede
That a Crown corporation
Could profit the nation
In trading, by taking the lead.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My paramour left me; I pined
Till I found me an oak, the "write" kind,
Where I carved, "LORNA MOORE —
WHAT A SLUT AND BORN WHORE!"
There her name and her shame are enshrined.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She could handle the creep on the phone;
Susie's brashness was very well-known.
She was brave, with a sassiness
People called brassiness.
"Scram!" she said. "Leave me alone!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
It's believed that the Genesis Rock
Formed a part of the Moon's ancient stock,
Part anorthite we're told,
Near four billion years old.
If I'm honest, that comes as a shock!

limerick_list.author: splendiferous
limerick_list.text:
The usage of words can dismay,
As their meaning can be rather gray.
You can bone that fresh fish,
Or debone if you wish:
All the bones are removed either way.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
I love Emmenthal — cheese of a dream!
With its lovely smooth texture of cream,
It is tasty in rolls,
And is all full of holes,
So small mice like it too, it would seem!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I'm a do-it-yourselfer, methinks;
I constructed a console for sinks.
But you shouldn't see air
In the joints under there!
It's my crude, crooked carcass that stinks.

limerick_list.author: Dixon Wragg
limerick_list.text:
An elf, so the legends report,
Is pointy-eared, spritely and short.
I know some find them cute.
Please don't think me a brute,
But I'd probably shoot them for sport.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
There's a green at the end of our road.
It's a wide patch of grass (rarely mowed)
That is dotted with trees.
Let the sight of it ease
All the tension that's got your back bowed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Our echidnas will soon be parental
Even though they are both aplacental.
No placentas have they,
Which is odd, I would say.
In most mammals they're quite fundamental.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We're calling for all hands on deck.
With no bailout, this country's a wreck.
So let's get a bill passed:
Pull together, work fast
To keep further collapses in check.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Through the ages, all cultures erect
Tall buildings to show their respect —
Like a citadel, Chartres,
Tour Eiffel (that's high art)!
We are all business now, I suspect.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
There's a time a missed cycle means "frown"
And you hope it's not spread around town.
But when menopause hits
And "the change" gives you fits,
It just means that production's shut down.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Many websites you may have been cruising.
Time to close some you're no longer using:
Hold Control plus one key:
Don't think "close" and press "C" —
No, it's W. Ain't that confusing?

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
An Australian doctor named Hook
Did nothing at all by the book.
No matter how poorly
His patient, he'd surely
Say, "Nah, mate.  You're just a bit crook."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
The dispassionateness showed on his face.
Forty hours per week in this place
With detachment he trudged.
This career he'd misjudged;
Now he felt like a rat in a race.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
In L.A.—winter, spring, fall and summer—
Driving home I just couldn't be glummer.
Which route?  What a stumper!
All's bumper-to-bumper,
And bumper-to-bumper's a bummer.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
If I'm catching your drift, what you're saying
Is, I'm cheap and your patience is fraying,
But allow me my thrift —
Let me cadge us a lift.
(I've a major aversion to paying.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Only every so often, I fear,
I will visit my grandmother dear.
Every day? Oh, hell no.
To Gram's home I will go
Maybe two or three times in a year.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When my windshield was broken, those turds
Down at Allstate imparted these words:
"Sir, you're covered for fire
And weather that's dire
And collision and theft, but not birds."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Roberto the white-skinned albino
Frequents cafe-bars to drink vino.
"One more bottle of red!"
"Eurgghhhh... my head..."
"Waiter! A strong cappuccino!"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Fluffy tails hanging out in the breeze,
Silly tree squirrels favor (duh!) trees.
Marmots, prairie dogs, 'munks —
We like burrows, not trunks.
For some ground squirrels, rocks also please.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight,
Nine, ten, bip, and then twelve would be great!"
So the dozenalist claims.
To base-12 this guy aims
To convert the U.S. (I can't wait!)

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Cystometrograms—useful for those
Who just cannot control urine flows.
You must pump folk up first,
Till they think they might burst,
And they're full when they pee on your toes.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
There once was a friar named Xavier
Who engaged in aberrant behavior.
He was so out of line,
Other monks did decline
To pray for his soul to their Savior.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
'Tis said doctors and nurses help spread
Deadly germs as they go bed to bed.
Antisepsis demands
That by washing their hands,
They'd cut illness—perhaps fewer dead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I like beaches. I'm off on a trip,
And my travel companion, a drip,
Says, "I know you're not prone
To go swimming alone."
Hell, I will, if I must, take a dip.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This year's plantings are rapidly failing:
Many husks are flavescent; they're ailing.
When leafage is yellowing,
It's not merely mellowing.
Our plans for this crop are derailing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In baseball I throw and bat right,
And I drag bunt for singles despite
The insistence of some
(More benighted than dumb)
That I can't. They can go fly a kite!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Dalai Lama's in exile, and yet
There's a lot of unrest in Tibet,
And the government blames him.
It frequently names him
When peace in Tibet is upset.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
If your last architecture design
Made 'em think, "Hey, that fool's drunk on wine!"
Here's a fine prophylaxis:
Just imagine an axis;
Plan with symmetry, based on that line.

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
I knew there was trouble ahead
When I hired the builder's son, Fred.
I exclaimed, "Whoa there, Shaggy,
A house can't be baggy!"
"Oh, that's just the ball room," he said.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
That's Benedick, poor maligned man,
Fighting Beatrice as well as he can
With his clowning and sparring.
They're ceaselessly jarring,
And both have, for marriage, no plan.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Esperanto, a tongue for all nations,
Was invented with great expectations,
But didn't succeed.
Can it be we've no need
For a plan of such high aspirations?

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"I've a pain in my brain," complained Fred.
But his wife, who's a nurse, simply said:
"Inflamed fundus — quite clear.
But don't worry, my dear.
It won't damage your cute empty head."

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Aveton Gifford lies low on the Aune,
Which can sparkle with sunshine at dawn.
There's a road that gets sopping,
And locals go shopping
At a store that 'big' managers scorn.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The fur coat bore a tiny white label:
"Don't use cleansers that might be unstable."
What the hell does that mean?
Should I only dry-clean?
Is it cleansable? Who can clean sable?

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Said the brown-nosing clerk Aloysius:
"Those who snack while they work aren't ambitious.
Just working is my part."
He then made a pie chart,
And noticed it looked quite delicious.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A hundredweight, cwt,
Is one hundred and twelve pounds to me,
But America's weight
Is one hundred pounds, straight;
Just one more thing where we disagree.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Do not suffer from sulfurous grief!
Shredded cabbage can marry corned beef;
Add it last, let it heat
In the steam of the meat
Till it's tender, each vivid-green leaf.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though he'd never shown panic states priorly,
Sy begged urgently, pressingly, direly.
He was calling from jail,
Asking cash for his bail,
Which would eat up my savings entirely.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
The Mandarins wine us and dine us,
Great eating, with only one minus:
Don't add Sichuan red flakes,
Because when the bao breaks,
Chinese mustard will clean out your sinus.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
As groundsman at Wembley, I twitch
When my turf is churned into a ditch
For some mega-band. Naughty,
I mowed "A-440"
To show it's a real concert pitch.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
I could sit here and endlessly prattle
'Bout my Gelbviehs—my prize-winning cattle.
I rustled these cows,
Plus ten goats and two sows,
And I'm hoping that no one will tattle.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Have you any Dutch doofpots for sale?
One would work well for icing my ale."
"Uncle Hans here's dispensable.
Is such business defensible?"
"It's an ash bucket. Hans can exhale."

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
I'm a rather strange farmer, I know,
'Cause I link the plants' stalks as they grow:
Bind the crops in their bed
With a needle and thread;
Next fall I will reap what I sew.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
The Brits can be clever and charming,
Which makes it both sad and alarming
To see them in thrall
To a dead-end, brick-wall,
Ship-of-fools party bent on self-harming.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Here is the question I'm asking —
When I set up to go multi-tasking,
Do I need to take courses
Or boost my resources
To help me at ignorance-masking?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Mighty Casey whiffed twice. "That pitch three
Should be out of the strike zone," thought he,
"So I won't swing my bat."
He struck out, and so that
Called third strike earned for Casey Kc.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
Goldie
limerick_list.text:
How you always harangue and complain
To diminish me, drive me insane!
But your mission is futile —
You're self-diminutal.
I see through your legerdemain.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Having scouted the isle as commanded,
I returned to the dock where we'd landed,
But was startled to find
They had left me behind,
Forsaken, abandoned, and stranded.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Amadelphous is, per Dr. Deming,
Women sewing in bees, deftly hemming,
Or the folk of a tribe.
It can also describe
Lemming loyally following lemming.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
When some bars make martinis, I've heard,
Cocktail shakers aren't used—that's absurd!
For a person enjoys
That nice clattering noise
When a drink's being shaken, not stirred.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We've got fine campus eateries, but
The old dairy bar's closed—funding cut.
I'll miss "omelet supreme"
And their fresh-made ice cream.
Well, there's always the burger joint glut.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Your dockage," I said, "is expensive."
The owner seemed hurt and defensive:
"We're well-lit and patrolled,
All our moorings pre-sold,
And our service is quite comprehensive."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ron requested that Donna undress,
All the better her weight to assess.
Total nonsense this was
And a failure because,
"Flumadiddle!" she cried. "What B.S.!"

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
It's adjectiveless: my new book
Which I wrote on some gobbledygook.
Critics laud it and praise
It in numerous ways
And tell everyone: "Come, take a look."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As Tucsonans, we must beat the heat.
During daytime, we stay off the street.
We wear minimal duds
And drink maximal suds;
To stay cool, to our pools we retreat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
We cruised the corniche in the Bentley.
Far below us, the ocean lapped gently.
He was gorgeously tanned
(And that night, on the sand,
He took more than my hand, incidentally).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I'm incessantly missing my zither,
Guessing whether to seek it, and whither.
So, while weathering withering
Blither, I'm dithering,
Slithering hither and thither.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Creatorship goes to the One
Who made everything under the sun.
He formed with His hands
All the waters and lands,
And the garden where Satan had fun.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the Celticist's knowledge of Manx
(Also Cornish and Welsh), he gives thanks
To the sagas and tales
Of the Bretons and Gaels
Who made war with the Teutons and Franks.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
A dibber makes holes in the ground,
A most useful tool, I have found.
Also known as a dibble,
Of that I won't quibble.
From those holes seeded growth will abound.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Though my holiday looked like a cheapie,
When I booked it, I must have been sleepy.
A budget hotel
Is all very well,
But I do draw the line at a tepee!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Artificial? Such gravity's found
In a plane or a merry-go-round.
With sustained 'celeration
We'll get the sensation
We're falling, by force, to the ground.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Spaniard captured by Interpol mission
In Peru. Spain, preparing petition
That today it will file,
Wants this guy, who is vile,
Back in Spain to stand trial (extradition).

limerick_list.author: Tom Foolery
limerick_list.text:
It's a heck of a garment, the apron.
Whether cut at sharp angles or tap'rin',
It protects the cook's clothes
From what splatters and flows.
Got a wife? It's the best thing to drape 'r in.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a typical cow barn and, sure,
I'll be happy to give you a tour.
All the stalls here are full:
Twenty milkers, one bull.
Pen's outside. Mind your step—that's manure!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Beware the seductive enchanter!
Resist his warm, intimate banter.
Late tonight, some sweet lass
Will succumb to his pass,
Yet next week someone new will supplant her.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Side orders aren't always nutritious;
They're often, however, delicious.
French fries, mashed potatoes,
Baked beans with tomatoes
To entrées remain adscititious.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I demitted my office today;
Told my staff, faced the press, walked away.
Now I've lost all my perks.
Damn those mealy-mouthed jerks!
Why are thieving and lies not OK?

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A drag is a wagon or dray,
Or a horse-driven cart full of hay;
And the drag, I proclaim,
Is the popular game
Of purloining from drags, by the way.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A knight in the king's comitatus
Stopped his horse, and he clutched at his latus.
Then he smiled a big smile
One could see for a mile.
An afflatus? Perhaps; maybe flatus.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The log of, say, x to base b
Has a colog, which math-heads agree
Is the negative of
That log up above.
It's as simple as that, Q.E.D.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Despite being named like a girl, he
Sought fame as a grappler, all burly.
Who'd have thought that small laddie
Would become a Big Daddy?
Don't laugh at his name, though: it's Shirley.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Spreading Islam's your number one quest;
Doing dawah is heavily stressed.
So, your deen: help Earth be a
Safe place for shari'ah.
But infidels sometimes protest.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
Taken drugs? Fallen down? Cracked your wrist?
Had an accident?  Fought when you're pissed?
For emergency care
It will always be there.
If it wasn't, it sure would be missed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"You've a blood-spattered face!" cried the bat
To his pal. "We're not vampires—why's that?"
"Over there. Do you see
A tall steeple?" choked he
In reply, "Well, I didn't and…splat!"

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
"I'll only buy brand-name blue jeans,"
Sniffed a trend-conscious lady in Queens.
"They'll impress all my friends—
Prove my worth to great ends—
With the ends just defying the means."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If the fresh air is calling to you,
And you find that you've nothing to do,
A gazebo gives pleasure
From where, at your leisure,
Your garden's in beautiful view.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Your employer, I hope, will insure ya.
It might cost lots of money to cure ya.
In this cup of your pee,
Too much diastase.  See?
Something's giving you diastasuria.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Two young blondes in a car, my oh my!
Their excitement has reached a new high.
Sign says: DISNEYLAND LEFT.
They are somewhat bereft
As they turn, heading home, with a sigh.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
Counterfeiters were getting ahead
Of the money produced by the Fed.
Now make note at your till,
The new ten-dollar bill
Proudly cites "We the People" in red.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Deposit (direct) is a must!
It's a transfer of funds that I trust.
Automatic, secure,
It can help to ensure
That your bank account never goes bust.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
The dog days of summer are here,
And I'm perfectly Sirius, dear,
When I say that in August,
The days are their doggest,
While I'm catatonic, I fear.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The man's end's undeniably near,
Yet his visage shows calmness, not fear.
He's gone numb, we've no doubt,
For his gut's pushing out,
With his entrails transfixed by a spear.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
This assay and assayer five-liner
Uses try as the former's definer.
What assayers are for?
Well, they analyze ore.
You can ask any old forty-niner.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
I write little poems, for sale.
Four lines of critique — a betrayal?
For every chastushka
I send my babushka,
I spend three more months in the jail.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Early on, was a footloose young singer.
Later, June found him too much the swinger,
But her frowns failed to chasten;
Time a-wastin', he'd hasten
To do just as he pleased—that's the zinger.

limerick_list.author: proof
rusty
limerick_list.text:
Sid the stick insect knew had he been a
Fine lover, more ardent and keener,
He'd have showered his missus
With passionate kisses,
And not just a peck on the gena.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Part-Svengali, part-Bozo on air,
Sonny Bono created the pair.
He drove at the start,
But switched seats on the cart,
Quite content to be riding a Cher.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
If there's one thing a knight wants to be,
It's well armored, not armorless, oui?
With no garb known as mail
To protect parts so frail,
No amour in the night will he see!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The trees blazed; the flames flared and got higher.
His home then ignited, caught fire.
It brought tears to his eyes,
Which is not a surprise;
He'd just found, after months, a cash buyer.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
What's codilla? Well, here are the facts:
It's the coarse tow of hemp, jute, or flax—
Like the fiber in twines
Or the stuffing that lines
Our recliners and comforts our backs.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
Electrostatic describes a technique
That I use on my hair when it's sleek:
Rubber brush, stroking fast,
Adds a charge that'll last—
My new "flyaway freak" is faux chic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I play my old flute with a tootle,
My husband's reactions get brutal.
He threatens a riot,
But I just won't be quiet.
I persist—all his efforts are futile.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
A gal by the first name of Jill
Had an accent as broad as a hill.
"Whatcha mean that me thighs
Are as wide as the skies?"
She's a broad broad who broadly speaks, still.

limerick_list.author: Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
As I passed a gendarme in Évreux
I enquired of him, "Est-ce que tu peux . . . ?"
He replied, "Va te faire—"
So I stopped him right there
And disgustedly bade him adieu.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
When his friends call him backward, Jon sneers:
"I am very advanced in some spheres.
With my jigsaw techniques,
I can do in six weeks
Puzzles clearly marked '2-4 years'."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
His integrity's under a cloud.
One night out with that ostracized crowd
Led to vilification:
He caved to temptation,
And finds himself spurned, disavowed.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm predictable; I always know
What I'll say, what I'll do, where I'll go.
My expectedness chains me;
The tedium pains me.
My life's just a dull status quo.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
His assumptions will prove incorrect;
It's a train wreck continued unchecked.
He'll hear no one's opinions
But his groveling minions',
So, far be it from me to object.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
On a console I set my TV
In a place where it's easy to see,
To watch black-and-white thrillers
With serial killers
And dames trying vainly to flee.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
"If I waste these fish parts from our dinner,"
Said Caius, "that makes me a sinner."
So the guts were fermented,
The air strongly scented —
The garum he made was a winner!

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Were our verses all cloyingly clean,
And bedazzling with shimmering sheen,
We would blind you, so we,
More for you than for me,
Have slipped smudges of smut in-between.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The cartoonist is also the star
In a strip that is mildly bizarre.
It's the story of how
He wrote Beardo and now
The cartoonist is also the star.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
The bare-knuckle champion, Jones,
Has fists like two cobbling stones.
To puddles he renders
The leading contenders
And then picks his teeth with their bones.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Critics hailed a French chef as incredible,
But my dinner? Disaster—inedible!
There was hair in my soupe;
In pommes frites, rodent poop,
And my veau was old goat: unblanquetteable.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
If your wash gets a pitying look
And your kids vote you "world's poorest cook,"
Here's advice anapestic:
In science (domestic)
Take a course, pass a class, read a book.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
For a school project, Sasha Obama
Presented a neat diorama:
Malia and Bo
(Secret Service in tow),
The prez and Michelle (that's her momma).

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Butt-naked means "lacking in clothes",
A practice that's favoured by those
Who like to display
(To others' dismay)
 What most wish they wouldn't expose.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the soil, or a pond, or a lake,
Many ciliates live—no mistake—
They are lively and motile.
It's not anectodotal;
They're genuine, proven, not fake.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This ABM treaty's sophistic.
What it asks for is unrealistic.
I challenge this notion:
If a missile's in motion,
How can it be antiballistic?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Beach Box Brie is a cheese that's high-classed,
Since in Oz they don't do things half-assed.
Rolled in ash, you will find
That it's got a gray rind,
Plus you can't say its name three times fast.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you are an autodidact,
And you wish to make tissue contract,
Try to buy an adstringent—
But success is contingent
On your pharmacist's knowledge and tact.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When you glance at this fish, you've no doubt—
From its throat, blood is sputtering out.
But look closer; it's ruddy,
And not really bloody.
Red markings define cutthroat trout.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mel would hide in the elephant grass,
Where the pachyderms snacked as they'd pass,
But at times he'd emerge
From his place in the verge
With an urge for an African lass.

limerick_list.author: dave newton
limerick_list.text:
Though each of them has but one cell,
A bacterium's growth can be hell.
To inhibit this spreading,
Use chemical bedding:
Bacteriostasis is swell.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
So your partridges hatched out today
And you've herded them all out to play.
You've got birds in a herd?
That's absurd! What's preferred
Is a covey — the right thing to say.

limerick_list.author: C. H. Carpenter
limerick_list.text:
With his financing out of control,
Having mortgaged both body and soul,
Ed turned to the Mob
To bankroll the job.
Their investment's his ace in the hole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Kit isn't dainty or pretty,
But she's never the object of pity.
All who know her admit
This description is fit:
She's hilarious—eminently witty.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I am dating myself when I say
I think Truman as prez was OK.
Plus I think that it's groovy
To take in a movie
Then hope that I go all the way.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Acanthopterygii fishes
Are good in all kinds of fish dishes.
Their fins are quite spiny,
They're ever so briny,
And many are, frankly, delicious.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The pilot was fearful about
Safety problems he noted throughout
His whole plane, but right now
It is airborne somehow,
Its airworthiness highly in doubt.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
In poker and some other places,
You may have been dealt all the aces.
But with no other power,
Your game could go sour —
It's tricky with aces and spaces.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Like a Coke?" smiled the new girl, Fran Dow,
That first lunchtime at PepsiCo. How
Her new co-workers jawed
In shocked horror. "Good Lawd!
Did that girl use the C-word just now?"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Colonialists have ambitions
To settle and farm acquisitions.
The tongue of their motherland,
Set in some other land,
Varies with local conditions.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"I'm afraid," said the plumber, "you're cursed:
And at best just a water pipe burst.
But your neighbours complain
Of the foul-smelling rain,
So prepare for their sue-age, at worst."

limerick_list.author: OxfordVictor
limerick_list.text:
A and B both shot C in the eye,
So I thought they had caused him to die.
But these books say I'm wrong;
It's not "sine qua non".
Neither shot caused his death, they imply.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A cover girl's face may be seen
On the front of a slick magazine
Sold from L.A. to Delhi;
And we saw Rita's belly
In a film with a Kelly called Gene.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Alamogordo there's sand
That is covering most of the land
And a graveyard (Atari)
And Ham's there, but sorry
He's dead (although still in demand).

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Through familiarisation, tough action
Can grow easier, p'raps by a fraction.
You won't harbour false hopes
When you once know the ropes,
As you might in unpractised abstraction.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
She had ailurophobia — that's
An intense fear or hatred of cats.
Her acidic aspersions
On both of my Persians
Caused most of our squabbles and spats.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a gimmick some will misconstrue,
Ted; the parody might not come through.
The most tolerant cat
Isn't ready for that,
Man. The blacking of skin is taboo.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These creatures died out; they're extinct.
Their demise is thought climate change-linked.
What? You saw one last week?
Well, it died—take a peek.
The whole species succumbed while you blinked.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Several scientists, right off the bat,
Saw their theory on valence fall flat:
Take the max and min, then
When subtracted get 10,
But Abegg to differ with that!

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
VP Calvin Coolidge succeeded
Warren Harding (a coffin he needed).
He was dubbed Silent Cal,
And he stopped the cabal
From Ohio, a gang he got weeded.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We mean by the word animality
A beast's or a creature's vitality—
Those natural drives
Making animals' lives
Unrestrained by ingrained rationality.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Charter members declared the formation
Of this long-standing organization.
Though they're now but a part,
They've been in from the start—
They're to thank for this whole operation.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My heart's on my sleeve, I'm afraid;
My emotions are easily swayed.
I'm affectable, so
I don't ever say no—
And I find that I often get played.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Daring Dan, as a great canyoneer,
Shows, when canyon-exploring, no fear.
Down ravines he'll rappel
To clefts tighter than hell.
(So is Dan — it's that pre-hiking beer.)

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Define capsular? Pithy, low-dose,
Curt, compendious, limited, close,
Brief, laconic, or terse—
A more capsular verse
Would have been more concise (less verbose).

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"A few wisps," I said, thinking aloud,
Looking up. "Please don't rain on my crowd."
Jake replied, "Won't deter us
If it's only cirrus;
Smart money says 'sunny-day cloud'."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A canard that's so old that it's hoary:
You'll go blind if you do that's the story.
Instead, you'll agree
That most people can see.
Scorn a statement derived a priori.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
All this fine pickled herring we're sharing
Is evidence, friend, we're uncaring,
So perhaps we should quit;
Every bite leaves a brit
As the orphan of one of those herring.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Blooming shrubs of the genus Dombeya
Have a beauty beyond all compeya.
But you can't find romance
Via African plants,
Thus my aim remains true, Princess Leia.

limerick_list.author: Nick Szymanski
limerick_list.text:
People ask me sometimes, "What's a cwm?"
I'll explain it, there's plenty of room.
Cwm is Welsh for a valley
Where a glacier did sally
Long before global warming did loom.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Cold War history that's certain to harrow:
Mega-weapons escaped the path narrow.
Crashes, mishaps perhaps,
Or overt judgment lapse
Earned the Pentagon code: "Broken Arrow".

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
For young David let praises be sung.
On his skill his land's future was hung.
With a sharp-pointed rock,
He delivered a shock:
Giant slain with a tip of the slung.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
I'm articulative to a fault.
If I'm trying to say "Pass the salt,"
I might ask, "Please propel
That there NaCl
Towards my plate 'til it comes to a halt."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At a Marriott up in Marin,
An ague had guests in a spin
(Runny noses and chills),
But they took a few pills,
And today there's no rheum at the inn.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our teacher is truly a bum —
We must give up our gum, so we're glum.
Her strange wording confused us,
Then later amused us:
"Henceforward you must eschew gum!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
This out-of-date chintz makes me yell;
A new sofa would suit me quite well.
I'd like something unique—
Not too trendy, yet chic,
In a plush aubergine brocatel.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The serum from grandmother's blood
Showed coagula, cloudy as mud.
In the test tube were lumps
Of coagulum—clumps;
And my tears tumbled down in a flood.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
We are seeking a few keen trainees
For a perfume promotion, but please,
Anallergic: no wheezes,
Wet noses or sneezes.
Advancement? Well, no guarantees.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
We will focus on draining the swamp! Um,
I mean dumping those guys with big wampum.
No more billionaire hacks
From big banks, Goldman Sachs!
Mnuchin and Bannon will stomp 'em.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With bronchioles foul and dilated,
Bronchiectasis often is hated.
First you can't catch your breath,
Then you're coughing to death—
So it seems—till the cough has abated.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'll reach in my pocket for money
To buy you a double-shot, honey.
I just backed a winner:
Come back and have dinner.
It's my treat — don't look at me funny.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Robin Hood never knew of PCs —
If he had, we'd see scenes such as these:
Shunning all keys but four
(Since he wouldn't need more),
He'd hit up, down, left, right (arrow keys).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In He climbed up the ladder, the word
After climbed is redundant, I've heard.
Plus, the opposite term
Will cause purists to squirm,
Since the concept is clearly absurd.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
There once was a miner named Ben
Who was not the most gracious of men.
When let into the adit,
He said, "Now I've had it!
You gave me the shaft once again!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Engineers took the time to observe
How a car body's surface might swerve.
Though appearing abstruse,
It was quick to seduce:
They invented the Bézier curve.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Coming back from the vet, "I've been robbed!"
A dalmatian named Gwendolyn sobbed.
"My long tail is now short,
I am sad to report,
A condition the humans call bobbed!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your ethics are old and they're tired.
Call off statutes no longer required!
Let's adopt a new stance—
Maybe: "Give piece a chance."
Tell all vice squads tomorrow they're fired!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Giuliani faced rugged terrain
In the states where he didn't campaign.
Ranking third where he did
Led to dropping his bid.
He will now be supporting McCain.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Of the Druids we don't know a lot;
Bugger-all's about all that we've got.
The Romans had written
They lived in old Britain:
The rest may be true, or may not.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
It's a spa and resort in South Britain
Where ladies can chat while they're knittin'.
But it's also a tub
Where you sit while you scrub,
And where knittin' while sittin' ain't fittin'.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
The playwright collapsed on the floor
When told that her show was a bore.
She called her clichés
"Archetypal displays,"
But the critics had seen it before.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
When I worked in the chalk-plant-cum-brewery, a
Chalk-beer of sorts would accrue via
Juxtaposition.
It caused a condition
Called calcium pee, or calciuria.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The batting cage has a machine,
Pitching balls that I hit at a screen.
But its aim was so bad,
Here's the thought that I had:
Did the batting coach set it on "bean"?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your crops are attacked by a pest,
This insecticide beats all the rest—
And its formula's heaven:
C12 H11
NO2. I find carbaryl's best!

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
VERaLOE is my acronym; check?
There's no room for mistakes, because, heck,
Just three words form my name
(And my mum's were the same).
I'm Veronika á Loënnec.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Two snot-nosed young sophomores from Groton
Had gotten a carton of cotton
(The absorbent type—fluffed).
Scotty's toilet they stuffed.
What did Scott call their plot? Misbegotten!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This bondwoman's certainly fond
Of that bondman and trusts he'll respond.
As the maid and her neighbor
Perform unpaid labor,
They've formed an emotional bond.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
These sad breathless worms were Abranch-
iata: in gills' place, a blank.
How did they evolve?
What a puzzle to solve!
Was this part of God's plan... or a prank?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Thomas Paine had received urgent word
Of the war plans of King George the Third.
This set his press humming:
"The British are coming!"
And a cry for protection was heard.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All the drap'ries are made of brocade—
Heavy silk—what a fortune you paid!
They're a magnet for dust,
So, my dearest, I trust
That you'll go out and find me a maid.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The boards creak, and at first we deduce
That the flooring's installed to be loose.
Thus intruders are thwarted,
Assaults are aborted—
Or perhaps that's a floorer's excuse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I demanded my money emphatically.
The agent replied bureaucratically:
"Don't go postal, my friend.
You'll be paid in the end—
Maybe next year." He smiled enigmatically.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When I'm netting for fish, what I wish for
Is a fish that will make a fine dish for
My mom.  But in my catch,
I find lots of bycatch:
Fish unwished for, that I did not fish for.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Community property rights
Mean that women will lie awake nights
To determine how best,
With one half, to then wrest
All the rest in vexatious court fights.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Unbeknownst to the former town friar,
His love was a former town crier;
But everyone learned
How their shared desire burned
When she screamed "HEAR YE! SET ME ON FIRE!"

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
"So they're closing the casket now. Crud!
She looks peaceful, my sweetheart, my bud.
Through the years, things were tough,
But our vows were enough.
Yes, I loved her endurably." Thud!

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Expect snipverts that aren't proper clipverts,
Like quipverts and other such flipverts,
Each advert well aimed
At your subconscious, famed
As a sucker for blipverts like stripverts.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
Van Gogh's Starry Night is fantastic,
With colors that swirl, orgiastic,
A scene that immerses
The viewer. This verse is
About it, and therefore ekphrastic.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Your aroma, it makes me obey!
I can't help it; I'm headed your way.
It's your chemoattractant —
I'm over-reactant!
No way I can dodge your bouquet.

limerick_list.author: C Wayne R
limerick_list.text:
A thief lives amongst us, you know.
She's with us wherever we go.
Our dearest sweet girl's
More precious than pearls.
She stole both our hearts long ago.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Driving cattle, the cowboy would straddle
