His horse, spending days in the saddle.
Now he aches when he walks;
Bow-leggèd, he talks
To the doc: "What'll help?" "Here, this pad'll."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
"Hey Pops, could I get a Corvette?
And how come you're still with Suzette?"
"We use buggy and horse,
Son, and never divorce.
We're Amish — try not to forget."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It was chilly; I tried to inquire
Of the Pueblo, a group I admire:
Could I use their estufa
To bathe (with a loofah),
Kept warm by the tribe's sacred fire?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
By lightning, the network was struck.
Overloaded, with circuits amok,
All the breakers were blown,
And the relays were thrown.
An electrical blackout. Oh, yuck.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
A convict of manner audacious
Escaped, but a trail alliaceous
Allowed a good hound
To run him to ground
(Eating shallots, he'd been too voracious).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If a woman's official vocation
Is commander in chief of the nation,
Then the Army must do
What she's telling them to.
What a broad overgeneralization!

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A one-legged auditionee
Made a hopeful enquiry to see
If as Tarzan he'd do
("Me need Jane, no need shoe"),
Should he prove he could hop tree to tree.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I have heard bird of Jove means "an eagle,"
A bird that's decidedly regal.
What's called bird of Juno?
A peacock—now you know.
(Does Mercury dog mean "a beagle"?)

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
The cockles are warmed in my heart
And rejoiced at this news you impart:
But heart cockles are what?
It's a mystery, forgot—
Lost in time, beyond scholarship's art.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Keep away from that pub, my young lass!
The foul lager they serve gives you gas.
Their posh cocktail's just gin
With some fruit from a tin,
And real ale's an Ayrton a glass.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
There are times when I cannot deduce
A word's sense, so perhaps I'm obtuse.
It's abstract, as it were,
So I have to refer
To my Webster's for words like abstruse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though my limerick's delightsomely written,
It bombed in the Bronx. "It ain't fittin'—
It's the pits; it ain't pleasin',"
They say for no reason.
Perhaps it will fly in Great Britain.

limerick_list.author: tonygonz
limerick_list.text:
A mythology scholar named Blaire
Held a wonderfully bacchic affair.
Even nymphs and fauns came
To join in on the game.
(They say Pan did ten shots on a dare.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I don't think too much of him, actually.
His scholarship often errs factually;
Yet this contract I signed
(Was I out of my mind?)
Means the clod's my co-author, contractually.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Disagreements were worse than they'd thought.
Though both Mort and his wife were distraught
As they argued discordantly,
Mort commented, mordantly,
That their marriage fared best when they fought.

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
If you hate when you're asked "What's your age?",
There's a way to respond that's the rage.
A biennium's years
Cut in half what one hears;
The result's not as easy to gauge.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
When "Death be not proud..." wrote the poet,
His words didn't stop it nor slow it.
Death proceeded right on
And declared thus to John:
"You are Donne, sir, so kindly just stow it."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Hear the merchandise manager yelling:
"This sales report's less than compelling!
We need specialty shops,
Not the old Mom-and-Pops—
A boutiquey approach to our selling!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It was War of the Worlds on the air,
Cross the country inducing a scare.
It was really a hoax;
Orson Welles liked his jokes.
No, the Martians were not really th

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is true that I hadn't a clue
Why McHugh was lethargic and blue.
He was feverish, too;
My anxiety grew
Till I learned he'd come down with the flu.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The entomopathogen clan
Includes fungi. As part of the plan
Fungus enters an ant,
(Which gets locked on a plant)
Then sprouts out from said ant, if it can.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To a Teuton der Teufel said, "Hey —
Time is up, fool; today is the day!"
But when Faust "Mercy!" cried,
That droll punster replied,
"Tut mir leid, you've the devil to pay!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A switch with a couple of states
(Only two equilibria, mates)
Has been tagged with a label:
It's known as bistable,
Which speaks to just one of its traits.

limerick_list.author: Workshop and Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Mankind's civilizations all fan
Common cultural forms for our clan.
We have fears: "Who are we —
Minds, machines, dreams — all three?
Did some natural law plot this plan?"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'm censing the house with perfume,
Burning joss sticks of myrrh in each room.
Now my wife, an asthmatic,
Is up in the attic.
I'm sensing she'll lower the boom.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
The ejido's the old Aztec way:
Land belongs to its workers, OK?
(So those Mexicans say
Who regret that today
NAFTA capitalism holds sway.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Dropped my adding machine —  I can't trust it.
The "Plus" button jams (it seems busted).
So no one's amazed
That it's acting bedazed
And confused; it appears I nonplussed it.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I find Indian dishes très yum!
And if fried, I'll consume every crumb.
A samosa's a treat,
And especially with meat,
But don't cook it with steam cuz that's dum.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
The pasha is known as my friend.  He
Adores all the presents I send.  He
Says, "Infidel? Maybe,
But gift giving, baby,
Has earned him the title effendi."

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
So your neighbors all call you a loon?
I agree, Granny.  Here, eat this prune.
See, you're raving insane (ya
Might have acromania).
Quit stabbing me, please, with your spoon.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As in college he learned anthropology,
He found he'd a knack for ethnology.
Describing societies,
Their rules and proprieties,
He'd learned to tell fact from mythology.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A computed tomography scanner
Takes pictures in X-ray-like manner.
One gets placed in a tube—
Be he only a rube,
Or a gent or a doc or a tanner.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In The Fam'ly, fam's "hand" or "to handle".
"So does fammy mean 'handy'?" asks Randall.
"Could a conjuror's scam
Be a sly 'sleight of fam'?
And would panfam for 'beg' be a scandal?"

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I manage my children's saved money
(Gifts from Santa, their aunts, Easter Bunny):
A custodial account
That continues to mount—
Till I go on a trip someplace sunny.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He was cornered, he saw with chagrin,
As the enemy swiftly closed in.
Though he looked to each side,
He found nowhere to hide.
He just prayed he'd escape with his skin.

limerick_list.author: joshuacronemeyer
limerick_list.text:
"No, don't!" yelled the captain, aghast,
To a deckhand who acted too fast.
Off the edge fell what looked
Like the anchor unhooked,
But 'twas ancoral ballast he cast.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
It's Black History Month.  Reverend King,
While we lift ev'ry voice and sing, cling
To your dream of equality.
Demonstrate polity,
Tubman; Obama, take wing!

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
limerick_list.text:
An enantiomorphic connection
Resembles a mirror's reflection.
The form of the first
Is the second, reversed.
You've a pair close at hand for inspection.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Barney Google's diminutive size
Stressed his famed "goo-goo-googly eyes."
Though you might think it odd,
Who went missing, by God,
From the strip? Barney Google! (Surprise!)

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
When Herr Hitler took over as head
Of the Reich, he quit painting and said,
"I'm now Chancellor, so,
To my chancellery go,
Tear down pictures; pin maps there instead!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Is Damocles out of his gourd,
Being seated all day 'neath a sword?
Well, he'll never forget:
Every king's under threat—
And he's guaranteed not to be bored.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
Said my scrotum, "It's cold, so I'm stoic—
Contracted, impassive, heroic;
But in air hot and soupy,
I sag and get droopy,
All thanks to my muscle dartoic."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
O edelweiss! Blossom of snow!
May you bloom here forever, and grow.
Like dirndls and strudels,
You symbolise oodles
To Austrians (dears who sing 'Do').

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You asked, "What's an appendage?"  Let's start:
It's a less vital, oft jutting part
Of a creature or plant,
Like a leg on an ant.
Tell you more? Well, of course; I'm that smart.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Oh, I knew it would be a mistake
To add quite so much booze when I bake.
Sherry sponge gets me loaded...
Rum tarts just exploded!
Caked with pie, I am pie-eyed on cake.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
An evader is hard to pin down.
He'll tell lies and crack jokes, play the clown.
He'll be rude and uncouth
While avoiding the truth,
And you're left unfulfilled, with a frown.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
For the music of Bach, take good heed:
In performance, great skills you will need.
You singers and flutes
Must breathe from your boots:
Mighty Bach demands breath-taking speed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Long pockets will always avail
Should you contemplate acts of defrayal,
But alternative charms,
In the shape of short arms,
Make your creditors turn rather pale.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
At life science, call me a whiz.
Asked by Teach what an Eskimo is,
I mulled, "Give me a minuit…
Hah! That's an Inuit!",
Acing that last oral quiz.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At the end of a series of flashes,
Cremation leaves Father in ashes.
The rest of his whole
(Like his rarefied soul)
Is now aerified—totally gaseous.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Boosterism: That's the good word.
Come out west, one and all, ain't you heard?
There is land that needs breaking;
It's yours for the taking!
Miss out on this deal? That's absurd.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Magnolia felt such repulsion
At regular household emulsion
That viewing beige paint
Made her shudder and faint,
And occasionally have a convulsion.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Though I used to hate blacks, Jews and gays,
It was just a regrettable phase.
I'm disprejudiced. Yo!
Every man is my bro!
Love thy neighbour's my favourite phrase.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
Acrotism's a problem to dread,
'Cause you rather resemble the dead.
Your beat's hard to find
In a flaw of this kind,
And your life likely hangs by a thread.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You're getting my goat.  I'm annoyed
By your jokes.  Could you somehow avoid
Making all that I say
Have a meaning risqué?
Do you know who'd be proud?  Sigmund Freud.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Father Jim is becoming obsessional
About dubious doings Congressional;
But he can't say a word
'Cause it's something he heard
In the secrecy of the confessional.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Enrichment need not denote wealth,
But additions, overt or by stealth,
That add something extra
In content or texture
To life, or perceptions, or health.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Adolescence, I think, was my prime—
Hanging out with my partners in crime.
Big Vincenzo and Horst'll
Remember that borstal
(Reform school) in which we did time.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Move closer, dear, will you, because
Your aunt's eyesight is not what it was.
Let me look at those shoes.
Always red ones you choose!
My dear Dorothy, this isn't Oz.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Linus Pauling was pulling his hair;
Mother Nature just doesn't play fair.
In a three-carbon ring,
The banana bond thing
Makes the angles much closer to square.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
A cranky recluse, Ebenezer,
Was anything but a crowd pleaser.
When kids would poke fun,
He'd growl, "Humbug! Now run."
He was sad, just a cankered old geezer.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lying west of Alaska are isles
That stretch outward for hundreds of miles.
Amchitka, the one
Where the A-tests were done,
Was polluted by underground trials.

limerick_list.author: sigg
limerick_list.text:
On the telly, presenter James Burke
Has a show with a bit of a quirk:
Diachronic inventions.
He eagerly mentions
Connections between them that lurk.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An angry, medieval-dressed claimant
Demands from her seamstress repayment.
She's having a snit
Since her cotehardie's fit
Shows too much—it's a form-hugging raiment.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
While the nanny-state's tender caress
Is dispensed by the DHSS,
All the benefits due
Will accrue if you queue,
Which a few might construe as success.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I heard from a friend in Japan
When his biblical studies began:
"I am not libertarian,
But antilapsarian,
Denying that first fall of man."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Applied arts produce items we use,
From teapots to toques to tattoos.
One aesthetically pleasing
Device is for squeezing;
Another's for polishing shoes.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
If inept means one isn't adept,
Then it's logical one would accept
That its prefix was placed
To negate what is graced
Upon those who are skilled: that is ept.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He bobs up like a jack-in-the-box
For the oarsmen who row by the clocks;
And at one with the crew
(Though the cold makes him blue)
He will shout out the beat.  He's the cox.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Dad's sisters are nitro savants—
Of knowledge of bombs, they are fonts.
More amazing, these sisses
Help mohels do brises:
My dynamite, cutting brisance!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Edsels were named for a car.
Like the car, they din't go very far —
Just one hit, but a pearl
Of a song 'bout a girl
With a name that is pretty bizarre.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
"To be quick at addition," said Brad,
"Was the only ambition I had,
So I'd speedily come
To a plausible sum—
Which was wrong, I should hasten to add."

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
My dress-conscious friend (what a toff!)
Wears his hamster-pelt coat—don't you scoff!
Maybe that explains why,
Having tried London's Eye,
He's addicted—I can't get him off!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My kind child psychiatrist: she
Diagnosed me with ADHD,
And then put me on Ritalin.
Then, just a little'un —
Addict, now (methhead). Poor me.

limerick_list.author: Fleur De Lim
limerick_list.text:
He's industrious, toils night and day—
Pulls his weight, gets things done, come what may.
As for pay, there is none;
Does he labor for fun?
Nah—for ants it's all work and no play!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was hit at a moment unguarded,
And with vile accusations bombarded:
"Beast! You cheat, steal, and lie!
We are through!" and so I
Was, like yesterday's garbage, discarded.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
There was a young man from [FILL IN],
Who committed [SOME FAULT OR SOME SIN],
When we get to line 5,
He may be still alive,
But I'd say that his chances are thin.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We're not rich here, but holding our own.
Wish the mayor would leave us alone:
Promised jobs, renovations
Come with loss, confiscations
Once we're labeled an enterprise zone.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Most often, parental unease'll
Disappear like a hen-stealing weasel.
But my parents take sides
When it comes to their rides—
Mom's electric, while Pop goes for diesel.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
In the process of anodization,
Electrolysis-caused passivation
Is a layering trick
Just a few atoms thick.
It's a way to prevent degradation.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
"It's not fair, because we're citrus too!"
Say the envious limes that we grew.
This green fruit feels maligned
By what Webster defined—
Only lemons have citreous hue.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Should the ashlar be perfect or rough?
We judge not between men; it's enough
That the symbol pertains
To each man, as he gains
Through experience—polished but tough.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While I'd like to be suave, as a rule
Around girls I'm completely uncool.
When they're near me I try
To be charming, but I
Come off looking like some sort of fool.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said the swami, "Be happy with less.
What you need shouldn't grow to excess.
Enough is as good
As a feast.  Understood?"
(Who's this loon?  Why'm I here again?)  "Yes!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Dear Robert, my love never stops,
Though it welters through rises and drops.
When I count all the ways
I adore you these days,
I get five. Maybe six. Seven tops.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A player who's not namby-pamby
Is basketball star Marcus Camby.
Both with right hand and left,
He is dextrous—so deft
That he isn't just dextrous; he's ambi-.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
I see things can be lifted by air,
Become airborne and fly—like a hair,
A huge airplane, a leaf.
Knowing I'd come to grief
Trying flying sans wings, I won't dare.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A downhole's a vertical hole,
Whether dug by a human or mole.
It's a shaft through the soil
When you're drilling for oil,
Or you're mining for diamonds or coal.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
"The course will be quite comprehensive,"
Said the teacher. The students looked pensive.
"But don't you get queasy —
The subject is easy.
So, no need to feel apprehensive."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
The new  roof is secure and top notch
As the thatcher inserts one more brotch.
With that strong wooden pin
The last yealm is pegged in.
Rarely seen, this is something to watch.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
British White is a rare breed of cattle.
Snowy-furred and red-eared, 'twas a chattel
Of great worth to the Gael,
For its birth as a male
Could give rise to much bull and more battle.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Let's deglutinate, dear. We must part.
There's no need to be smart as Descartes
To discern our affair
Will bring only despair
If the head's overruled by the heart.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
An item that's commonly seen
As an air fern is really marine:
Sertularia, sea fir,
(No kin to the tree fir),
Is sold dyed (temporarily) green.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
Can't believe what I'm hearing and seeing;
All around me, my neighbors are fleeing!
Local troops are deployed,
And the town's been destroyed
By some horrible alien being.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The tensions had started to soar:
"They got nuclear weapons galore!"
They turned in not one
(Since of course they had none)—
"Being armless", an odd act of war.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
Got a coin where one image prevails
On both sides (thus two heads or two tails,
One reversed)? That's a brockage
And caused by a blockage
When the process of minting coins fails.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Second childishness, then, is the last
Phase of life—and it creeps up so fast!
He will dribble, go blind,
Lose his teeth, lose his mind,
Dimly mourning his glorious past.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We all love our proctologist, Pam—
Her great gams, and her aura of glam.
Tough and masculine guys
Have been heard to breathe sighs
As she digitally does her exam.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We've air-conditioned Guido; he's through,
And no longer a menace to you.
The grotesque little troll's
Head to toe full of holes.
Ventilation was long overdue.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Can Brazil nuts produce a bright glow?
Oh, come on guys, please say it ain't so.
Though their flavor's attractive,
They're radioactive,
More than all other foods that we know.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
A languorous fellow named Phil,
By a doctor was given a pill
Which produced a proclivity
To frenzied activity
In listless folk lacking the will.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
In Jellystone Park, people stare
At the nudists with nothing to wear.
But the naturist scene
Stays composed and serene;
It's no booboo they choose yoga bare.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
In a bunker I hide from my wife—
In this cozy ol' hole there's no strife.
I have food for a year,
Though I know that my dear
Could be mad for the rest of my life.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Dee would chase me all over the place
To attempt an unwanted embrace.
"Dee, stop bothering me,"
I'd plead, "Please let me be!
I need space, do get out of my face!"

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Build Your Own Backyard Church, Chapter 9
Is called "All About Arches' Design" —
"Atop each pilaster,
Carve chaptrels..." Much faster:
Pray out in your garden. Divine.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Farm critters eat hay."  "By the way,"
(Introducing a topic that may
Or may not be related
To what she just stated)
I asked, "wanna roll in the hay?"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
"Look at Venus de Milo," said Margot.
"Arriving in Paris as cargo,
She did not masquerade
As a gun or grenade,
Yet fell foul of a strict arms embargo."

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
Since your liver is shot from Merlot,
And the blood it receives cannot go
Where it should, my poor Lucy,
You've caput medusae
(Collateral shunting of flow).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
On the stage, he spoke rather emphatically,
And postured and gestured dramatically.
While appearing intense,
He was making no sense.
Once again, he was thinking erratically.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
From the harbours of Europe's west coast,
They once sailed full of cargo and post.
Is that craft really there
Or a vision — a crayer
From the past (like the Dutchman, a ghost)?

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Said Adam to God, "Wait. Don't leave.
I'm alone on this world, I perceive.
Do the magic you do —
Take a spare rib or two
And corporify eye-catching Eve."

limerick_list.author: Dick C. Erd
limerick_list.text:
You should visit Ahvaz in Iran.
What a great place to work up a tan!
But despite tons of sand
All nude bathing is banned.
I'll try tanning my hide in Bhutan.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Carbon atoms joined up in a row
Were all wondering why they were so.
Said the first, "We're a chain,
And a chain must remain,
For there's strength found in numbers, you know!"

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman and speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
At the Cromwell in Barnaby Gate,
A pet donkey stole food from my plate.
"Dinner fit for a king!"
I declared—the best thing
That hotelier's ass ever ate.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Church and state? I'm for separatism.
Polysyllables?  Minimalism.
Thus it comes as a blow
That I have to be pro
Disestablishmentarianism.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
While the Britons in Britain drink tea,
Angry Bretons live just 'cross the sea.
The Bretons—both Celtic
And madder-than-heltic—
Want Brittany Frenchless and free.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
There are many carcinogens found
In those cigs that you carry around.
Throw those cancer sticks out,
'Cause they're paving a route
Leading straight to a plot in the ground.

limerick_list.author: neilski
MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My dairy vocation? Frustration —
So I tried a devout education.
I've a brand new D.D.
(A religion degree),
And I'm loving my pastorization.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Baccarat cost me many a franc.
When I'd win, still I'd pay, so I drank:
The cagnotte! It's akin
To a tip off each win,
The house vig—five percent to the bank.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word bases, I'm sure you can tell,
Comes out "BAY-siz" for most personnel
In most cases, but please
Note it's also "BAY-sees"
As the plural of basis as well.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Famous Danes? Well, there's Blixen and Bohr,
Buxtehude and Brahe (that's four),
The Canutes, young and older,
Perhaps Emil Nolde,
And Kierkegaard too. Any more?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is hard to maintain concentration
With agita gripping our nation,
From a terrorist threat
That we just can't forget
(It's a type of advanced aggravation).

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
Take ions of sulfate and mix
Them with barium. You get blanc fixe;
Used in pigment and plastic
And (this is fantastic)
For clear GI tract X-ray pics.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"What's a mountain goat doing up there —
On a cloud bank, so high in thin air?
As I pilot my plane
I just ask once again ..."
("Omigod!" was the pilot's last prayer.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Despite my elite education,
Geography's still a frustration.
So it's Holland that's known
For its dikes, not Gabon?
And all grade-schoolers know that? Damnation!

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
There's declension of breathtaking scope
On the downwardly bending of slope,
And so those who pass firs
On their skis are just blurs,
Who avoid quaking aspens, we hope.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
Rhett bragged of a horse he had vetted:
Betz placed grudging wagers and fretted.
Rhett urged him to go
And bet all of his dough:
Rhett abetted the bets Betz had betted.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Pease
limerick_list.text:
An unfortunate fellow named Jim
Had poor motor control of each limb;
He could barely contrive
Just to walk, much less drive,
So his doc called ataxy for him.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Are these worms biotypic?" asked Lee.
"Are their genotypes known? Can they be
Simply placed side by side?
I will act as your guide,
And say 'yes' if the genomes agree."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If this reference is circular, then
It is self-referential, so when
You proceed where it shows
And you go where it goes,
You'll return here again and again.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Donald Trump is commander-in-chief,
But he's more like commander-in-grief.
He inflames racist rages
And puts kids in cages.
Let's hope he's commander-in-brief.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Blacking makers made blacking. (That's news?)
That's the polish you'd use on your shoes.
If a customer said,
"All my footwear is red.
Still, I bet you can help me," he'd lose.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Did Bezold and Brücke get miffed,
Sharing credit for finding their shift?
Orange brilliance had fled
And these Germans saw red.
And their genius? Accepting the gift.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
In this bell foundry, school bells were cast,
Long ago, but it foundered at last,
Its finances unsound,
And it could not rebound,
Since its church bells were simply outclassed.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I've a headache; I wish I were dead.
"Let's examine your brain," the doc said,
"Through a hole." At this juncture
Such craniopuncture
I need like a hole in the head.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My siblings are bothersome boys
Who enjoy rearranging my toys.
I'm a female, you see,
Who wants someone like me,
And my sislessness simply annoys.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our new electrician's inspiring.
Trish's spirit and pluck I'm admiring.
She just entered the crawlspace
(That small and not tall space)
To fix what is wrong with my wiring.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Caught and bowled (or, for short, c & b),
Once again, was the downfall of me.
A full ball that I parried,
To the bowler it carried,
And he pouched it with ease and great glee.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
There once was a woman so busty
That when she ate bread that was crusty,
The crumbs piled up
On each triple-D cup,
And her tabletop never got dusty.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
As kids we had oodles of fun.
We'd be cops catching crooks on the run.
Every boy had a blast
In those days that are past,
Shooting caps from his fifty-round gun.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I had peed in the sorbet that he licked;
He found out; so he sued me in delict,
Seeking civil redress.
Shouldn't tell him, I guess,
What I'd done to the ice cream that she licked...

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Daniel Bakeman outlasted his peers
So for that we should give him three cheers.
The Revolutionary War
Is what Dan's noted for,
Though his pension just lasted two years.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Anodonta  are missing dentition.
This condition's just one more omission
As they try to get by
Absent ear, mouth or eye.
They're lucky they're lacking cognition!

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
An anteroom can be a bore
While you wait to go through the next door.
When you visit your lawyer
And sit in the foyer,
You're stuck on the opposite shore.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Removing the box from the van
Didn't go quite according to plan.
A falling packed crate
Gave the guy a cracked pate.
What a painful delivery, man!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When federal law intervenes
To save lives, we will use any means.
The once-threatened condor
Flies freely out yonder.
Let's now try to save New Orleans.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Though your diet success you may vaunt,
You have lost too much weight; you look gaunt.
To this red-blooded male your
New look is a failure.
Extreme thinness is nothing to flaunt.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
You were born years ago on this day,
With some parts you don't often display.
 So I bought a machine
 That can help keep them clean,
And it's all for you — Happy Bidet!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Things to do to help winter nights pass:
Knitting mittens falls into this class,
As does drinking hot broth,
Or embroidering a cloth,
While imbibing mulled wine by the glass.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A fly-cove's suspicious and sly.
Past him nothing and no-one gets by.
He sniffs every whiff,
And it's almost as if
In the back of his head there's an eye.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Do you have to employ condottieri?
These soldiers of fortune are scary!
They're hairy as apes,
And they wear, neath their capes,
Hidden weapons—you'd better be wary!

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
These allegements you've brought to this trial
For burglary meet with denial.
But the thief had the gall
To sneak in a call
And his prints grace your telephone dial.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
An Aryan ought to be blond —
The kind of which Hitler was fond.
But in fact it's Iran
Where this race first began,
So the pale they are long since beyond.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This tailored grey suit that you wear,
With its classical cut, like your hair,
Makes me think, at a guess,
You're conservative. Yes?
Or, if I may say so, a square!

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"Come with me—in the sea we'll be free!"
Panted beautiful call girl Marie;
But he found, to his cost,
That the moment was lost:
The voluptuous 'she' was a he.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Back when he was the Prez, Jimmy Carter
Called his brother Bill over to barter.
"I'll trade you a beer
If you steer clear of here."
Billy jumped at the chance (Jimmy's smarter).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A blue stellar object behaves
Rather oddly: no radio waves
Get emitted—which means
That recordings of Queen's
Won't be playing tonight at the raves.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Latin classes, in school, I just hated,
Wherein my old teacher related:
"The phrase Veni, Vidi,
Together with Vici
Is, spoken by you, overstated!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
It takes fuel to coat iron with zinc,
Fire clay, or make plastic.  We think
That a "green" graphite basin
Should take pride of place in
Our bathroom: our own carbon sink.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To demobilize, troops must disband.
No more milit'ry action is planned.
We have orders—no jive—it
Means every last private
And sarge and lieutenant is canned.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When Chaucer was writing, 'fore God,
A stone or a cullion (not cod)
Was a testicle. All
Now have come down to ball,
Cut from ballocks, which hang near one's rod.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
Laying eggs inside holes in the wood —
It's something I'd do if I could.
But alas, I'm still me,
And no carpenter bee,
So I don't think I'd bee very good.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Said the chem prof, "When working with lye,
Wear your gloves, in case things go awry."
"Why didn't you tell me
Before it befell me!"
Tom caustically said in reply.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My uncle claims powers fatidical,
And swears that their source is Druidical,
As in college he dwelt
With a genuine Celt.
My opinion? His claims are falsidical.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Helminthologists surely confirm
That an acanthocephalan worm,
Though remarkably tiny
(With proboscis that's spiny),
Can cause your intestine to squirm.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a witch, clearly Mabel's unstable.
She declares, "In my home I am able
To use grave wax to shine
Any oak, ash, or pine.
It works great on my dining room table!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Eatin' baccy, tomatoes, and bolls
(Those of cotton) are three of the roles
That the corn earworm fills
Till it pupates, which stills
All the thrills of its ravenous strolls.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If with demons you'd try to attune,
Take a Bible, and do it at noon.
What you might conjure up
Could be harmful: "Who'd sup
With the Devil should use a long spoon."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A deficiency judgment will seize
What the sale of your goods doesn't squeeze;
So it isn't enough
When finances get rough
To just walk off and leave them the keys.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"I'm invisible now; see ya later,"
Said the cheeselip (a sowbug or slater)
As it rolled in a ball.
In the North, what we call
Cheeselip's rennet, the big cheese creator.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
At the burial service for Fred,
He was present, but, being stone dead,
His widow's elation
And wild celebration
Went totally over his head.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Glenn Miller!  He got in the mood
To come closer, in music: Imbued
With close-harmony's sound,
Those sweet saxes abound
In romance, by a jazz line construed.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
The city of Canton's a joke,
With a stench that's so foul you could choke.
Folks there say, to be funny,
"It smells just like money."
If that's true, I would rather be broke!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Are your mood swings severe and aggressive?
This drug can relieve your excessive
Depressive and manic-
Type symptoms. Don't panic,
As Depakote's very impressive.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Fry some onions and spuds to a hash,
Then add cabbage and give it a bash.
As a child, every week,
I loved bubble and squeak,
Though its posh name is Colcannon mash.

limerick_list.author: Lostock Hall
limerick_list.text:
That Tower in Paris is gallic
And quite unashamedly phallic.
But the Pisan confection,
That tilting erection,
Is, aptly enough, pure Italic.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Out of gas, now in neutral, I'll coast
Down this hill — a bit uphill at most.
I'd be thrilled if I might
Reach that station in sight,
But my napping wife's rousing — I'm toast.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Sighed experient actress, Ms Dawes,
"My performance, at times, has its flaws.
Still, a quick 'Break a leg'
Helps me up it a peg.
How I relish the cheers and applause!"

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
On the night before Christmas, I brooded
As sweat from my forehead exuded.
My heart felt like lead,
Since my husband had said,
"The batteries? None are included."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As primitive peoples all know,
Nothing grows from the seeds that you sow,
'Til you mix in the blood
Of your god with the mud:
Springtime deicide makes it all grow.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Clearly earth leads are put there to earth
Any dangerous currents. Their worth
Is in helping a flow
Of such currents. You know
There should be, of their number, no dearth.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Since some microbes have found an oasis
In my bowel, I've made that the basis
For swearing on oath
To inhibit their growth;
What I pledge is bacteriostasis.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A terrorist born in Bahrain,
On the Gulf, hoped for virgins in vain.
Seems the bomb he had hidden
Exploded unbidden.
He lives, but few organs remain.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Colonitis? I've got it, alas,
And my buddies berate me en masse.
In the chatrooms they post
That I'm self-diagnosed
Since my head's firmly stuck up my ass.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Epexegesis is what I would do
By adding some words — one or two —
To make clear what I mean,
So more content you'd glean
From this poem, dear Jean.
Help its meaning be seen;
So I did. And this all just for you.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Helsinki they don't seem to care
That the planes are in need of repair.
On the typical night,
You'll see more than one flight
Disappearing right into Finnair.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Its wiggly bright fronds standing straight,
The anglerfish, sly, lies in wait.
This method enables
A turning of tables:
A fish using worms as its bait.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
José got a can on, he swore.
Juliet's got a cob on. She's sore.
Drunk, and angry, they mean,
Though I never have seen
Either one of these phrases before.

limerick_list.author: D Frayer
limerick_list.text:
Good king Abgar was leprous (or gouty),
But had faith, so a note he sent out. He
Addressed it to Jesus
And said, "It would please us
To host you. Come heal us. Be doughty!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My buddies report you insist
That I'm one of the girls you have kissed.
That's a lie—a false claim—
So abolish my shame
By expunging my name from your list.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
The ball was defended by Cole
And over the goal-line did roll.
The cross to be borne: a
Quick kick from the corner —
A header, a strike, it's a goal!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In Ibsen, my friend is a dabbler,
But she's also a snoop and a babbler.
I remember the day
When we went to a play
And she gossiped throughout Hedda Gabler.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A lady of County Fermanagh
Ascended her stairs in a Stannah.
As it rose, how it squeaked,
Rattled, wobbled and creaked!
So she tightened it up with a spanna.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The antimonopolist fell
To Adele's irresistible spell,
Under which he agreed
To abandon his creed—
Now he works for the OPEC cartel.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
When a bad guy commits an offense,
Then this biblical dictate makes sense.
You sustain an attack
And he gets it right back —
Like, an eye for an eye — same expense.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Working jobs in two cities, Jake thrives
With two cars and two homes and two wives.
Is dividing his time
Between both such a crime?
Neither knows that he leads double lives.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In the snapdragon bloom there abides
A fierce creature; you pinch on the sides
And two lips move apart.
No, it isn't black art
This bilabiate blossom provides.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
The police placed him under arrest.
At the scene of the crime he professed
Some close ties to the judge;
But the cops wouldn't budge.
His aligning was suspect at best.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
If your bank offers giro, you might
Make a transfer of funds that goes right
To another account,
In whatever amount,
With no check that you needed to write.

limerick_list.author: Randy Lee and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Could the guy who received no applause be
That funnyman legend Bill Cosby?
Even he was a bust
Among blacks—losing trust
When he dared to point out what their flaws be.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His TV set habitually blared,
As my neighbor was hearing-impaired,
But he claimed this contraption 'd
Make programs closed-captioned,
With titles for shows that were aired.

limerick_list.author: Jac
limerick_list.text:
When you get to the end of the week
And the leftovers look pretty bleak,
Fry cabbage and meat,
And potatoes — how neat!
The Brits call it bubble and squeak.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Life's a bitch and a battle for some;
You work and you slave for a crumb.
The American Dream—
Not just peaches and cream.
Keep on truckin' or wind up a bum.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Those beliefs you hold deeply, sincerely —
So profoundly — you'll pay for now dearly.
Since your faith in your gods
Versus mine is at odds,
I must punish you, darling, severely.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Both the tribe-prince of Judah and spy,
Dogged Caleb would never say "die."
While the other ten jeered,
He and Joshua cheered,
"We can certainly win if we try!"

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
The word ace, for a pilot, conveys
He's made forty-two kills on soirées.
Wait: soirées? I meant sorties;
And not in the forties,
But five. Oy, it's one of those days.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My new key system's cheap, I confess,
Since I don't have a ritzy address.
Electronic? Well, yes.
It's sufficient, I guess,
And it's better than no EKS.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Getting on toward the end of the day,
Almost midnight, the clock ticked away.
"Cinderella, I'm not,
And I like him a lot,"
Terri thought.  She decided to stay.

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
The Boston Tea Party's a spree
Brought about by a boycott of tea.
Sons of Liberty chose
As disguise, Mohawk clothes,
And these "Injuns" tossed crates in the sea.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
My cooking was quite the fiasco,
A failure, and so said Chef Vasco:
"The sauce in this pot
Is outrageously hot—
Too much pepper, yes, too much Tabasco!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
With extreme peaks of volume resounding
From a sound system endlessly pounding,
Its hearers won't panic
If headroom (dynamic)
Improves its full output. Astounding!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Oxidation by water and air
Can lay waste to your nice wooden chair.
So, one day it may pass
That you land on your ass,
Thanks to eremacausis. Beware.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
They hid; they were lying in wait
For the moment I stepped through the gate.
Then the ambush began,
And each eager young fan
Started asking me out on a date.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
The fount Aganippe saw birth
When great Pegasus stamped in the earth.
'Twas a nymphly abode
Whose bright waters bestowed
Inspiration 'gainst poetry's dearth.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
The government gravely admits
That delinquency (seen in young Brits)
Can be set at the door
Of their broken homes. War
Didn't have that effect in the Blitz.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Rob was late every day and he slacked
At his job—then stole food, and was sacked.
So to settle the score,
He set fire to the store:
What a dastardly way to react!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My girlfriend is somewhat a sleaze.
"Call me 'Bambi'!" (Her name is Louise.)
"Why that nickname?" "I'm deer!"
"Get the hell out of here!
You're so deer that you spread Lyme disease."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"So you're out on the lake, in the barge,
With a corpse and a knife," says the sarge.
"Never meant him to die,"
Says the kid. "Honest, I
Can explain, if you'll let me enlarge."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
See the bridegroom ride up on a horse
And abscond with his sweetheart. The source
Of this wrongheaded mission?
The bridelope tradition.
It's probably grounds for divorce.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Both on plains and on hills, sheer and steep,
Genus Capra is found — quite like sheep.
With straight hair, horns curled back,
Be they brown, white or black,
All these goats close their eyes when they sleep.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Alkoran, though an English word, can
Be derived from the words Al Quran,
Which is Arabic.  You
Use Koran—that's fine too—
If you need a two-syllable scan.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
The mouse and the elephant knew
That theirs was a doomed amour fou.
Oh, they wanted like mad
To be mutually had,
But such disparateness! What can you do?

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
"Try some samples! Chinese food galore!
Have an egg roll, my friend — take some more!
Now just dip it in duck sauce."
"Is it yummy- or yuck-sauce?"
(Takes a bite) "This is great — I'll take four!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Ah, the look on the archbishop's face
When he'd taken possession! "Your Grace,
I did not leave this seat
'Til the deeds were complete,
But they're done: you've an asset in place."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
"You thinking what I'm thinking, lovey?"
"I'm thinking I'd love to, my dovey,
Except that I'm freezing!
Before we start squeezing,
Replenish the stove with some Bovey!"

limerick_list.author: Pie Snelson
limerick_list.text:
When critiquing your trip from this town,
Roger Ebert, please smile and don't frown.
Tell us, how long's the stint?
If you can, send a hint:
Is the next life thumbs-up or thumbs-down?

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
In the lower house, Government yammer'll
Move their bills; in the upper house, clamour'll
Vote them down, change them round
Or enact them as found.
That's the beauty of systems bicameral.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Have a car and my clothes without fail
Outside of this old county jail.
It has only one fence,
 Which does not make much sense,
So tomorrow I'll scale it and bail.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
For a ham, it's a joyful occasion
When his beam-path submits to persuasion
By electrons unbound,
Whose refraction is found
With the Appleton-Hartree equation.

limerick_list.author: wikisaur
limerick_list.text:
It's aberrant regeneration
When nerves on the fritz get fixation.
Without some correction
They'll spread like infection.
With eye nerves! Well, any location.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
An eye-box is not to store eyes —
It's a space. So a shooter who's wise
Learns to better her aim
At a bull's-eye or game
By increasing her eye-box's size.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The Liberal Democrat won,
But of cabinet posts, there were none.
With his nose out of joint,
He belaboured the point—
To be Labour, perhaps, would be fun.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
By two yarns, each of different kind,
Known as S- and Z-twist, intertwined,
Thus the crinkly shape
And the sheer fluid drape
Of well loved crêpe Georgette, is defined.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Dear, you married for better or worse:
For the good times, and yes, the reverse.
All commands that I say,
You must quickly obey!
Take as gospel — I'm blessing and curse.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
They've given me only one stanza
To do what I like with bonanza.
It's a windfall, a boon . . .
Do my words make you swoon?
I'm not waiting around for an anza.

limerick_list.author: C Wayne R
limerick_list.text:
He's a purist, least that's what he said,
Then he sold out for airplay instead.
Now his music's all pop;
It's on stations non-stop.
Won't you please rip his songs from my head!

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
The addressograph's now obsolete.
We have digitized labels (how neat!)
That come from a printer
In summer and winter;
Old technology cannot compete.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Please don't tell me I'm Omar Khayyam,
And don't holler at me to stay calm.
To call me a Persian
Brings on disconcertion.
And how do I know you're my mom?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A barefisted fight is the kind
Leaving knuckles and hands in a bind.
At the finish they're bruised,
Black-and-blue, and contused,
So the prizefighter's check can't be signed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
If exhaust valves and piston crowns too
Need the carbon removed from them, you
Should decarburise now
As above and then – Wow!
Your car's engine's vroom-vroom you'll renew!

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee
limerick_list.text:
When the cold has her feeling forlorn,
She has dreams of green beans and sweet corn.
In the spring, she'll plant seeds
And she'll pull out the weeds;
She envisions her garden reborn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Formosan—this word may not please
Those who favor the term Taiwanese,
But the folk on this island,
Both lowland and highland,
Are the ones with the most expertise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I knew what the leaders had meant
When I stood and I voiced my dissent:
"I object, disagree!
That was wrong; all can see!"
Then directly to prison I went.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
This fine eighteenth-century chair
Has a bell seat, and you may compare
Its seat (shaped like a bell)
To the others we sell,
But you'll note it is not a bergère.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A pheromone yields a reaction
Causing intraspecific attraction.
When one species entrances
Another, the chance is
An allomone's part of the action.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Beecher Stowe's anti-slavery novel
Showed slaves as they lived, in a hovel.
Uncle Tom, the head slave,
Urged the rest to behave:
"In the presence of Massa, you grovel."

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
Unforeseen, in a meeting, a blow
Caught me blindsided. Now I feel low.
Though I thought I'd succeeded,
It seems I'm not needed —
Redundant. I'm being let go.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
The director said, "Do you concur
With my choice to add sounds here, monsieur?"
"After hearing the track
Of effects playing back,
I must foley agree with you, sir!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When a girl sighs and swoons, it seems quaint.
We assume we have witnessed a faint
And approach at our leisure.
We doubt it's a seizure,
And we're sure cataplectic it ain't!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Horror movies are sure to offend
If they're not what producers pretend,
So your hair remains staid,
And decumbently laid —
Not the way that you'd paid for: on end.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Oscar Wilde's famous quips never fail
To amuse, like his plays: each a tale
To delight. Marked his end
With the ballad he penned
In his cell, about Reading's town gaol.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Diarthrodial joints, like the knee
Move around to a useful degree,
And with elegant motion.
I observe with devotion
That to bend and extend they are free.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We two in the nude are a sight.
Do us both a big favor, alright?
With this issue addressed,
We can lay it to rest.
Be a doll and go turn off the light.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Alocasias are grown by my aunts,
And with one of those tropical plants
Sporting leaves like a heart,
They'd reluctantly part
If you sent them a modest advance.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The poet describes his excursion
To woo a fair maid.  In his version,
Devotion grows wings—
Like a nightingale, sings.
It's a bulbul? The poet is Persian!

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
There once was a whaler named Bob
Who suddenly started to sob.
Said the blubbering fool,
Throwing down his sharp tool,
"I'm just not cut out for this job!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I encourage her, urge her, implore her
To love me; I swear I adore her.
When I say so, a chick'll
Reply that I'm fickle,
And giggle, like dozens before her.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Near  the paths of my woodland demesne,
Down its hollows, grow ladders of green.
And on each pinnate leaf
In a patterned motif
The chain-like spore cases are seen.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Lord Byron, the poet of old,
Came down like a wolf on the fold.
So many were chaste;
Lady Lamb fit his taste,
But Caro was hardest to hold.

limerick_list.author: Bill Dorner
limerick_list.text:
The Aussies on Facebook are sad,
Having lost the best goat that they've had.
"Liked" by millions of blokes
For his bleating good jokes,
But for me, they were only "Not baaad."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Whatever the time on the clocklet,
It's always the right time for chocolate.
I'm squirmin' to savor
That cocoa-y flavor.
Deprive me?  Prepare for a squawklet!

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
When the pollen count's high in the breeze,
And you know that you'll soon start to sneeze,
Lose that droop in your mug!
Give your druggist a hug,
And say, "Give me acrivastine, please!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ooooo, those Vikings! I just have to say
Direptitious describes them today!
I could feel my blood boil
As they'd plunder, despoil,
And then snatch all our chickens away!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You asked a tough question — oh brother!
The answer is something or other.
Was I called out of town
The night London burned down?
Let me see — I — uh — ask me another.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
I'm rapidly nearing senility,
Thus losing accountability.
To account for my time
My response is this rhyme,
Which just adds to my sense of futility.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This geometry textbook provides
A solution that helpfully guides
As I take my exam.
"What's a chiliagon?" "Ma'am,
It's a figure with one thousand sides."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Of some spiders we needn't be wary,
While others are ugly and hairy.
Beware if you find
The citigrade kind;
They're the wolf and tarantula—scary!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
No one peeks at my cheeks, I will vouch;
When she grabs at my abs, I say, "Ouch!"
Bodybuilding's no art
To my taste, with my heart
(As I munch on some chips on the couch).

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
What a hellhole next door at that spread!
It's those three barking dogs that I dread.
Uh-oh, now I can see
It's just one dog, not three.
If it's Cerberus, I must be dead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There are retailers' stores on our shopping blocks.
Park my car on a hill? I use stopping blocks.
But for hacking up meat,
These big blocks can't be beat—
I'm referring, of course, to my chopping blocks.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
When folks die, what occurs when they're gone?
Transmigration of souls on and on?
Moves to Heaven or Hell?
Naps in dust at death's knell?
Or is deadlihood merely a con?

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'm a vampire, and don't think I'm griping;
A and B from my teeth I am wiping.
But what leaves me aglow
Is when virgins shriek: "O!"
Then I go (with the flow) — that's blood-typing.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An elderly crash victim, Bert,
Broke five bones in his face. (Boy, that hurt!)
First his car hit a tree,
Now he's room 23
All because of the fact that he FIRT.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I'll denudate," the candidate said.
"He'll lay bare his whole life, every shred,"
Said the press.  Voted in,
Now his words take on spin
As he sports a new look — a shaved head.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Demarcation lines may be well planned,
And each tribesman from crossing is banned.
But tribal divisions
Don't match the decisions
For lines that are drawn in the sand.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Those real estate agents can goof,
And my living arrangements are proof:
Though they found me a home
Where the buffalo roam,
I expected four walls and a roof!

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Constitutional fixes? Complex!
Twenty-seven to date on the decks.
The 19th, we should note,
Gave the distaff the vote.
That amendment contains the word sex.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Desperate measures, when all else has failed,
Are the actions most likely entailed
In a last-ditch attempt,
From which no one's exempt,
To repel those by whom they're assailed.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Though I give you a great deal of latitude,
You incessantly give me an attitude.
You behave like an ass,
And your assitude's crass.
I just wish you'd exhibit more gratitude.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
When he plummeted over the cliff,
He was terrified, frightened, agliff.
Though the Road Runner's fine,
'Tis the end of the line
For Sir Wile E. Coyote the Fifth.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Yon lassie's bin twistin' her neck;
Thinks ma kilt's a gae horrible check,
Disnae fancy ma hair
Or the claes that ah wear.
There's nae need for tae mock me — don't geck!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This evening's my fancy affair,
And your job's shlepping dinnerware there.
But you've mixed up the dates:
I've no silver, nor plates,
So I'm tearing my hair in despair.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Rose, that card that you gave me's not crappy,
But it's cloysome (that's schmaltzy and sappy).
It's so maudlin and gushy
And terribly mushy
That  tears washed my face!  Love, Grandpappy.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
We're old friends, sporting T-shirts. We came
For a coffee klatch. Let me proclaim
That we don't need a reason —
It's always the season
For get-togethers. Um, what's your name?

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Joe's acerbic, sarcastic, and dry—
He enjoys cutting words more than I!
But he'll strive for good taste,
Although sometimes in haste:
Ham on wry he will often pass by.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"All day und all night, unrelenting,
Mein shveetheart Brunhilda is venting:
'Mit dis Budveiser here,
Ist dis vahter or beer?'"
(It's a dialect act I'm presenting.)

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Roughly three-quarters copper to start,
Twenty-two percent zinc's the next part.
Add aluminum next,
And you will not be vexed
By corrosion. This brass is quite smart.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Nicknamed Didymus, Thomas the Twin
Saw his Lord, resurrected, stroll in,
And his didymi tightened.
"Thom, do not be frightened:
Probe didymous wounds in my skin."

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
If you're shaped like a cup, then you're chaliced.
If you're wearing suspenders, you're gallused.
But whatever you've got,
There's one thing I have not;
That's because you're a man, and you're phallused.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
If I talk of your blemish a bit,
I hope that you won't have a fit.
It's quite euphemistic
And sounds more artistic
Than pimple or blackhead or zit.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
I love to watch ladies abduct
In the exercise class I instruct.
But their legs are obstructive
When training's adductive.
It's crass, but to quit, I reluct.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Are the rites of your church Bacchanalian?"
Asked the alien—a stranded Australian.
I said: "Here in Kigali,
We shun all such folly.
We've an Anglican church, Episcopalian."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A corpulent man went and sat
By a girl who deflated him flat
When he asked her to dance:
"Are you nuts? Not a chance!
You're not only too old, pal—you're fat."

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
With an aspirin, your health stays okay
(Though four may be better, they say).
But four hundred or so,
Ma'am, is not apropos
If you're yearning to see the next day.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
My benevolent, miserly mammy, she'd
Offer one dime, and son Sammy, he'd
Race 'round the grounds
Grabbing glutinous mounds
Of her favorite annual, clammyweed.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A ward of the state as a tot,
Then a government pension he got.
When his last breath he draws,
Alimentary laws
Will provide for his burial plot.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
The chevage we give to our lord
Is more than the poor can afford.
Capitation (his plan)
Must be paid by each man,
And our lord keeps this hoard safely stored.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
If you use either hand when you write,
And your left is as good as your right,
Ambidextrous you are:
In the ring, you will star —
"One-Two" and he's out like a light.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The term butt-kicking contest implies
In the end you'll have sore-bottomed guys.
Friday night I kicked more
Than the rest (44)
And was therefore awarded grand prize.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
If you think you've contracted diphtheria,
Check for symptoms that meet the criteria:
Mild fever, sore throat.
Oh, and dig a wide moat
So that no one comes anywhere nearia.

limerick_list.author: David Roberts
limerick_list.text:
They buried a buddy of mine.
He's encased in a coffin of pine,
And, as from the hereafter,
I thought I heard laughter:
He owed me some money, the swine!

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
"Have eggs and beef liver!" I rave.
"They have choline, my chemical fave.
Acetic acid and it
Form a bond to transmit
The neuronal sensations I crave!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Not normally worn by a farmer,
This garment's a save-me-from-harmer.
It is heavily padded,
And mail pads are added—
The arming coat's worn under armor.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Hungry, looking for catfish to kill,
The tall shoebill remained very still.
Then he rapidly struck,
Saying, "Boy, I'm in luck!
This fish is just right: fits the bill."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though court-martialed, you'd never have guessed
That I'm serious and scared. Court recessed
To let me calm down,
But I laugh like a clown.
See, I get the damn giggles when stressed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The bullring is where the torero
Goes to prove he is not a vaquero.
He is brave, taunts the toro,
A swordsman like Zorro,
And never will wear a sombrero.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
In a not-so-cheap book that I bought,
Something happened that just hadn't ought.
A crack in the back,
Freeing pages, alack —
Thermal binding, it isn't so hot.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
The children invasion's begun.
These miscreants! Get me a gun!
  They crawl down the halls,
  Out of ceilings and walls,
And afflictively want to have fun!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My M.D. finished treatment, and he
Wrote a medical order: "D/C
Radiation." I wondered
If my doc merely blundered,
Or in Washington soon I would be.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Shooting bees with a BB or three
Was a booboo, I think you'd agree.
As the hundreds you've missed
Got so wonderously pissed,
Wave buh-bye to the bees as you flee.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
My editor Randy insisted
Every S&M source that existed
Be shown as a reference.
I did so, in deference:
They're bibliographically listed.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
E: between d and f fills a niche.
En: a measure in typesetting pitch.
End: choice morsel for dinner.
Endo: prefix for inner.
Endor: biblical village with witch.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Ambidextrous, yes, that's what I am
At tennis and badminton—wham!
I can smash day and night
With my left and my right.
My opponents despair, hissing "Damn!"

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
As a child, I was curious why
People talked about Canada Dry.
Ginger ale that I'd get
Was decidedly wet,
And went well with a jigger of rye.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
He looked in my eyes and he smiled.
I felt flattered, intrigued and beguiled,
But next morning he'd fled—
Left ten quid by the bed.
I felt dirty, despoiled and defiled.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
Buy a barothermohygrograph, you
Get an instrument shiny and new,
To record on a chart
The pressure, in part,
Plus the temp and humidity too.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You're a daydreamer, dear, and it's clear
The professors do not have your ear.
You hear nothing they say,
As you're far, far away—
In your mind, you've gone out for a beer.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Who's the Boss?  Was it Danza or Light?
Was it Tony or Judith?  Who's right?
Micelli spends hours
Reforming the Bowers
Until they're no longer up-tight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Scene One, on a llama, a lama
In pajamas, in old Yokohama,
Finds his momma—but, hey!
I'm not staging my play.
It is meant to be read (closet drama).

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An Arab who's stuck in a jam'll
With luck have a ruminant mammal.
If a sandstorm's in sight,
He can quickly take flight
And then hump through the night on his camel.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Of all eras, the Cryptic's my fave.
Over younger ones, others can rave.
The late Cenozoic?
It leaves me quite stoic.
The ancient is more what I crave.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Not a thing on the face of the earth
Should allow a mere detail of birth
To determine your pay.
You're a woman?  Okay,
But your work is of comparable worth.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My poor horse has a sore fetlock joint.
It's the place I'm about to anoint
With some gel, rubbed in well,
'Cause it's starting to swell.
Having pets can be hell (case in point).

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
But you can't mean the Bible's not funny—
Its stories are playful and punny!
In spite of the rumor,
It's full of good humor;
Best laugh on God's earth, for my money!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Highlander had a bad vibe
When the Borneans started to gibe.
Then out came the pot
And in went the Scot.
'Twas a cruel anthropophagous tribe.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Though for sushi I'll be in the mood,
There are delicacies I'll exclude.
Just like Orthodox rabbis,
I won't consume crab eyes;
They're not my idea of "see" food.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This corythosaur's skull, with a crest
And a bill like a duck's, may suggest,
In its fossilized state,
That one dinosaur's fate—
A blind alley in nature—was best.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
As a vegan, Gus Grissom should know
That these stalks keep his calories low,
But his garden's one veggie
Makes relatives edgy.
It ain't NASA celery, so?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Aruba the burrowing owl
Proudly claims, "I'm the national fowl.
Though I don't like to boast,
I've legs longer than most!
And for rodents I stay on the prowl."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
This word complicacy's clearly a fright,
One far harder to say than to write.
Does it work? Yes, it does,
But then only because
Complicatedness didn't look right.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Always mad as a freaking wet hen,
She'd come barging right into my den.
Could've flung her about
Or just moved my ass out.
I've been flatting with Freddie since then.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
In your grandmother's day (you'd forgotten?)
The bathing suit fashions were rotten.
With their skirts and their frills
They provided few thrills,
Whereas now—they're just slivers of cotton!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Dumb and silent" we'll be if we're bled
Of our speech freedom, Washington said.
If absence of voice
Is the dictator's choice,
Then, like sheep to the slaughter, we're led.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
He figured e constant, as frequent
A fraction as Leonhard pled usant.
Calculate: nil.
Then write it off still.
Oho! Factor null is indecent.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Old women succumb to anility
(A loss of their mental ability).
So find them good nurses,
But don't touch their purses
(They fight with a splendid hostility).

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Here's a math rule of which I am fond:
If two parts (angles, sides) correspond
On two congruent triangles
(Or pairs of biangles),
Both share a congruent bond.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If, when running, your foot falls afoul
Of the hole of a burrowing owl
Right there in the track,
Set your jaw and bounce back:
Many joggers just naturally scowl.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Dutch 200: a bowling game where
You might spare and then strike and then spare
And then strike once again,
Through to frame number ten.
It's a feat that's remarkably rare.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Anatomical parts that append,
Or conjoin, or abut, or extend
To another exist.
They're adnexal—and dissed
If unable to hold up their end.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
"Don't worry," he snarled, "Have no fear,
For you won't see this guy disappear
Far away off the scene
Like he never had been.
I am staying for good.  Is that clear?"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The decathlon's a sporting event.
For the toughest of athletes it's meant,
And they all stay alive.
I would never survive—
They are Superman; I am Clark Kent.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Tums that I chew are calciferous,
Producing effects salutiferous.
Their carbonate (calcium)
Boosts my morale—see 'em
Douse all my heartburn. Splendiferous!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Course catalogs over at State
Feature Arguing 10 (not Debate).
Classic Films is a major.
So's Hunting, I'd wager,
And Finding a Cousin to Date.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I recall all the games that we played
And the promises tenderly made;
But I felt so betrayed
When the bills went unpaid—
Guess our marriage was just a charade.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm writing a graduate thesis
On techniques for a celiocentesis.
I will drain, without gravity,
The abdominal cavity,
Using powers of psychokinesis.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
This demountable building, on site,
Is convenient, functional,  bright.
Once this job is complete,
'Twill be hauled down the street
To be set up anew, overnight.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Calumniate me, would you, bud?
Turn my name (which was spotless) to mud?
I shall see you in court
For the falsehoods you've wrought.
Be advised, pal: there's gonna be blood!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Although books on the subject abound
That quite thoroughly cover the ground,
Here's a long-standing mystery:
No Canadian History
By Careless and Wrong can be found.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
For years, Britain's best-known appeaser
Was Chamberlain, ill-advised geezer
Who pandered to Hitler.
Could leaders act littler?
Who'd trump him? What's your view, Theresa?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The foundation, our primary funder,
Jay claimed,  had committed a blunder,
And our acting troupe's books
Didn't balance. Gadzooks!
The discrepancy caused me to wonder.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
Human nature is quite acquisitional;
Our desire to acquire's unconditional.
 Even when we possess
 Far too much, nonetheless,
We are bound to keep wanting additional.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"We've been Gatored," I cried to my mom,
"On our website HailSatan.com!
When a surfer comes by,
A damn banner he'll spy:
'Let's recite now the 23rd psalm'."

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Inductor connects to transistor.
Capacitor goes to varistor.
A diamond (Oh, you!)
Made from diodes (Oh, poo.)
Is for rectification — there, mister.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Our eternal rest comes when we die,
'Cause it looks like we're sleeping.  But why
Use this phrase?  Just the body
Stops functioning.  God?  He
Takes souls to live on in the sky.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
A charet is pulled like a chariot
By horses (or dragons to vary it).
'Twould rule on the highway;
I'd always get my way,
With spikes on the wheels that would carry it.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
When the Bolsheviks started their party,
It was Lenin who led them (the smarty).
Some historians say,
"He was tops in his day,
And his beard was so pointed and arty!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He was hit on his head, on the right,
Yet the left is the side of his blight.
Contralaterally weak,
He can't walk and can't speak,
Though he tries with the whole of his might.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though today we say "high as a kite,"
In the era when Prinny got tight
A scoffer might say
That he spent half the day
In his altitudes. (Longer? Quite right.)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Affirmations are what we declare.
They're assertions of faith, which we swear
To be true, even though
Some are things we can't know,
So they're made on a wing and a prayer.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Will you tell me now, how did it feel
When your lover confessed she's disleal?
It burned like hot oil
To learn she's disloyal
And six hundred years old!  That's surreal.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Fox's anchors are rocking the boat,
Finding scandals and getting our goat.
Don't just argue and clash.
Delegitimize!  Bash!
The Chicago way, boys!  Cut their throat!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
Virge
limerick_list.text:
At the end of the job (what a squeeze!)
I looked round with a growing unease;
The roll was all gone!
To the neighboring john
I advanced with my pants round my knees.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The wine has been drained. They suggest
I refill from the butt. Hence my quest
To the buttery door.
"There's no butt on the floor."
"There is now!" I'm the butt of their jest.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
"To the home of the gods I shall ride,
Clad in nothing but animal hide.
I was faithless, derided,
And so I've decided
On deicide!"  (Bet he'll be fried.)

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
If you're captious you think that it's neat
To find fault with each person you meet.
In all you survey,
Nothing measures up — Nay!
Just to please you would be quite a feat.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Though the film started off with financement,
It's been spent on computer enhancement.
Will those bullet time scenes
Be the ultimate means,
In the fight 'gainst machines, of entrancement?

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The corpse flower's quite a rare plant;
It's huge, and it stinks—that I grant.
Its phallic appearance
And need for tall clearance
Lure tourists who smell it and rant.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the blastula's cells keep dividing,
A gastrula's formed, and it's hiding
A pouch that is what
Will become the beast's gut,
And the blastopore, into it guiding.
