limerick_list.author: Carol O and Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The ancients divined by default,
Casting crystals aloft for gestalt.
Alomancy provided
The clues that resided
In brine, a solution of salt.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In court, Enoch Bartlett draws stares
As he glares at the judge and declares,
"I'm extremely distressed
You've denied my request
For a jury comprised of my pears!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
While reading my library book,
I forgot that I must take a look
At the DD (due date),
So I kept it too late.
The librarian thinks I'm a crook.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Chain reactors some think of today
As a cost savings energy play—
But a deadly emission
From uncontrolled fission
Is a paramount factor to weigh.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer and mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Said Belle, in the Beast's regal keep,
"There's a tome I've been reading, to sleep.
Here's a word that I've seen:
What's cutaneous mean?"
"Well, my Beauty, it's only skin deep."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The prophet's divinement was grim:
"The tomorrows of mankind look dim.
There are more and more kooks
Who have menacing nukes —
Any hopes for this planet are slim."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Despite the advice that we gave yer,
You've engaged in outrageous behaviour.
Now, alas,  overwrought
That your ass has been caught,
You're distraught, but there's naught that'll save yer.

limerick_list.author: geniuswaitress
limerick_list.text:
Malcolm Cowley wrote quite the review—
Also Exile's Return (mostly true).
He could edit, write verse,
But for better or worse,
May be best known for people he knew.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
"Dermatosis!" a patient intones.
"Oh my God, my skin's blotchy in zones!
But it ain't any sin
To take off my skin,
And dance all around in my bones!"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At my window, I think that I'll never
Grasp the breadth of my corporate endeavor.
One building? No — eight
On a parklike estate:
It's a campus that goes on forever!

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
When refining a cuprous ore, mister,
One step's a black mass with a blister;
But no worries, for sure,
What we've got's almost pure.
Blister copper's here, soon it will glister.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
An obligate aerobe is bound
To reside where O2 can be found.
From its nebular birth,
For long eons on Earth
There were none of these critters around.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Uh... concerning that issue today...
Apropos that... mistake, I daresay...
With regard to the latter...
In view of the matter...
I'm sorry. There, said it, okay??

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Electricity frequently flowed
In Faraday's humble abode.
He measured its force,
But also, of course,
He sang of its charms in anode.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Changing keys on guitar? It's no sweat
'Cause a capo's the bar you should get.
On the neck, it's a snap,
Held in place by a strap,
So there's never a reason to fret.

limerick_list.author: Robert Schechter
limerick_list.text:
"I think …."  Descartes paused. "Do I dare go
And tell you now what follows ergo?
What's that?  You insist?
Very well.  I exist!
And my feet hurt.  Now, where did my chair go?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Stay away from the bellyache-bush"
Is advice that I'm trying to push.
Some report that its seeds
Fill your laxative needs
If you want a Vesuvius tush.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An ash can's a garbage receptacle,
So please pardon me if I'm skeptical—
What is called Ashcan art,
As a genre apart,
Seems both trashy and truly dyspeptical.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In London I spent half a year
Eating bangers and mash, drinking beer.
Now my friends all complain
That my speech is insane.
You ask why? I am cockneyfied, dear.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
"No matter what illness assails one,
Chicken soup is the cure for what ails one,"
Thus mine Yiddisheh mama
Dispensed with my drama.
She scolded, "You're no Prince of Wails, son."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Once a jockey, this author prevails
At exploring the many travails
Of the lads and the horses
At England's fine courses.
He has spent many years braiding tales.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As drunk Doug lurched upstairs that dark night,
His slim glim seemed a wavering sprite.
But that candle, ignored
While he soddenly snored,
Birthed a ravening monster of light.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Losing power while landing, he's miffed,
So the pilot's reaction is swift.
With the airflow that wraps
Around wings and their flaps,
He can give the plane much-needed lift.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
Spiro Keats, the Greek poet absurd,
Had a beak like a predator-bird.
With a schnozz like a hook,
He'd a hell of a look
And a snore that's the loudest I've heard.

limerick_list.author: oneslowtyper and Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
As a pig, I was nearly forsaken:
Without the blue ribbon, I'm bacon.
Charlotte did me up big,
In her web, spun "SOME PIG",
Saved my hide, but she left my heart achin'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Here's a study in matters linguistic:
You're a bighead if you're narcissistic.
If you've bighead, perforce,
In a sick sheep or horse—
That can make you feel quite pessimistic!

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
In conclave confined, day and night,
The cardinals ballot (or fight);
The stern camerlengo
Will not let his men go
Till the smoke from the chimney is white.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A Delphian doorkeeper, Noah,
Was ogling a dame in a boa,
When robbers slipped by
With the oracle's eye.
Seems that no one was minding the stoa.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
These flies, acalyptrate, are pests:
What the eater, if careless, ingests,
When he nibbles on cheese
And belatedly sees
It has hundreds of maggoty guests.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
When both upper-lobe bronchi arise
Above where the artery lies,
This ambiguous situs
Comes right back to bite us:
For being two right, there's no prize.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I misread his politeness.  He said,
"You try first.  I insist.  Go ahead.
After you."  Then I learned
That I should be concerned.
All the king's prior taste testers?  Dead.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Little girl, don't use all of your might,
For you can't skip a rope if it's tight.
Stand relaxed in the middle,
Give just a small twiddle,
And jump at the oncoming bight.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Alex Colville, an artist in paint,
Rendered passion with careful constraint.
He achieved wide acclaim
Dot by dot, made his name
With rare paintings suggestive of plaint.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
A beaver once frantically swam
To avoid angry landowner Sam
Who was knee-deep in mud
That had come from the flood—
He'd been damnified (damaged), by damn.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The programmer of a computer:
Part-builder and part-trouble-shooter.
Those zeroes and ones
Are all fine if it runs,
But too often the code-word is neuter.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The Earth, as it shares day and night,
At equinox divvies up right.
It's the first day of fall,
When our faithful old Sol
Will for half of the time provide light.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Is it time for your dethronization?
Lose your crown, cut you down, my relation?
Indecision's my bane —
How it dogs this great Dane!
Bump off Claudius, risking damnation?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The tapering edge of that board—
Its featheredge—that I ignored
In building this ceiling.
So now I am reeling;
In fact, I must say I am floored.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
With a body off Baywatch, he's hot —
From a distance.  Up close, not a lot!
Face off Crimewatch, his mug's
Like a plug-ugly thug's.
He's a bobfoc; most wanted, he's not.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A brief gamble was all we'd intended,
Till our fortunes turned parlously splendid:
We'd have left, but the host
Rumbled, "Leave and you're toast.
Why rush off?" He looked darkly offended.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
The gray rubber boa's a snake
That I saw way out west, near a lake.
It was smallah and slowah
Than others termed boa,
But its rubbery skin made me quake!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"The Virgin's appeared!" the men cried;
They produced some "ex-cripples" who lied.
Chicanery breeds
The "Church in the Weeds"
And they'll fleece devotees far and wide.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Lady Celia set off in her Bentley,
But the chauffeur was driving too gently.
Her complaining, at last,
Made him drive much too fast
(Which, in turn, got them lost, incident'ly).

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
At Naxos, Poseidon was blue,
Then a nereid came into view.
When he spied Amphitrite
In naught but a nightie,
He gave her an ocean or two.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As an athlete he's light on his feet,
And I never suspected he'd cheat,
But I now know the worst:
As I slid into first
The guy punctured my hand with his cleat.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
In court, with his balance and knife,
He was poised to take justice and life
And to weigh out his fresh
Pound of fair, promised flesh,
Though the cries of "Sweet mercy!" were rife.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Code Papa is used now and then
As a shipboard announcement for when
There's a spill soiling land
Or the waterways and
Mother Nature gets screwed once again.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The midwife was kind, had no malice,
And her tone was empathic, not callous,
But her message was trouble:
"Your newborn has double
Male genitals—yes, it's diphallus."

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Dish antennas are shaped like a... bowl.
Often found on your roof or a pole
To receive a transmission,
They're a great acquisition
If watching TV is your goal.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Cross assembler programmer Hall:
"I'm a coder for apps that are small—
Such as firmware for phones
Or an app on our  drones.
Code that's tailored and tight, all-in-all."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Chuck got caught, and they read him his rights.
He copped chips at the place he worked nights.
Memory's gone; he'll see jail
For the theft, on the scale
Of unthinkable billions of bytes.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chopped-up offal might garner disgust,
So a casing of pastry's a must.
Learning French, one might say
"In a crust" is pâté,
And accept all the contents on trust.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Eurocommunism favored alliance,"
Says the text for our course (social science).
"It supported new movements
For social improvements—
Towards the USSR showed defiance."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Best move on from that beauty; forget her.
She would eat you alive if you let her.
While appearing delicious,
That harridan's vicious.
You'd rue the dark day that you met her.

limerick_list.author: John Joyner
limerick_list.text:
A curmudgeonly Brit's muttered claim:
"Litigation is common law's shame!
The barristers' trust is
In winning, not justice.
The adversary system's to blame."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Though I haven't enwombed you, don't cry.
Yes, I know many months have gone by,
But I firmly believe
You were meant to conceive.
Until then, what a thrill just to try!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
After crossing the nave and the cross,
He stood staring at stalls—all that gloss!
Feeling awed and inspired,
Young Thomas inquired:
"Is this where monks sing to the Boss?"

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The cat's swallowed up the canary
And is proud of the deed he's done—very!
I'd just love to erase
That smug grin on his face!
He's left only the feathers to bury.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
There once was a band known as Bread.
To a soft-rocking style they were wed.
Songs like "Make It with You"
(Number 1) and a few
Other hits proved their musical cred.

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
If your stool is too loose to ignore, I'd
Suggest some relief for your sore hide.
Don't throw in the towel!
To slow down your bowel:
Diphenoxylate (ahhh!) hydrochloride.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Your little black evening dress
Has me drooling, I have to confess.
It would show your whole chest,
Were it not for your vest—
Seems you've got it on backwards, I'd guess.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
"Bug-collecting all day is just weird,"
My playmates in grammar school jeered.
Would they care to apologize?
I now entomologize
For zoos with collections revered.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Rain in torrents — deluginous — came
To our picnic.  I yelled, "God-damned shame!"
Then a bolt struck my tongue;
A deep voice boomed, "Thou dung!
Thou shall not take in vain the Lord's name!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The blanket flowers cover the valley.
Their beauty induced us to dally.
I'll hate going back
To my South Brooklyn shack,
Where stinkweed grows tall in the alley.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Unless they're infected with rabies
Or crazed from a case of the scabies,
These shepherds from Oz
Are a favorite because,
Unlike dingoes, they won't eat your babies.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As he dizzyingly climbed to the top
Of a roof with a hundred-foot drop,
Bert declared, "I'm vertiginous!
Send a Sherpa, indigenous
To Nepal—or else call me a cop!"

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
She was smoking, the fire chief claims,
In her bed, so it's her that he blames.
She's in heaven, I trust
(Remain faithful we must).
Still, I'm saddened she went up in flames.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For years I've known Lucifer; though
He is far from ideal, he's my beau.
Unknown Damien tried,
But a date I denied
Because better the devil you know.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The young stewardess gave a light cough
As she gently reminded the toff,
"Our procedure is neat:
To be safe in your seat,
You must fasten your belt to take off."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
If a patient should happen to wet
His hospital bed, you can bet
There's a trick they apply
So he stays high and dry:
A draw sheet's the thing he will get.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When your injury's bleeding a lot,
You can treat it with something that's hot.
Lest your loss when you bleed
Leaves you less than you need,
Opt for cautery, causing a clot.

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Defining his style quite loosely
With high-powered words used profusely,
I quickly surmise
We should give him a prize
For confusing us all, most abstrusely.

limerick_list.author: Miss Mimi
limerick_list.text:
On sharing, here's Polly's discursion:
"To monogamy, I've an aversion.
I feel glad when my mate
Is enjoying a date.
I'm not jealous, but filled with compersion."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
If there's one thing old leaders enjoy,
It's to send out, position, deploy
Their young soldiers at night
Who are ready to fight
And engage in a seek and destroy.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
It's a mix (mostly meat) in a skin;
An old car; or a firework's din.
A banger can be
Any one of those three,
Or a madam enjoying her sin.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
Yummy dumplings I find quite a treat,
Made from cornmeal, potatoes or wheat.
In hot water they boil.
Topped with garlic and oil,
Give me gnocchi, delicious to eat!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
In L.A., almost everyone thinks
That the best chili dog comes from Pink's.
No one ever sees flaws in
Dyspepsia-causin'
Junky food that (nutritionally) stinks.

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
O'er the Baltic, ships Seaslessly rolled,
And the Latvian sailors were bold.
The Estonians, too,
With Lithuanians who
Formed some States in a war which was cold.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There is nobody, penny-wise, wiser.
He could work as a scrimping adviser.
He's a demon for thrift.
Even words get short shrift:
No econo is spared by this miser.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"That's our Enterprise, muscle in motion,"
Said old Sparky, with pride and devotion.
"Bet if action breaks out,
She'll be somewhere about.
She's the fightingest ship on the ocean."

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
A scheming young student named Scott
Tried to take out more cash than he'd got.
When his bank card was swallowed,
He panicked and followed.
He's stuck till they widen the slot.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"We eat everything!" bragged Tom and Flo.
Their hostess served blackbird —go know!
Flo gulped, "Thanks for havin' us."
Tom gagged, less than ravenous,
"Well, I guess we'll just have to eat crow."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"That club's moniker sure disconcerts
All its fans," said the mayor.  "It hurts
City pride and brings shame.
So I'm scrapping the name
Of that Little League team: Hershey Squirts."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The word flatulate's dear to my heart
Since it can't help but make me sound smart.
It's an excellent term
If, like me, you will squirm
Any time you must say the verb fart.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
I've a chronic disease and I suffer.
And I ask — through the pain — which is tougher:
The long years of illness
And bedridden stillness,
Or the treatment, which couldn't be rougher?

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I awake from a terrible dream
To a hideous, blood-curdling scream.
"Oh my God! What was that?"
"It vos only a bat,"
Says Count Dracula, canines agleam.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They're so trendily, faddishly dressed,
A la Gentleman's Quarterly—blest—
Looking stylish and lean,
Metrosexuals preen,
By those men in the mirror impressed.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
When I call  you, you'd better come here.
I'm the ruler! It's me you should fear.
In our African home,
I'll say where you may roam.
I'm in charge! I'm your nation's emeer.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bacterioscopy: one of the terms
For the study of microbes and germs.
Through the lenses I peer;
I prefer this career
To a job giving haircuts and perms.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Euxanthin — my teacher once bade
Me research: Was bright pigment once made
From the urine of cattle
Fed mango leaves? "That'll
Make Indian yellow. Won't fade."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Wisconsin in winter is nice,
So for fishermen, here's my advice:
Go chillax in a hut
After making a cut
Through a seven-inch layer of ice.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Dermovascular action's the flow
Of the blood in the vessels that go
Out to nourish the skin
From deep pumping within,
So my toes warmly glow in the snow.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
We've lost count of the number of dates
We've been on, but we're still without mates,
And the future portends
"Witty" barbs from gay friends,
Who have dubbed us the desperate straights.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
To ensure a good joint between two
Wooden items, drill holes partway through
Faces meant to abut;
Then a dowel pin cut
And push in after coating with glue.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An acid-tongued lady named Sonya
Made a meal of your basic begonia.
For the basic appeal
Of a plain, basic meal,
She would wash it all down with ammonia.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The economy's started to crash;
Dump your greenbacks — yes, empty your stash.
It won't long remain spendable.
All your thrift, once commendable,
May leave heaps of depreciated trash.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Oh, my love for you draws me near, Baby,
And however in peril my way be,
I shall fight for your heart.
Naught will keep us apart,
And I'll never equivocate. (Maybe.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's dissepiment? One definition
Is "a septum, a body partition"—
In an organ it goes.
There is one in your nose,
In an upright, dividing position.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Your financial plight getting too crummy?
Find it hard to get food for your tummy?
There's the food pantry, see?
They distribute for free
Meat and produce to make your meals yummy.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A CD player plays my CDs
With the songs I like best, such as these:
Lonnie Donegan's hits
Or some other famed Brits'
And all Austrian songs (Viennese).

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
My fiddlestick isn't a log.
It's a fine piece of wood that can jog,
Sweep, or bounce on a string.
I'm controlling its spring
With my fingers and thumb at the frog.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
What a thrill when you get an award,
Like a crown on your work—oh, my lord!
It says, "Yes, you're the best,
Rising over the rest!"
For your toil you deserve this reward!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Said a drunken old man, "Dear, oh, dear!"
And he hiccoughed, "It'sh patently clear:
I cannot exshisht
Unlesh I am pished."
Then he swigged one more bottle of beer.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
The acetyl value's the weight
Of the potash that's used to abate
All the acid in fat
Which was hydrolised (that
Is a fact that I'll gladly relate).

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
When omnipotence flows from my soul,
All the cosmos within my control,
All of Heaven and Earth
Shall profess my great worth.
Almightiness:  that is my goal.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Eradiate's here in my reading,
So a good definition I'm needing.
I see "radiate" will do.
(I am asking: Don't you
Think that English could use a good weeding?)

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
When you promised us sun, what a sham!
All your barograms aren't worth a damn,
And your barograph's junk
That belongs in a trunk:
It's been raining so hard that we swam!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A baby wagon (also called pram)
Is a carriage for baby boy Sam.
We bought such a carriage
Before our June marriage
And carted it home on the tram.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
For want of a meal we would fast
Were it not for the amyloplast.
In potato or larch
It turns sap into starch,
So our debt to this cell's rather vast.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Each image on Polly's computer
Is so cutesy it couldn't be cuter.
She quietly traffics
In computer-type graphics—
Not male and not female, but neuter.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"There's a reason your brother's not found,"
God tells Cain.  "He cries out from the ground
That you killed him.  Your fields
Will produce paltry yields,
And you'll restlessly wander around."

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
You'll find me on pants made of felt.
You'll find me on pants with a welt.
You'll find me on top
Where the pants seem to stop:
I'm a belt loop — a belt for a belt.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
In the Rockies, blue columbine grows—
A perennial flower that shows
Shades of purple or blue;
Even pinks are seen too.
It's the bloom Coloradoans chose.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Deadpan comics, to me, are the best.
I can't tell you how much I'm impressed
When they joke all the while
Without cracking a smile.
That's the way to deliver a jest!

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Now don't blame your sweat, it's not fair;
It's bacteria stinking up there.
Undergo electrolysis:
Bacteriolysis!
There! Doesn't that clear the hair!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
When you say my career is a sham,
It's that Auto-Tune software you slam.
For this fame, I've no choice
But to upgrade my voice,
'Cause I really can't sing worth a damn.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq and psheil
limerick_list.text:
Mr. Snowman was melting, so I
Said, "Ma, save him! Don't let my friend die!
It is possible, feasible;
Snowmen are freezable."
"No!" was Ma's chilly reply.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Folks read Drabble, a topical strip,
'Cause it covers what's currently hip.
The humor's not bad.
I like Patrick and Dad
And then Norman, who's somewhat a dip.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If you're someone who savors the taste
Of sweet caramelized onions, make haste!
Abbot's Gold will be better
For you. It's a cheddar
Where an onion soup flavor's been placed.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Much like meeting your doom at high noon:
A compulsory purchase deed, soon,
Will be pinned to the door
That was yours just before
They planned building this road to the moon.

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
If your respiratory system is humming,
Making whispers, fine crackling or drumming,
Then it's nothing benign:
You have Abrahams' sign.
(Read: a case of TB is forthcoming.)

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Both their résumés say they are hot,
But we really don't know what they've got.
When we're judging their minds,
There are only 10 kinds:
They know binary, or they do not.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I adore your new biochem course, meant
To teach chemical means of enforcement
Of enzyme induction—
That's speeding construction
Of catalysts. Here's my endorsement!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Most enticingly tempting me out,
With the message, "Spring's here—have no doubt,"
Sunny coins beckoned smilingly,
Winking beguilingly—
Gold that March winds couldn't rout.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
As some foolhardy bathers have learnt,
Do not swim in the Benguela Current.
From Antarctica's coast
To Angola's shores, most
Of those in for a dip wish they weren't.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Be careful the measurement's good
When you're cutting a dovetail in wood.
So the tenon won't move
In the mortise's groove,
Use a countergage. Everyone should!

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
It is time that I got myself dressed.
Ought to make an attempt, do my best,
For just sitting around
In withdrawal profound
Leads, in my case, to getting depressed.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Although women might keep men as pets,
As cadettes some were staunch suffragettes.
"Do you think that a guy
Could be taught how to fly?"
"Are you crazy? You'd let in cadets?"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I'm so hungry, I'm famished. Of course,
I could chomp that proverbial horse.
I have never been so
Extra-peckish. You know
I'd eat you and show little remorse.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A nerdy accountant named Max is
Found constantly doing his taxes.
His head starts to throb
When he's not on the job:
Doing taxes is how he relaxes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fils is a Frenchman's own sonny,
As in Cyril et Fils, yet it's funny
That in English the word
May also be heard
As a unit of Middle East money.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
Your baby blue eyes are enticing —
So warm that their color's de-icing!
They're dazzling and true,
And they say "I love you!"
(Except when you're mad — then they're slicing!)

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
It's apostrophe heaven, this word,
Because fo'c's'le is forecastle slurred,
And means "cabin in front
Of a ship", to be blunt.
You can see why its origin's blurred.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
"Blocked up ear canals? Oh, what a pain.
So, a problem? Less sound to your brain?"
My poor friend simply sighed,
Moved in close and replied,
"Pardon me, could you say that again?"

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An Irishman's girlfriend, named Flannery,
Worked nights shelling beans in a cannery.
In Belfast, a shell
Felled her Paddy—the hell
Of a life filled with rife black-and-tannery!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Speaking Greek is no walk in the park;
With an asper, the contrast is stark:
To turn Ellen of Troy
Into Helen, my boy,
Use a backwards apostrophe mark.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The convolvulus, second to none,
Climbs widdershins, seeking the sun;
But the honeysuckles stray
In the opposite way,
Climbing clockwise. Their shadows are fun!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My pop thinks he's a fountain of mirth. He
Jokes, "Bloke I know needs a wide berth. He
Said 'Oops!' We recoiled —
His trousers he'd soiled!"
(My dad's sense of humour is earthy.)

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
On the front of the head is the face,
Without doubt the superior place.
The much lower contender
Deserves no defender —
Smiling arse about face would lack grace.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
If you're quiet, immobile, and still,
And you cannot be moved, if you will,
Then you're actionless, so
Even friends may not know
If you're dead or just over-the-hill.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Shakespeare's  lovers both die in a tomb;
There they lie, bride and groom, in the gloom.
Double suicide, they
End this great tragic play—
And the audience weeps at their doom.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Steve Jobs said, "I gave all that I had.
If they can't compete, that's not my bad."
His foes have to grapple
With products from Apple—
First iMac, then iPhone, now iPad.

limerick_list.author: RCK
limerick_list.text:
I wait, and I wait, and I wait.
But my problems? They never abate.
I'll be waiting forever
For life to get better,
To improve or ameliorate.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"To follow that goat would be folly: a
Heretic, is Martha Collier",
Thundered Birch. "She's a bitch,
And of Endor, the Witch;
Whereas I'm, on the whole, rather holier."

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
An idea once dismissed as mythology
Is the basis of astrolithology.
Now it's hard to deny:
Rocks that fall from the sky
Can explain puzzling bits of geology.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You might like to use this sharp sword
If you fight for a lavish reward,
But if back to the wall, shun
This weapon, the falchion.
Use statecraft to reach an accord.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
Webster's Third International's version
Of my word makes it worth an excursion.
Apadana would be
The great hall that you'd see
In palaces, ancient and Persian.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Guard your assets and cope with taxation
By forming a close corporation.
Just the founders — just two of you,
Or maybe a few of you,
Can guide it with less aggravation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our thoughts seem to clash. I predict
Our opinions will often conflict.
In this conflict, or fight,
We will scratch, hit, and bite.
For convictions, we'll both end up kicked.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Eve's mistake put us all on the spot —
For her sin, banned from Eden we got.
Then the curse: work and strain,
Sorrow, sickness and pain,
And then death: Fall of Man.  Thanks a lot.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Tell the warden my cellmate agreed
I would sleep on the top bunk, then he'd
Said his word wasn't binding;
His handshake, he's finding,
Should've meant something — just let him bleed.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
Using cogeneration's a way
To make burning that gas really pay.
Excess power, or heat,
Can be sold on the street.
It's efficient; what more can I say?

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
He's a miserable person, a grump.
You would think he had married a frump.
If you wait quite a while,
You will not see him smile —
Sixty years he has been in the hump!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Freeze and don't move a muscle!  Stand still,"
Yelled a guard, "or I'll shoot you to kill!"
Thought the motionless felon,
"This itch is pure hell, 'n'
Not scratching takes all of my will."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
As the mouse chased some nuts (what a crock!)
Hanging over his wheel, we took stock.
Said the doc, with a frown,
"Is that mouse running down?"
That's the hickory augury, doc.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
To read Euclid you'd better prepare
For distress and the tearing of hair.
Geometrical proofs
Are big trouble for goofs
Who can not tell a line from a square.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
He says, cussedly, "Over my dead,
Lifeless body!" It enters my head:
Such a threat from my spouse,
Who's a pig-headed louse,
Tempts this wife to arrange what he said.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Our mission: with verses five-lined,
English words, one and all, are defined.
Definitions all swarm
In a limerick form—
Lord, this site is just one of a kind!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A blender's a wig with a band
For the forehead. It goes hand in hand
(When your make-up's in place)
With what's put on your face
And the band, so it blends. Understand?

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Though the ewes were most lightsome and lissome,
Old Sam wasn't minded to kiss 'em.
"That's for humans," said Sam.
"I'm a baattering ram
Who must rut while my blossoms are blissom."

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
You've achillobursitis? Big deal;
I'm not really concerned how you feel.
You have been, without fail,
Such a pain in my tail,
I don't care you've a pain in your heel.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Captain Komet has plans for the moon,
Spanning craters with domes very soon:
"Earthmen won't feel at home in
This place till there's domin',
And first comes a lunar saloon."

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
All the animals yak, wouldn't ewe?
I'm not kitten — I'd gopher one gnu.
On porpoise, it seems,
The gorilla my dreams'
Lion eyes steered me wrong — whatta shrew!

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
I can see joyful Toad on the road,
In her RV, her only abode.
With her paintbrush and boat
And the rest of her tote,
The road is the Toad's motherlode.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The McCoys' top ten hits numbered two:
"Hang On Sloopy" and "Fever" got through
With Rick Derringer (lead).
As a soloist, he'd
Just one hit: "Rock and Roll Hootchie Koo."

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
In prescriptions, amounts are the same;
As a book, it's the anecdote game.
Up in Éire, it invokes
An old goddess, but folks,
On our friends, Ana's only a name.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Liking Paul and George, Ringo and John,
Doesn't make you a betelnut, Don!
If folks chew you and drool,
And it's red — well, then, fool,
Only then will you qualify, mon!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
We fish from the top of this rock. Why?
More fish swim near here than the dock.  Why,
By this fast-flowing stream
Sockeye fishing's a dream—
But do not call these great waters aquae!

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Men of wisdom, they came from the East,
Bearing gifts and expecting a feast.
"Christmas Day in Duluth
Ain't a ball, that's the truth,
But we're outta Noo Joysey at least."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
My Coolgardie safe works, though it's crude,
And its use now by most is eschewed.
Made of meshing and hessian,
It keeps my meat fresh in
The cool, guarding safely my food.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Don't get huffy, kid — this is the norm.
Freshmen students must fill out this form.
Just supply what's requested,
And once we have blessed it
Your mommy can live in the dorm.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
When a chromosome splits into two
In a microbiologist's view,
Then two threads in a pair —
They're the chromatids — bear
Out life's mystery: many from few.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My arctophobe girlfriend shows fear
Any time that a teddy bear's near.
When she's forced, she'll concur
They're just stuffing and fur,
So the root of her fear is unclear.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
An architect came to enquire
How a church could be made a bit higher.
"Think big and have vision,"
I said with concision,
"The answer is simple: aspire."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Like spotlights, my downlights suggest
I'm a star.  Shadows form neath each breast.
I'm a Greek Aphrodite
As I slip on my nightie.
(I'm a bit self-obsessed, as you've guessed.)

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
I'm not part of the wondrous elite,
But I do have a talent that's neat.
Neither hero nor god,
I'm a branchiopod
And can breathe through the gills on my feet!

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
I read "dish elm" and "bright, bloody red,"
And thought, "Let's carve a platter for bread!"
But who knew elm wood shrinks?
And who knew elm wood stinks?
Or dishelm means "exposing the head?"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Eve has figged herself out — every leaf
Decked with daisies and folded so brief
That it's almost not here.
She heard Lilith was near:
Teasing Adam may give the ex grief.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In these clerical books I've been delvin'.
They're by Calvin, you fool, not by Kelvin,
And this Calvin's named John.
No, his name is not on
The Nobel, 'cause that Calvin's called Melvin.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
The areola's color surrounding
The center of something that's rounding.
The nipple's an ample
Areolar sample.
(That I kept this so clean is astounding!)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Will you dash off this note, short and sweet?
"Dear Soon Ex: While I'm working, you meet
With a guy, so we're through."
Send a copy then to
My attorney.  You care to go eat?

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In Great Britain, where everyone strives
Against stressful or difficult lives,
You are likely to see
Lots of drinking of tea—
Cup that cheers or the cup that revives.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This brittlebush, growing beneath
Desert skies, has a lot to bequeath.
It is used to make glue,
And as chewing gum too,
And by cowboys for brushing their teeth.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An acantho- and cephalan worm
Is a parasite, I can affirm.
It's terribly tiny,
Tenacious and spiny.
If you get it, you'll wiggle and squirm.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I seek differentiability:
Which is female, and which has virility?
In these species of fleas,
"He"s, one sees, look like "she"s,
So my efforts will end in futility.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"A camerist," argues Louise,
"Was a lady's maid." "Her expertise
Was photography?" "No!
Though today some say so
And pronounce it as 'camera-ist'? Please!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Lift the edge of the carpet. What's there?
Just a section of floor that is bare?
No, there's dirt that I've swept.
Cleaning house? I'm inept,
But to tell you the truth, I don't care.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Private Budd trudged the war-torn back road
With his pack on his back: a full load.
Then Budd shouted, "I've found
A dud round on the ground.
Is it true misfired shells can't expl—"

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
As it roared through the gathering gloom,
Those who watched felt a deep sense of doom.
From its sound, you'll agree,
That 1,000 cc
Means a bike that's designed to go vroom.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What is dracanth? A natural gum
Used to thicken this jam made from plum,
And in health-giving pills
That you take for your ills—
So much firmer these capsules become.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The Soviet girls' swimming team
Were all known to employ special cream
On their lips and their chins
To remove hairy grins—
Russian depilator worked like a dream.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A capitulant ought to show shame.
(What remains to a loser but blame?)
Still, I hold up my chin
Even as I give in:
It's a stumble; don't judge me as tame.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
By example and free conversation,
So that logic defends inspiration,
I shall buttress my creed,
Both in word and by deed:
My apology, my affirmation.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
When Cupid with arrows takes aim
At a fellow, or else at a dame,
He shoots out a dart
Which pierces a heart
And sets a new lover aflame.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Alphabet
limerick_list.text:
To Eliot, April is cruel.
As far as months go, he's a fool:
October's a curse,
November's a hearse,
And December's a harsh icy ghoul.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
At the campground, we needn't delay.
Let us pitch the small tents right away,
Then we'll raise the big tall one
Beside the last small one.
It's there that we'll gather to pray.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
At first, lovely Hilary nagged me
To date her, and later she dragged me
To her villa where she,
With the help of some tea
(Which she called "get-acquainted tea"), bagged me.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chemiluminescent, it quietly glows.
A reaction's the cause, I suppose,
To the vanishing cream
That I hoped would redeem
What I found on the end of my nose.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The gewgaw's a fun thing to play:
Hold by lips (against teeth), pluck away,
Move the tongue to change pitch.
Now when I have the itch,
I twang Mozart's sonata in A.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Chipping sparrow's home's flimsy?  No fear!
Nest has holly protection; food's near.
Plumage-perfect Spizella
passerina, vain fella,
Molts face feathers six times a year!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Oh, how I loved Teaneck High!
I'd have liked to play there till I die.
Thanks to JV and V,
I was BMOC —
A most-wanted and popular guy.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
All the commies and pinkos and such
Fight for freedom from capital's clutch.
They would equalize wealth
By revolt or by stealth —
Far left radicals, so out of touch.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My unease with geology's chronic;
In the lab, I feel lost and moronic.
Diastrophism must
Be about the earth's crust,
But I'm baffled by matters tectonic.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Don't scuttle from this derivation,
Or smoulder in deep concentration.
Fallen trees compressed tight
Through the aeons' long night
Put the coal into coalification.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Cobitidae: scavenger fish
(Not the type you would eat from a dish)
That are also called loaches—
My net now approaches,
Since one, for my fish tank, I wish!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A restaurateur who's a schnook
Gives his sous-chef a lecherous look.
What crosses his mind
Is her shapely behind,
And it leads him to goose his own cook.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Said the centipede, strolling life's path
With the one hundred legs that he hath,
"I love science, but still
I've declared in my will
That I'm leaving my body to math."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
His cerebrovascular system
Has vessels. He's sure to enlist 'em
While wracking his brain
To the point where the strain
On his arteries threatens to twist 'em.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though my dad was his mom's only child,
She was harsh, and not known to be mild.
She had scrapbooked her boy;
Do the clippings show joy?
At the yellowing pages, I smiled.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"Answer up!" wrote the WE,
'Cause he wanted an answer from me.
He had asked me a question
On the word indigestion —
Why he did so, I just failed to see.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When he answers the door knock at dawn,
Gilbert Stuart finds troops on his lawn.
"You will take in this boarder
And sketch him," they order.
"Lord North must be quartered and drawn."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In deflation, economists tell,
The economy's going to hell;
And the prices all crash
When there's too little cash
Chasing goods that I'm trying to sell.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cairn terriers never will grow
Very large and, a long time ago,
It's from Scotland they came.
They're both friendly and tame.
And in Toto, that's all that I know.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Assyriology studies the hour
When carvings of lions would tower,
And the myths of Iraq
Could be found on a plaque:
The era of Babylon's power.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
Said Ma to our kid brother, Leon,
"Tomorrow, for sure, you'd best be on
Your true best behavior
For our blessed savior:
In church you'll not act like a peon."

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
His sudokus Gramps solves in the basement,
In pencil to limit defacement.
He then rubs out the numbers,
Wakes Gran from her slumbers:
It's her turn, with clean slate erasement.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Into credulousness she was lulled,
When he swore it meant "apt to be culled".
Cut it out! You believe?
Then this means you're naïve:
Cullibility — girl, you've been gulled.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a tone that is angry and bilious,
You declare I am over-punctilious,
But you're wrong!  I'm appalled;
'Cause the browridge is called
Superciliary, not supercilious!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Our geological survey has found
What's upon and far under the ground.
Let us therefore take stock:
Say, an aquifer? Rock?
Diamonds? Clamshells (an Indian mound)?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let us carol with joy—exultation—
'Cause I've found a brand-new occupation.
I no longer turn tricks
Like the other hot chicks.
I'm a preacher; I peddle salvation.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"Thank you, those-who've-been-left-in-the-lurch box,
Poor-folk-who've-been-knocked-off-their-perch box.
Drop a coin in the slot,
As a little's a lot."
(Signed: The Bloke Who Broke Into The Church Box.)

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Do my oddly cut flagstones, and craving
For haphazard forms, mean I'm raving?
Whereas Sylvia Plath
Paved with death her sad path,
I obsessively lay crazy paving.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Something claviform looks like a club —
Not a club where you booze and eat grub,
But the kind used to beat
Victim's heads (or their feet)
Till they beg for a soothing hot tub.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
"Better English helps people get on,"
Thought the Bullokars, William and John.
Folks could looke for a spelling
In the booke Dad was selling,
But for meaning to John's they'd have gone.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
To astrogate's not to step through
An alien arch to pursue
Strange forces fanatical
With fate problematical.
Instead, steer your spacecraft with crew.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I am almost in love with you, dear,
But not quite, as you bring me no cheer.
I'm unhappy and gray
When you're far, far away.
It is almost like having you here.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A fatherlike figure I'm not,
As I wench and I wander a lot.
Not protective or kind,
I am often maligned
For the numerous  brats I've begot.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
What's with coneflowers? Boy, I'm perplexed:
When their petals turn down, they're deflexed.
Petals ought to spread wide,
Up, or out to the side.
Oh, okay; as described in the text.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
You drove Humpty today up a wall:
Made him livid.  That wall's ten feet tall.
For an egg, that's not good;
That is not where eggs should
Ever be, not at all, should they fall.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Do you wish to remain abject mice?
Want a thesis too dull to entice?
Make your question forgo
Any answer but no:
Erotesis. (A doubtful device?)

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
This consumer report gives a warning
For a product we all should be scorning:
If you take it at night
All your hair will turn white,
And you'll never wake up in the morning.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Sure, the Danube is brown as can be —
It gets flooded with feces and pee.
This unclean human dung
Down the Danube is flung
To the chronically mucky Black Sea.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A poor Lord had just purchased a Ford,
Though the car left him thoroughly bored.
Said he couldn't afford
To obtain an Accord,
Or a Cord that was lately restored.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Your courtyard looks dreary and sad.
You need something … Ah yes—a calade!
A pebble mosaic
Is never prosaic.
Oh, let's start a cobblestone fad!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I've never made much, but I'll try.
Stella's growing our baby; that's why.
All I know is brute force;
Look, I'm strong like a horse.
I can lift heavy things. We'll get by.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Three and one, so the count's in my favor:
A position a batter should savor.
But the way I've been slumping,
My heart just keeps thumping.
A bunny at bat would seem braver.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
If you don't want to look like a jerk,
When a sucker seems stupid, don't smirk!
No, to gain a fool's favor,
Simply wheedle and glaver.
It's deceitful, but really does work.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Though on spiritual issues we lead,
Ardent clericalism's our creed.
In secular matters
Mankind is in tatters,
And the word of the Lord's what we need.

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
Yes, chocolate chip cookies are fun.
They're a snack food that can't be outdone.
But one batch won't suffice:
Up the quantities (thrice).
On your recipe scribble, "Serves one."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In China, I wooed Mary Woo
In her robe of celestial blue.
Such a long, breathless kiss!
And I hope that her bliss
Like my own, was celestial too.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Maud the bawd pauses, paws at her gaud
(A large rosary bead). She's so bored.
"Daughter, pray the Our Father,
Hail Mary..." She'd rather
Be off (oh my gawd) clawing Claude.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Best known methods for doing things rock,
Such as choosing just when to sell stock.
What's the best way to write
"Best known method"?  The trite
BKM —  Was that really a shock?

limerick_list.author: Toxic
limerick_list.text:
In matters of Mexican weed,
On this, all the hippies agreed:
A joint that is rolled
With Acapulco gold
Contains fine marijuana, indeed.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
I hate violence—I made it my mission:
Make a G-rated cutdown edition
Of Saw, but my edits
Left only the credits
And that old FBI admonition.

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
In a distant celestial romance,
Two great spheres are engaged in a dance.
Gravitation'ly bound,
Partnered stars whirl around,
Linked fore'er by ethereal chance.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In a plight after plighting her trow
To a hundred new beaux in a row,
She has yet to confess
How she loves to say yes,
Which not one of her boys seems to know.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A child who is good, I conclude,
Is well-mannered and never is rude.
A bad child is okay
In a restaurant, I'd say,
But then only when there served as food.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This calc-sinter mineral brings
A long history. Formed by hot springs,
Handsome travertine stone
Is in Italy known,
Seen in villas and homes built for kings.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When your brain is relaxed, its default
Mode's a network that never will halt,
And the traffic explodes
Twixt its multiple nodes
When you daydream of melon with salt.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
What the dickens? The question is: who'd
Plot the murder so cowardly crude
Of this dude in his prime?
What a fictional crime
Was The Mystery of dead Edwin Drood.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A lifetime in prison's the issue.
You imagined great wealth, but now wish you
Hadn't let all that dreaming
Hatch criminal scheming.
The fantasy's dead. (Here's a tissue.)

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The once feared, now unhorsed, chevalier
Is a knight antimonarchists jeer.
If he whipped out his sword
In the palace (dear Lord!),
He'd excite the odd queen — but not fear.

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
If a chemical peel's called a beautifier,
Then a bow in your hair is a cutifier.
And I guess when you're loud
And obscene in a crowd,
My hand on your mouth is a mutifier.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Where large rivers demarcate frontiers,
Changing flow alters borders for years.
On one side of the course
May rule royal armed force
Where dominion was once that of peers.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A broker with aught in her pocket
But a locket is needing to hock it.
It had come as a shock,
When she'd shorted a stock,
And went broke—it took off like a rocket.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Let's review what in life's sure, or certain.
If you go to a dance and are flirtin',
The guy who'll respond
May come on like James Bond—
But in looks? Nowhere near Richard Burton.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a cross, to which Highlanders pray,
Or an off-the-coast isle (en français).
'Twas a stiff (as in dead)
To Will Shakespeare, it's said—
Also "barter,"  of corse, in his day.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Stringing wire round walls, you could clamp it,
But a hook is sufficient: a crampet.
For aesthetics, it's best
If the wire's recessed,
So cut grooves, sink each crampet, and tamp it.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Once a doubter, I'm now a believer:
Doctor Derrick's an overachiever.
This intern from Merrick
Diagnosed my enteric
(Or as Grandpa would say, typhoid) fever.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Having fibromyalgia's no gas—
I so wish that this illness would pass.
I'm tired and slow,
And I ache head to toe.
Safe to say, it's a pain in my ass.

limerick_list.author: Gina Frierman-Hunt
limerick_list.text:
A marriage commissioner can
Wed a woman to her chosen man.
Two brides are OK,
And two grooms also may
Be joined up, where they've lifted that ban.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Since I don't want this worm in my apple,
Nor my quince, nor my pear, I shall grapple
With my problem and catch
Codling  moths by the batch—
The bad apples I'll feed to my caple.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
See the sides of the gables? Beware!
Simply décor are crow steps up there
Where the birds often rest,
But for safety, it's best
That just avian weight's all they bear.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What a scoop! I'll at last break a story:
"Headless Torsos Turn Up in a Quarry".
Though the corpses were bloated,
The editor noted:
"No dice—insufficiently gory."

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
If you ever get jailed by the law
(Might have busted some guy on the jaw),
The detainer they'll file
Keeps you locked up a while,
'Til the charges they press or withdraw.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Deprivation has kept me up nights.
What's become of my spousal delights?
Give the baby a break;
Bliss awaits you—partake.
Don't deny my consortial rights.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
To discloud—aka, clear the sky—
There's a couple of things you can try:
Seed the clouds with dry ice;
Try a rain dance. Suffice
It to say, if you fail you'll be dry.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
My chiropteran pet turned thirteen,
And the party I threw her was seen
By my buddy, who's Jewish,
As sort of a newish
Bat mitzvah. (You know what I mean?)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This belief gives a naturalist pause:
That the croc lets a bird walk its jaws.
The beast's motive's not mystical —
Ministrations dentistical?
She pecks twixt his teeth then withdraws?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The eradicator came to our house
To get rid of a ravenous mouse
Who'd devoured a rat
And ingested our cat
And was eying both me and my spouse.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Most Parisians might look askance
As the federalists hope for a chance
At departmental rule,
Since there's always some fool
Who would cling to old centralist France.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
With a strike like a fast-darting adder's,
He is flicking his way up the ladders
Of amateur sport
On the badminton court.
You might say that he's badass at badders.

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
If two different dyes have been blended
But you'd like them apart, as intended,
Chromatography's key:
Find a medium free
To choose one from the other.  It's mended.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
For the poor, I have emptied my hoard;
Into service, my life has been poured.
For my altruism here
(Can't you tell I'm sincere?)
I will reap an eternal reward.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
"Discriminately" doesn't explain
The way we burn bones. We maintain
And, in fact, guarantee
That, yes, all men are cre-
mated equal (so ghosts can't complain).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Blondie's writer, Chic Young, and two wits,
Burns and Allen, in comedy bits,
And Gene Rayburn, a game
Show emcee: what's the same?
They made fun of dumb Dora, that ditz.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Just your typical, average gal
Who exemplifies all women, Val
Is an everywoman.  She
Is the target, you see.
It's our marketing firm's rationale.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Quakers ban boozing and junk
When they're cruising to shoot at a punk.
Their Society's rule
Is "sobriety's cool."
That's why Friends don't let Friends drive by drunk.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
"See that none of your actions embarrasses.
Those slopes, like that tower in Paris's,
Are thousand-foot drops.
Do not run!  No fast stops."
Our whole class walked on air at the arrises.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
You're marketing locally, small.
Continentalize soon, sell to all.
From initial gestation,
You'll carpet the nation.
Competitors, brace for a brawl.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Dictionarians hold the position
Philologists seek from ambition.
But we harmless old drudges
Won't brook any fudges
To bring you a verse definition.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
I'm a custrel; I bear Sir Guy's armour.
He's so dashing—an absolute charmer!
At his lady's advance,
Watch him raise his great lance,
Which I note never fails to alarm 'er.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I got called up to Major League Ball—
A cup of coffee with Philly was all.
Seven days in "The Show"
(It's my hummer—too slow),
So goodbye to my place in the Hall.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
Where cumulative voting is done,
The one-vote-per-man meme we shun.
At the candidates' call
You could vote one for all,
Though they ask you to vote all for one.

limerick_list.author: cecelia
limerick_list.text:
An experienced hiker from Kent
Carried dubbin wherever she went.
"Its tallow and oil
Mean my boots never spoil
In the rain, and sore feet I prevent."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The upholsterer worked with great flair
But his heart attack caused quite a scare.
O'er the bed chair help hovered,
But he never recovered.
To this day the recliner lies bare.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Be there prey? Coccinellidae tarry.
Scarlet women? Nay, nay. Blessed Mary
Gave the name, for her cloak
Once was red. She bespoke
That bright garb for her ladybirds airy.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I won't ever accede to your wishes.
I want you to sleep with the fishes.
You want change for the worse
In my most perfect verse?
I'm afraid that I'd rather do dishes.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If you're taken to hospital, pray
You don't suffer what I did today.
Crawling out of that hedge,
I said, "Go, get a wedge;
Chock the wheels so I won't roll away."

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
You saw Ozzie while out on patrol?
I am sure he's just out for a stroll.	
Oh, please don't impound him,	
'Cause that's where I found him—
Our county's own Animal Control.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
OEDILF provides standards and guidelines.
Join in, don't just sit on the sidelines.
Good rhymes, jokes, and meter?
Your limerick's much sweeter!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm reviewing my friend's latest list,
And the bridesmaids she's chosen consist
Of pals Claire, Mare, and Cher.
I'm not there. Should I care?
I insist I was missed, and I'm pissed!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When I'm hosting our weekly affair,
It's a hub of activity there.
We've an evening of fun
At the center—the one
Our community built on the square.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A visiting vicar named Kenny
Liked mountains; he asked, "Have you any?"
The Monmouthshire deacons
Said, "Brecon's tall Beacons
Abound here in Abergavenny."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
An electric arc furnace is needed
For getting a charge quickly heated.
To tell you the truth,
I once arced a tooth
And, in melting my fillings, succeeded.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
If the feeling I'm feeling, my dove,
Isn't quite the same feeling as love,
You'll be willing, I trust,
To discover, in lust,
A contributive feature thereof.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For a squirrel, this rodent is big,
So it sits on a branch, not a twig.
It's less large than a fox,
Or an owl's nesting box,
And it's nowhere near big as a pig.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I am filled with profound apprehension.
It's a thing I perhaps shouldn't mention.
I opted for beans
When my host offered greens,
And I'll now pay the price of distension.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"No one cares for a big-worded guy.
You just said you'll absquatulate.  Why
Not speak plainly?"  "I mean,
To avoid being seen,
I'll vamoose without saying goodbye."

limerick_list.author: Miss Mimi
limerick_list.text:
Take some butter and melt it right down,
Gently heat till the solids turn brown
And then strain and you'll get—
Et voilà!—beurre noisette.
(Or the ghee of South Asian renown.)

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Some beans that agronomists love
Bear their fruit underground, and above.
Amphicarpous legumes
Spread some seeds with their blooms,
Keeping others secure in a glove.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
If you're building cob homes out of clay
And some straw, it is best that you pray
That good weather's expected
Till the roof is erected,
Lest the rain wash your work clean away.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Besiegers extracting surrenders
From fortified fortress defenders
Would aim at the sky
With their arbalests nigh:
Steel bows with mechanical benders.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
He will green-light that project today.
Let's spend dough on it, gals, right away,
Or else we might find
That he's changed his dumb mind
And  rescinded his drunken OK.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When you have to protest, yet you fear
That the backlash could end your career,
One solution applies:
You can fictionalize.
"No resemblance to anyone here."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Before novels appear in the shops,
This vocation's been plying its chops:
Bibliogony's books—
Their production, their looks—
An obscure art, but grant it its props.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
An ox who was feeling anoxic
Had been shod with a glue too epoxic.
The fumes were so toxic
The smell made his doc sick.
They carried both out in a box sick.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jack was steady, but now he's erratic—
Destabilization, dramatic!
"Jack, unless you get back
On your previous track,
You'll be shunned!" I said, stunned but emphatic.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The Fed sets the dread discount rate.
Who must pay?  Member banks — no debate.
That rate changes with time;
It can dip, it can climb.
That %? Now < .8.

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
A ceilometer's laser projector
Beams off clouds to a signal detector.
The system works nicely,
And measures precisely
The height of the sky-based deflector.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She's familiar; I've seen her before:
Those features, that laugh… and much more.
Mustn't gawk; I'll alarm her;
Be direct, and disarm her.
"Pardon me. Have you worked as a whore?"

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Before daybreak Roy's up in the stand
With an AR-15 (though it's banned).
He must bag something cervine
To take back to Irvine.
He'd bragged he'd have deer in each hand.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The blue riband is Patrick's, and that's
Why his ladyfriends shouted "Congrats!"
He's a breeder of felines.
The judges made beelines
To congratulate Pat and his cats.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A deft beadle named Bede loved to bead.
"To sew beads on a frock, pay me heed:
All you need's a strung needle
And beads," said the beadle,
Proceeding to bead with great speed.

limerick_list.author: Meps Schulte
limerick_list.text:
The distraught Cajun chef cried out, "Phooey!
My dishes need sausage that's chewy.
I'd load up my fork
With hot chilis and pork
If I only could find good andouille."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Brothers Four jumped on the scene
With a song about fields that, once green,
Became parched by the sun —
Almost made number one.
Then they sang for the big and small screen.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When you're riding your horse in the street,
Keep in mind you should keep the street neat.
Use the poop bag called "Catch It!"
(No other bags match it)
Or you'll catch it from cops on the beat.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
There are sounds that are clear and distinct,
Like the twang of a banjo when plinked,
Or the snap of a stalk,
Or the pop of a cork,
Or the chinking of crystal that's clinked.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
From the sides of the road, they keep growing,
And the confluent puddles are flowing
Into one, a smooth stream
In the headlights' bright gleam.
Traffic stops. It's not safe to keep going.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
A nutcase (or so I have heard),
Who owned and kept many a bird,
Would feed his poor parrots
On hundreds of carrots,
Which may well be rated absurd.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An adsorbable substance like gas
Can have molecules stick to, say, glass
Via chemical forces.
This process, of course, is
A bummer when methane-to-ass.

limerick_list.author: wikisaur
limerick_list.text:
Just -blooded means nothing—I'm blunt—
Unless you add something up front.
Try red, blue or hot.
Then what have you got?
A word that's a word, not a grunt.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Whether babies or papas and mamas,
All camels, alpacas and llamas
Are camelids: creatures
With insolent features
And a taste for expectorant dramas.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When we cotise the bends, that refines
The escutcheon, enhancing its lines.
Narrow stripes on the pales
And the bars—such details
Are the stuff of heraldic designs.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
Said his mother to clever young Fred:
"On Monday, I heard that you said
That your teacher was dying—
She's alive! You were lying!
You're in trouble, young man. Go to bed!"

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
He thought dipping tobacco would mean
He'd stay safe from the cancer he'd seen.
But although he's still young,
Surgeons cut out his tongue:
A glossectomy done on a teen.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"I'm bowled over," I said of her quest
To shed 70 pounds.  "I'm impressed!
It would sure be a wonder
Were I ever under
200!  Too much I ingest."

limerick_list.author: woozy
limerick_list.text:
Of foods, I like meat best of all.
I'll eat it each day in the fall.
But when winter's near spent,
I'll forego it for Lent,
So I'll binge one last time: CAR-NI-VAL!!!!!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bovine Bessie was taught to play soccer
In hopes she'd become a great blocker,
But her poor World Cup play
Caused her coaches to say,
"That's the ballgame!  Go clean out your locker!"

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
My bank account statement today
Proves my checkbook's in gross disarray.
The bank knows I've no money.
Do they think that it's funny
To charge me more fees I can't pay?

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
When a Briton says awlbird to you,
Then their dialect's rural ('tis true).
Well, a woodpecker (green)
May well be what they've seen;
Or an avocet, just wading through.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Not long after photos began,
One "type" was a flash in the pan.
Daguerre had a winner,
And tin-types were thinner,
So ambrotype's glass "also-ran."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
To the O.E.D.I.L.F. — Hi.
I have kidnapped your Editor guy.
All your members must pay
Fifty dollars today
Or you'll bid Chris J. Strolin goodbye.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
I'm genetically prone to not fuss,
And I'm happy and try not to cuss,
'Cause my blood type, you see,
Means I've antigen B:
B positive (written B+).

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
What's the name of the tanker that banked
On a reef where it grounded and tanked?
The ship, if you please,
Was the Exxon Valdez.
'Mongst the worst US spills ever ranked.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
As a youth, no one's future was brighter.
Now Joe's shiftless; some call him a blighter.
He's a pest and a cad.
There's no good with the bad?
Well, in bar brawls he's sure a fine fighter!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Find the tenderest flesh, so discreet
In diaphanous film, such a treat;
By this carpel excited,
My craving's requited:
A segment of citrus, how sweet!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the cleanup that followed the flood,
We became well acquainted with mud,
But what came through the door
And was caked on the floor?
I would have to describe it as crud.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Something horrid and cold in my den
Makes me shiver all over and then
I let out a loud "brrr!"
Did you hear that? A whirr
Like a wing flap—it's whirring again...!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The alarm's been turned off for the day.
Our caper's afoot — underway.
We'll use cat-like-tread stealth
To regift Walter's wealth.
Just how large the largesse, I can't say.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am sure I will never forget
When I first got to use a curette.
While removing the tumor,
I tried to use humor,
And bombed, to my lasting regret.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Brontology's just not for you.
Your discontent rumbles; you're blue.
Brontophobia means
That this fear's in your genes.
Quit your thunderstorm chasing; you're through.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Of impssbly 'brvtd words,
Advt's reduced by two-thirds.
It means "advertisement."
Take under advisement:
Pronouncing it's just for the birds.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The absolute scale, we can see,
Starts at absolute zero; so we
May consider it pleasing
That water starts freezing
At a temp of 273!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"'Tis full wild, a great Desert," he wrote,
"Full of Bears and huge Trees. We did float
Down the River, our Craft
A small, quickly built Raft,
Hoping Beasts could not reach our poor Boat."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Bivalent suggests room for two:
O or S, two electrons too few;
Or an antigen might
Plug an alternate site.
Twin or double? Perhaps with a view?

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
My benefits package is tiny:
No Mercedes for me, big and shiny,
Or a huge pension pot.
I'm a very small shot,
Who is taking it right up the heinie.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Walk across raging falls with no  net—
Just how wild can one aerialist get?
Charles Blondin, crazy Gaul
(Never once did he fall),
Did it seventeen times. What a set!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Without any scolding or chiding,
My ardor for you is abiding.
With you shall I stick
Through both skinny and thick
(Though my back might engage in some sliding).

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
What's accordion-like?  You will see:
Think repetitive pleats — that's the key.
Picture W, or
If you need any more,
Picture vvvvvvv.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Were the earth to revolve n:1
On its annual trip 'round the sun,
Then the years wouldn't leap
Each quadrennial sweep —
Making common years special to none.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Ahio and Uzzah—they "drave
The new cart." Uzzah acted to stave
Off a tumble. God slew
Him. Ahio thought, "Whew!
Nearly touched the Ark, too—a close shave!"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Great-aunt Philly's remarks, always telling
(To obsessive-compulsives, compelling),
Are quite mad, but that helps,
Since old Auntie's a Phelps
Who makes maxims on kelps deck her dwelling.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I'd be happy to cast the first stone
At the lender who's now on the phone
For his boring oration
On amortization.
I wish he would leave me a loan.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
STR is a check for a stroke.
Make it FAST or the victim may croak.
Smile and Talk, Raise both arms —
Fail just one, sound alarms!
Assume fire at the first sign of smoke.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Clean my wound and remove the detritus.
You will find I have diaphysitis
In my femur. The shaft
Is infected. You're daft
If you think that my pain's from arthritis.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Said the chair of the Back-Handers' Board:
"I'm entitled to call myself 'Lord',
And my wife's now a Lady.
Activities shady
Have paid me this handsome reward."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Calsilica (new kind of stone?)
Has a rainbow of hues all its own.
Used for jewels and beads,
This new substance succeeds
In adopting a mystical tone.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Archimedean solid? We'll make
One by carving this cube — piece of cake!
For a cubo-octahedron,
Fourteen faces we need, Ron;
Cutting corners is what it will take.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
If you want to make veggies au gratin,
Some breadcrumbs and cheese must be gotten.
A French language fan
Will prefer oh grah-TAN.
Just don't skimp on sharp cheese; put a lot in!

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
My best dish in the factory canteen
Is porridge.  Sez Dad, "Do you mean
That your favourite course is
A grain grown for horses?"
"No fodder," I say. "Oat cuisine!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm dizzy, I'm sore and uneasy.
I'm feverish, headachy, queasy,
With cramps in my gut,
And a pain in my butt.
Guess I'm feeling a little diseasy.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Darryl's done Carol wrong.  So, clean Carol
Gets his gun.  She is careful the barrel
Is wiped free of grime,
And then, in her own time,
Carol flips, through the heart, dirty Darryl.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Church services messed with her head:
Too long, and too boringly led.
Three years old, indiscreet,
And with young itchy feet,
"Shall we make this the last hymn?" she said.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
On a mountain top, outstretching arms
Spreading blessings on Rio are charms
Of the  Cristo Redentor,
Who stands as a mentor,
A symbol that helps ward off harms.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
As my track record must go to show,
At dependableness I'm a pro.
If perchance you should phone
To request a small loan,
