You can count upon me to say no.

limerick_list.author: limarico
limerick_list.text:
Don't beat 'round the bush or be murky.
Got some beef with surviving on jerky?
No back-packing dude
Who depends on this food
Will be able to quit it cold turkey.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A salad was waiting to toss
As I roasted a quail for my boss.
Deep in butter and flour,
I expended an hour.
What the hell; béchamel is great sauce.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Ethnobotanists seek to explain,
And to place in the public domain,
How we folks all relate
To our plants, and to state
The new knowledge we all thus attain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His chemical secret, a suberate,
Is so cheap that his stockpiles exuberate.
They help him make plastic
The world deems fantastic,
Which, in turn, makes his ego extuberate.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
A room full of aromaticity
May detract from perceived domesticity.
  Maybe friends feel entombed
  When your room's too perfumed,
And perhaps they will fear eccentricity.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"In my ark," said old Noah, "I try
To be witty, ironic, and wry.
As I sail o'er the main
In perpetual rain,
It is best that my humor stay dry."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Belatedly, let me just say:
"Happy birthday to you!  Hip hooray!"
I forgot (damn and blast it!)
And now you are past it:
You're thirty years old and a day.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
As the girls wander by where he sits,
That old birdwatcher's keeping his wits.
With binoculars trained
At the trees, he explained
To those birds what he meant by "Nice tits!"

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
To determine Earth's shape and its size,
And find points 'neath its beautiful skies,
There's a branch of applied
Mathematics I tried:
It's geodesy. (Now I feel wise.)

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
Now there's no need to get hoity-toity
'Bout the state known as  allopolyploidy:
Means you've two haploid sets.
Feeling hapless? Well let's
Just forget it and look at the boidie.

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
Among elk, chronic wasting disease
Will progress over time, by degrees.
As the prions put strain
On the nerves of the brain
It can bring a whole herd to its knees.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The act of incessant complaining,
That it's cold, or it's hot, or it's raining —
Continual harping
On details is carping.
Such moaning is not entertaining.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Said a fair-minded lady named Claire,
"With the kids, my attentions I'll share,
And  to treat each the same
Is the name of the game.
All my tykes I shall take to the fair."

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
The limerick form is concise.
Its rules, quite precise, should suffice.
Remember, be terse
When composing the verse
And don't be a smut-case.  Be nice!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
What's an Amsterdam folk-dance? A clog kick.
What's a flying pig launched by? A hog kick.
And a lad's lower limbs,
As they move while he swims
Doing breaststroke, describe this: a frog kick.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My belly band (cholera belt)
Is six feet of red flannel. It's felt,
By the brass and my mum,
That warming my tum
Prevents diarrhœa. I'll melt.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a drug lab that some call muy bueno
In the East Texas city of Plano.
They make Christmas tree meth,
Yet I'd think you'd risk death
Taking drugs that were made out of Drano.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
As you see, my physique is a mess,
So I'll bench press and cause myself stress.
Pile the weights on the bar
And I'll push them up far;
If I can't rack it up, I'll try less.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With kudos, the critics express
Their opinions  of Thomas Adès*.
The Tempest wins praise
As an opera that pays—
It's attained an amazing success.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
A dyslexic agnostic from Prague
Used to wonder while out on a jog,
 "Is there someone above
  Looking down? I'd sure love
To know whether there's really a dog."

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
From the acotyledons, we learn
That some plants like a moss or a fern
Have no seed leaves, and so,
When they're starting to grow,
Have no stored food to which they can turn.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
An adjective dye needs some care
Else you'll find that your colour's not there!
Left untreated, no doubt,
It will fade or wash out—
Use a mordant to keep your cloth fair.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Conservatively speaking we're toast:
We've a week left to live, at the most.
For our water supply
Is about to run dry,
And our food?  It just gave up the ghost.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A fish hawk, a large bird of prey,
May reside near a river or bay.
This osprey, a captor
Of fish—a strong raptor—
Serves her chicks a fine seafood buffet.

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
It's bloatware, this program I'm using,
With features profuse and confusing.
It takes minutes to save
When the thing does behave,
And I weep at the disk space I'm losing.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are local armed forces on hand
For the brushfire action we've planned.
It's a small-scale assault
On the rebels to halt
Their incursions and take back some land.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The bill-board on board of a ship,
By securing the cuspidate tip
Of the anchor, aweighing,
Prevents it from swaying
And causing the timbers to chip.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
From Denmark, I travel by air
To the White House (I stay the night there).
Full of apathy, next
I reply to the text
"What's your flight plan?" with "DKDC".

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Air your lungs; it will do you no good—
Can't imagine whyever it should.
All that piercing profanity!
Some question your sanity.
You're bound to be misunderstood.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
The Dramamine tablets I swallowed
Had little effect on what followed.
I was heaving like heck
On the slick, heaving deck.
Now my stomach feels empty and hollowed.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"Well, Cam Roy, am I Mayor Macllew?"
"O Democrats' non-star, come, do!
Not New York," Roy went on,
"Now Sahoto has 'Won'...
Oh, who came to vote, Mac, oh who?"

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
That Baer was a bear of a man—
He could knock you right flat on your can.
Though it's silly, his son
Played a hillbilly, one
With a Maximum get-girls-quick plan.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
This chromo is rare. It's antique—
With its frame, what collectors all seek.
In their time, these were cheap
Color prints. With a leap,
A new process came in at their peak.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
A motto that's presently shared
By the Boy Scouts was loudly declared
When a tenderfoot tyke
Fixed the horn on his bike
And then proudly announced, "Beep repaired."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
This appurtenance (pathway with gates)
Now a legal free passage creates.
Thus I may cross the land
With no payment in hand,
A provision the landowner hates.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A dog, without pause or deflection,
Will solve any maze to perfection.
One sniff, and he legs it
Direct to the exit—
Amazing, the scents of direction.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A double-wide packed full of grass
Is not what you might think, alas.
It's a paper that's big
For a head who's a pig
Or who's failing his joint-rolling class.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A buddleboy washes the ore
In a lead or a tin mine. What's more,
He maintains all the vats
For top management. That's,
In few words, what a buddleboy's for.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I'll expose all the facts by declaring,
While stripping off clothes that I'm wearing,
That nudity's great;
But I'm aged ninety-eight,
And what little I've left's not for sharing.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
"I am dovish but devious," said Thor.
"Open conflict I really abhor:
Like a dove I shall coo
While I undermine you:
Getting even sure beats getting sore!"

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
Way up on your horse you may sit,
Looking noble, I have to admit.
But you're going so fast,
To the ground you'll be cast,
So you'd better pull hard on that bit.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Balsam poplar is found in a glade.
In its buds, sticky resin is made.
It's a tree called the hackmatack,
And sometimes the tacmahack,
And it's planted a lot for its shade.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
When he'd killed the last cat found in Britain,
Kenny's karma caught up, so it's written.
He'd have paid a fair packet
To have a cork jacket,
But he didn't, and drowned like a kitten.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A back for the Packers or Cards
Looks for cracks and then racks up the yards.
As his label conveys,
He begins all the plays
From in back of the tackles and guards.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"First designed by a weaver named Victor,
It's much like the double constrictor.
It's the boa knot, men."
She has screwed up again.
I'm afraid that I must contradict her.

limerick_list.author: lopey
limerick_list.text:
The artilleryman called his command.
"The shelling's proceeding as planned."
"No it ain't," was replied.
"'Cause we all nearly died,
For you're targeting right where I stand!"

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Some composers, as everyone knows,
Borrow money as well as compose.
Richard Wagner is yet
The most deeply in debt,
While Hector, of course, Berlioz.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
In my gang that controls this whole town,
Many gangsters of wicked renown
Have cool names — like "Big Luke",
"Jim the Brain" and "The Duke";
And there's me, of course, "Fatso the Clown".

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The period's power's amazing!
It can bring to a grinding halt phrasing.
See! It's done it right there!
Cut me off in mid-air!
It's a stroppy full stop that I'm praising!

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Got the giggles — not hard to explain;
Nervous laughter flowed out as though rain.
Uncontrollable, then
If it happens again,
Let's just chuckle as one, not complain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The queen mother (a lady who'd been a queen)
Caught a fever with chills that chagrin a queen;
There's no need for hysteria,
We can treat her malaria
With atabrine (also called quinacrine).

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Ice down in the ground makes it shake;
My home rattles, there's noise like a quake.
With fast temperature drops
There are booms, bangs and pops:
These cryoseisms shock me awake.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A pharmacist, feeling concoctive,
Mixed some hormones he'd got overstocked of.
Now he's shocked and appalled
That he's suddenly bald,
While his voice has been raised by an octave.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
"I'm so sorry—I needed to climb
Up this ladder. Is that a big crime?
Well, I do beg your pardon"
(She was nude in her garden),
"But the view from up here is sublime!"

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
I'd rather play tennis with cheaters
Than baseliners, simple retreaters
Who won't play the net.
Not a drop do they sweat,
Though they'd surely all swear they sweat liters.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Two tailors had taken a chance
When my record they chose to advance.
Their marketing ploy
Is a winner. Oh, boy!
An album with two pair of pants!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
I'm making a soup-of-the-day,
But it needs some more dill, and I may
Add some anise seed, or
Just a pinch of "du jour,"
Which enhances the flavor, they say.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
When an earthquake takes place underground,
Straight above's where its epicenter's found.
Often wreckage here's shattering…
At times, just a smattering.
Earth's crust conducts shock waves around.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Thinking marriage, with Amy beguiled,
He inquired if she carried his child.
He decided to fly
At her only reply:
Ambiguously silent, she smiled.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
My limericks of late are so lame
That I feel a profound sense of shame.
They just don't make the grade,
And, you know, I'm afraid
That the one you're now reading's the same.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Read the sign, "Anatomical Wonders!"
That's what carneys parade as God's blunders.
One's a girl with a beard
Who's just gawked at and jeered;
One's an "ogre," whose flatulence thunders.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A codger who lived through the Crash
Is terribly close with his cash.
He tips in small trickles
Of pennies and nickels,
Lamenting each dent in his stash.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Copenhagen's where mad Karsten Phælps
Walks his Danes, both the great ones and whelps.
In the port, shoppers frown;
With those dogs in the town,
You don't have to look down but it hjælps!

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
There are too many nurses not there,
Because hospital coffers are bare.
Therefore patients are lying
Untended and dying.
It's not because nurses don't care.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
While mothers can act really tough,
Here's a mother who's rigid and rough.
She's the rein on your brain,
Sends the blood down to drain,
And she hoards juicy, fluidy stuff.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Tasty cheese in a pancake, a blintz is
A dish that can captivate princes.
Learn to cook! Be proactive!
Great cooks are attractive!"
Says Grandma. Her logic convinces.

limerick_list.author: DJ Letz and Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
Old MacBride wooed a fair Irish girl:
"I'll serve haggis and teach you to curl.
I'll mince guts from a sheep,
And you'll learn how to sweep."
She replied, "I'll show you how to hurl."

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Three meanings of bite I'll present:
The effect of a wind's discontent,
The corrosion that's sketched
When a metal is etched,
And the stamp of machines that indent.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
In the contest, Miss Archer's fine bow
Helped her humble her masculine foe.
It was not just the score
That he looked silly for,
But the arrow she'd lodged in his toe.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In Flatbush, the Lords led the way
At the cheerleading contest one day,
From the baron of "rah"
Through the duke of "huzzah"
To the prize-winning oil of "olé."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
There are large herds of cows, schools of whales,
Flocks of sheep with a tremble of tails.
When the Phelps family gather,
They're all in a lather:
A turmoil of Phelpses prevails.

limerick_list.author: saranita and Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
Understanding his speech was a pain.
(Was the problem his mouth or his brain?)
Though the kid was a star,
Buckwheat's words were bizarre!
You should take them with salt (just a grain).

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The costumes! The colour! The songs!
Oh, the stage is where glamour belongs,
While the orchestra's swell
Casts a magical spell
On the dancers in glittery thongs.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
A chemtrail's a trail in the sky
That's left by a plane flying by.
Conspiracists say
It's a secretive way
To control folks — but that's just a lie.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
Coordinators organize plans,
Balance schedules, and issue commands.
They're the ones in control
Of achieving a goal—
Work gets done when it's put in their hands.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
While in Paris she made coq au vin —
She cooked chicken she stewed in a pan.
Next she added some wine,
Drank the rest, felt just fine,
Then went out and she found her a man.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Can a bull who eats meat be a can-a-bull?
If his access is barred, is he ban-a-bull?
If he's out for a run
Far too long in the sun,
Might one side of his hide become tan-a-bull?

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The ship sank, now its cargo is flotsam,
And, because it was floating, we caught some.
It was steaks—how delish!
We were tired of fish,
So who cares if they'd started to rot some?

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When Beckett was over the hill
His wit made the odd stirrings still.
He held 'less is more'
For a truth, but his score
Never changed—Questions: one, Answers: nil.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Wife the first could make great date-nut bread.
"But the cost of supplies means," she said,
"First the dates have to go,
Then the nuts." So you know
Why wife two now makes date bread instead.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
An apple-cheeked lassie named Milly
Got fatigued from these questions so silly:
"Are those red cheeks you have
Just a rash?  Need some salve?"
So she always gave answers quite chilly.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If the serious drinker's fulfilment
Is the act, and result, of distilment,
Then consider how Jack
Came adrift from the track
When he found out exactly what Jill meant.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Diathermanous, -thermal, or -thermic
Means pervious—ova to spermic?
No, to radiant heat:
Sun can warm up your feet,
Since our atmosphere's not pachydermic.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Clearly named for its route of transmission
Is the enterovirus. Position?
Most go straight through the gut.
Maybe keep your mouth shut
If you want to stay well—good ambition!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
In west Africa, hard itchy lumps
They call craw-craw left Joe in the dumps.
In this case, a kindness:
It's not river-blindness —
I resolve to drink only from pumps.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Hey, man. Can ya lend me a lid?
My ol' lady took off with the kid.
Dig, that doobie is fat.
Man, how groovy is that?
All for me? I sure dig what you did!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This cuisine's not for me; it's the pits:
Filled with sharp-tasting, bitterish bits
Of radicchio, kale—
Sides of rhubarb-grilled snail—
Not to mention arugula grits.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
This project to some seems absurd.
It's outrageous, or so I have heard.
It's bizarre, I agree,
But what is plain to me
Is insane is the apposite word.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Akiba ben Joseph was known
For rabbinical studies, his own.
As a sage and a martyr,
Not many were smarter.
Aggadic midrashim he'd hone.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Coralligenous reefs are too few.
Don't steal coral, I'm begging of you!
It's a loathsome mistake
Since replacements can take
Sometimes decades to grow back anew.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
I'm not yellow —  I'm merely faint-hearted:
Avoid trouble, and leave 'fore it's started.
Bad things heading my way?
Without further delay,
 I am gone. On the road. Now departed.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The fur cover I lifted and sat,
While regarding the knitted pink hat
That we put on the spare
Roll of paper. But where
Went that slippery pedestal mat?

limerick_list.author: Jeff Bremer
limerick_list.text:
The Kodiak lives life alone,
Which sometimes evokes a sad moan.
His voice is so deep
Even fellow bears weep
Upon hearing his baritone groan.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She's aloft on his hands — she's sixteen —
When her dad stumbles onto the scene.
"You seemed calm," says her coach,
With a glare of reproach,
"When I said I was benching Colleen."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Old-time autos, you'd crank them to start.
Then electrical rescue, so smart!
Your car battery's there,
That lead-acid affair;
No more risking attack of the heart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm in love with a guy, and I'm frantic.
He has journeyed across the Atlantic.
Will he ever come back?
Lest my sanity crack,
I'll consult with a quack chiromantic.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Douglas Corrigan left for L.A.
On a flight of just over one day.
But his flight plan was troublin';
He landed in Dublin,
Then claimed he had flown the wrong way.

limerick_list.author: C Wayne R
limerick_list.text:
There he goes in his brand new Toyota
To the townships of South Minnesota.
He's allotted, this day,
Some birds made from clay,
And of these he will shoot his full quota.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
When conducting the patrons please make
Every effort to bypass the fake
Rembrandt drawings; they're not
What the curator thought
He was buying—he made a mistake.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Curtains closed, I shall lie on my bed
With this damn blinding pain in my head:
Intense agony! Hey,
It will not go away;
Makes me long for the sleep of the dead!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Collectibles: things of a kind
Such as Hummels, or teapots you find.
But the space that they use
Gives my sweetheart the blues,
So it's coins to which I've been inclined.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
The flatheaded whale that I've tracked
For a year has me feeling quite cracked.
Ate a fiver right out
Of my wallet! I doubt
That I'll get either finback intact!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
That geneticist does lots of screens.
There's so many I know what it means.
Though each test she does daunts me,
I'm willing—she wants me!
She's trying to get in my genes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Her pregnancy seemed to be fine,
But since Friday I've seen a decline.
I believe she is bleeding
Inside, as I'm reading
The darkening ring—Cullen's sign.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'm behind the times; some say I'm square
And old-fashioned.  I really don't care.
I'm content as I go
Through life not in the know
Of what's currently happ'ning out there.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
The gas tank is where my plane's storing
The fuel I need to go soaring.
If I fill it today,
I can fly a long way:
More than six hundred miles of exploring.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Henry Bliss from a streetcar had stepped
To be crushed by a taxi. Folks wept.
He was first from the States
For "Next Stop: Pearly Gates,"
In a way that, today, we accept.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
A toilet that's clean is a treat.
So your flusher should always look neat.
If you happen to sprinkle
While doing a tinkle,
Be gracious and wipe down the seat.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I know a deboner, Jack Jones,
Whose sole task is to separate bones
From the flesh of things dead.
Jack once jokingly said,
"I'm unbothered when one of 'em moans."

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
We use numerous things to attach
Things that break, like a rubbery patch
Or some glue or some string,
'Cause we all tend to cling
To those heirlooms that fate tries to snatch.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
There's a spot in your eye where you'll find
That no light-sensing cells are assigned,
So your brain just expounds: it
Is like what surrounds it.
Where nerve meets with disc, you are blind.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At a palace one sultry July
Near Paree, a jeune fille caught my eye.
She bewitched me that day
And I fell right away
En amour. It was love at Versailles.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Should I sue my new boss (my employer)
'Cause he fondled my breasts in the foyer
As we boarded the lift?
I suspect he was squiffed."
"You've a right to be miffed. See a lawyer!"

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
My scrotum expands and contracts
As its subsurface muscle reacts
To the heat and the cold.
It's the dartos, I'm told,
That accounts for these shape-shifting facts.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a syndrome called GRANDDAD around
That is not very widely renowned.
This misnomer, I'd say,
Is just barely okay.
Pediatrics is where it is found.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
If your drinkware is made out of glass,
It's called glassware: a wide-ranging class
Filled with jars, jugs and mugs,
Also bowls, bongs for drugs,
Pots and pints, steins and stemware en masse.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
She thought I had mammary lust
When I asked her to show me her bust.
She had one in her den.
I was dumbfounded when
She agreed and said, "Fine.  If I must."

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
Suitcase packed and the door hinges soaped;
Tyrant father asleep, as she'd hoped.
Just at midnight, her beau
Brought the carriage, and so
She clandestinely fled and eloped.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
I recall from my chemistry class,
That on earth there are three kinds of mass:
Stone-like solids are set,
Molten liquids are wet,
And there's smoke-like, untouchable gas.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though Dorado's not famous for size,
There's a sight for astronomers' eyes
Where it swims round the pole:
LMC (not the whole)
Is a jewel of southerly skies.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An antileukemic-type drug
Can't kill off a virus or bug.
It's a treatment for cancer
Of blood cells—the answer
For kids who need more than a hug.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Martin bragged that he races a car,
But his car doesn't go very far.
First I thought: "He's a gagster!"
But he's really a dragster—
At drag racing Martin's a star.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Multi-lingual instruction's the rule
At our Anglo-vernacular school.
The old dean, a Bengali,
Thinks the concept pure folly.
He's an obdurate, insular mule.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
My art is eclectic and I
Know that many will pass it right by.
But of critics I'm leery:
I can't stand when they query,
"Did you really do this—and, pray, why?"

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
He is Canada's Johnny Canuck,
A woodsman cartoon run amok.
Through the war Johnny came,
Then made hockey his game:
A new team with his name brought them luck.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Explication is when you make sense
Of what's muddy or complex or dense.
You explain, take a bow.
Pellucidity's how
To dispense what is what, why and whence.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
He's bourgeois and he's dull and he's Pootery
And his journeys are mainly commutery;
But he's off to French shores,
Where he's heard they cure bores,
For a fare that is known as charcuterie.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Tip O'Neill exclaimed, "Bah! Gerry Ford's
A Republican leader. Accord's
Not their style: Won't propose;
They just always oppose —
Those 'againster' contrarian hordes."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The councilmen, all aldermanic,
Are driving the townsfolk to panic:
"These women who revel
Are serving the devil!
Assail 'em or Salem's satanic!"

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Dress whites, says the plan-of-the-day.
Full honors for those passed away.
Piped over the side,
In God's deep they abide —
The warship gets back under way.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Beefaroni," my mother would say,
"As canned pasta is barely OK.
The brand name that I see
Looks like grading to me,
Since it's clearly not Chef Boy-Ar-A!"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
What help art thou needing to bed me?
Which surface assists for to spread ye?
Will haystacks suffice?
Would this carpette be nice?
Doth mine bed on its bedstead bestead thee?

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
A comma provides a short pause
In a list, or before a new clause,
While a coma's a deep,
Sometimes shock-induced, sleep.
(Semicolon abuse is one cause.)

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
I played the front nine like a pro
(That's hole 1 through hole 9) and then whoa!
On the 10th, broke my putter;
Resolve turned to butter,
Lost aim, lost the match, lost my dough.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
It exhilarates me when I swim;
Makes me happy and fills me with vim.
So I can't understand
That man covered in sand,
Looking drowned: there's no vim about him.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In the back of the book, sneak a peek
At the problem solutions you seek.
If deterred by your task,
There's a nerd you can ask:
Meet your date, "Trigonometry Geek".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"To remove all your cancer's my goal,"
Said my surgeon, the good Doctor Cole,
"So you'll have a cecostomy
(Called a typhlostomy)
From skin to the cecum, a hole."

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
Nine strikes on one pitch? A cartoon!
But in Major League Baseball there soon
Was a saver — the top —
And his change seemed to stop,
His Bugs Bunny change-up — a boon.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
All these cakes! White and chocolate and spice,
Apple, angel food, carrot—how nice!
Then there's devil's food, coffee,
Red velvet, and toffee—
I'll savor each sugary slice!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In a mine, after hauling out ore,
Lengths of lumber are stacked from the floor
In a "log cabin" style,
Made to form a strong pile
To the roof, which this cribbing will shore.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What does Chock Full o' Nuts mean to me?
A hot beverage that's clearly not tea.
It's a store that debuted
To sell early fast food.
It's the state of my family tree.

limerick_list.author: geekwraith
limerick_list.text:
There once was a lass from Nantucket
Who'd sit with a chicken and bucket.
The biddy would squall
And the maiden would bawl
For the still-living bird, as she'd pluck it.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Define Devastator? Name of a plane,
And two vessels which once sailed the main,
Superheroes with pluck,
And a big monster truck,
Plus a peak in volcanic terrain.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Sure, I called you a butt-head; it's true.
It's genetic, so what can you do?
Try to sprout horns forever:
A futile endeavor…
But you'll shine in my famous veal stew.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
As a Cub Scout, Matt's learned to camp out
And fillet and pan fry a fresh trout.
He can tie a fine knot,
Give first aid on the spot,
And track all the Brownies about.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
We had rested that night by the bank
Of a river, although it was dank.
In the dark came a rattle
And one of our cattle
Was caught by a monstrous afanc.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Cyrus spends thousands on trifles.
Yes, he'll splurge; there's no urge that he stifles.
He feels fortunate, for
Seems there's always a war,
And his fortune's been made selling rifles.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A380's the biggest jet yet:
With this new superjumbo, you get
Over five hundred seats,
But the crowding defeats
The pleasures of travel by jet.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Old Fred Sanford was dad and the boss.
Son Lamont, meanwhile, worked like a hoss.
"Big dummy!"  "Old fool!"
Their exchanges were cruel
As they bartered the junk folks would toss.

limerick_list.author: agingjb
limerick_list.text:
He's in prison; his treason was base.
It's a very long sentence he'll face.
But here's a surprise:
A pardon. How wise!
Said the monarch: "That's my act of grace."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
On the checkerboard, one grain of wheat
On the first square, then double.  Repeat.
This will come to a stop —
You'll deplete the world's crop
Long before the last square is complete.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
In my childhood my hair was antrorse,
Which occasioned regret and remorse.
Combs and grease were no good:
It defiantly stood.
Now it's thinned, and has lost all its force.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Encephalic gray stuff in one's cranium
Is treasured like gold or uranium.
Humans made gains
From incredible brains.
Try to buy 'em? They're plain "unobtainium"!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though a cotton gin once laid him low,
Peg Leg Bates made significant dough,
Up from nickles and dimes
To the 22 times
He appeared on Ed Sullivan's show.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
How proudly you carry the flag
For the hero you claim that I "slag".
You have not read an ounce
Of the work you denounce,
Yet you want to fit me with a gag.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I hope I'll be able to sell a
Tiny orchid plant named Dryadella.
Some like blooms large in size;
War and Peace these guys prize.
I need fellas who'd buy a novella.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With my fiberless diet, I skulk
To the toilet to struggle and sulk.
For more roughage, I'm told,
Get a cereal sold
By the name of Incredible Bulk.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
There was once a fine speaker from Wales
Who enraptured his pub mates with tales.
Every person who heard
Would not dare miss a word
Of his stories, which came with free ales.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"The plot of this script's a surprise—
A magician's adventures," Di cries.
"It's a show we can serialize.
Watch the guy dematerialize—
Disappear right in front of your eyes!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"We're consenting adults.  We're of age,
Thus by law, old enough to engage
In all manner of sex."
"It's the aftereffects.
We've not reached that emotional stage."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Most folks, after coughing up phlegm,
Tend to swallow discreetly. ("Ahem!")
But some teens find it fitting
For hawking and spitting:
"This loogie's the crème de la crème."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
The Bavarian Germans are fine,
For their Alpine behaviour's like mine —
Well, except for the way
In emergencies they
Never phone till they've cried, "Nein nein nein!"

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
This comparison, soon you'll have sensed,
Could perhaps have been slightly condensed:
When there's info to air,
Using data with care,
Try this phrase to compare: as against.

limerick_list.author: Dixon Wragg
limerick_list.text:
You should "get down and boogie," they say.
But where can one get down today?
Well, if you're in luck,
You can find a soft duck
Called an eider, and just pluck away!

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Leave your cities of concrete and grime.
Be immersed in Italia's soft clime.
Our food is delicious,
The prospects auspicious,
And our dolce far niente's sublime!

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Caveman Dana was tired of meat
That was raw, and he wanted to eat
Something roasted quite through
And more easy to chew,
Mumbling, "Cookfires—they'll give us heat..."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Well, John Ash says disgoring's "dispelling;
Dispersing a (horse's sore) swelling".
What a lexical hash!
Send this "word" to the trash:
Its missed g's a misspelling I'm smelling.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
To ground chickpeas (or gram), he adds spices
And some onion he quite finely slices.
At "A Taste of the Raj" he
Will deep-fry each bhaji
To serve before curries and rices.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Bananas are yellow and bent.
From more tropical climes they are sent,
So some bunches could hide a
Tarantula spider
To crawl through your kitchen in Kent.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's an acne that's called keratosa,
And another, medicamentosa
(The first—horny plugs,
The second—from drugs),
Seen from Boston to West Santa Rosa.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Call me "meddling," but this must be said:
Your mutt's fleaing her rump on your bed.
They'll no longer bug Rover;
They're scattered all over.
You'll have long, itchy evenings ahead.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The Brit sent back beer at the pub
And yelled, "Waiter, you've managed to flub!
This mug is a stein!
Is this Germany?  Nein!
Bring a tankard, you ignorant schlub!"

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
They'll be taught not to give us the sack. Ban
Their business, boys. We must attack! Ban
Their boats: an embargo
On all of their cargo.
Yes lads, let us call for a black ban.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Cried a Taliban soldier, "Stay out
Of affairs you know nothing about!
All our killing is done
For the most holy One.
We're not madmen; we're merely devout!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I watch Paul play football, I'm humbled—
Even when he's played poorly and fumbled.
He kept dropping the ball?
I don't mind it at all.
I've just called him a dumbbell and grumbled.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
A specific sub-species of bloke
Was a -gory: a -gill or a -gloak.
(James H. Vaux, who loved spinnin' 'em,
Says it's their synonym:
English, mate, as she were spoke.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Pled Medusa, "Please give me a do —
No salon will my dreadlocks shampoo!"
"No — your head bred splendiferous
Snakes: colubriferous
Clients cause hullaballoo."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
San Francisco's famed cable cars creep
Up some hills that make acrophobes weep.
"Get a grip" is their hope
As they head down the slope;
The declivitous street is so steep.

limerick_list.author: operadirector
limerick_list.text:
I've a fear of enclosures too small.
I just can't go inside them at all.
I keep telling my shrinks
Claustrophobia stinks
And the therapy's making me bawl!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A parachute jumper he's not.
In this movie, no airplane you'll spot.
There's no free-falling guy
Dropping out of the sky.
That's a chutist.  This shootist gets shot.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Made of corn? It's our favorite muffin,
So I wonder—is Muffy just bluffin'?
Has our tough southern cousin
Just baked us a dozen?
If so, soon our mouths we'll be stuffin'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Like mixed sounds from an ancient symphonia
Is the tree we call Citrus limonia.
Half a mandarin fruit,
And half lemon, it's cute!
Can you grow it in New Caledonia?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The abandannaad ought to be crowned
As "Most Specialized Crook to Be Found."
He's a pickpocket who
Steals just handkerchiefs. True,
But there can't be that many around.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Our daughters behave and excel,
While our sons often put us through hell.
We don't coddle the males,
But just paddle their tails,
Since a caudal shellacking works well.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The movie's successful and then
They decide to just make it again.
But all things being equal,
I'll sidestep the sequel:
Danny Glover and Mel: Lethal Men.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My publicity firm's been selected,
The electorate polled and dissected.
While you're out on the stump,
I'll be busting my hump,
Moving mountains to get you elected.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You complain over little things.  Why, baby?
Must you be always a crybaby?
You whine in excess.
It's past time I address
This behavior by saying goodbye, baby.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Anthropogeography tries
To explain how man's movement complies
With political forces
And nature's resources
By offering wherefores and whys.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The court order I met with derision.
The judge made me pay a provision
To someone I'd jilted.
The system is tilted.
I'll fight this horrendous decision!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Confronted with stone formed from mud,
A diluvialist might blame a flood:
"This terrain underwent
An extensive event."
To most others, the theory's a dud.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
Pliny's Romans knew one copper piece
As an as, but a little increase
Of one's fortune to ten
And those asses were then
A decussis, so hunger could cease.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A baking sheet's metal and flat,
With a rectangle's figure, at that.
These cookies I'm lovin'
Were baked in the oven
On one that I greased with some fat.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
Milk in coffee yields café au lait
When prepared a particular way:
Scald the milk so it's hot,
Equal joe from the pot.
In New Orleans, serve with a beignet.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When my beagle went into a hole,
I thought he'd emerge with a mole.
But my scent-sniffing hound
Then pulled out of the ground
A most terrible-tempered old troll.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I'm employed to evaluate wine,
To distinguish the base from the fine.
Some bouquets are so heady
I'm rendered unsteady—
A drag, but the burden is mine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Mack's a goof-off, an indolent creep.
Of all bums, he's the top of the heap.
"For a job moving earth,
I will pay what you're worth."
He said, "Hell, I'm not working that cheap!"

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
When my bride said that night, "When we breed,
The asexual route's what I need,"
I thought, Huh? She expects
To have kids without sex?
Then I saw her sans clothes, and agreed.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
Andorra's the cause of my smiles.
It's one hundred and eighty square miles.
In the Pyrenees high,
With France and Spain nigh,
It calls to me—even beguiles.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Atheistical? Me, to a T!
Yes, I'm godless. Whenever I see
"God" let hate and want reign
And the good suffer pain,
I must ask, just how "great" could He be?

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
Of the AM band I'm a big fan,
And I listen whenever I can.
It's the amplitude (height)
You must modulate right
To make practical radio, man.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
It's a marble-sized, bright yellow fruit
That's a good diuretic, to boot.
It's delicious in pies,
And in jams, it's a prize.
The cape gooseberry here I salute.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
An underground melody cheat
Passed around by musicians to beat
The high prices of songs —
I suppose that two wrongs
Make a fake book all right, to compete.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
All this limerick writing is fun.
I have already finished line one.
You can parse it with ease,
You can pass if you please.
I don't mind as this limerick's done.

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
On eclipses, a science-fair triptych
Says this:  See, Earth's orbit's elliptic.
The sun's at one focus.
Its plane is their locus,
And so it is called the ecliptic.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
All we Yanks can be oft misconstrued
By you Brits as too vulgar and crude,
But your etiquette's muddy:
Why can't we use bloody
When talking of undercooked food?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB and mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Faulty autacoids destine a critter
To life as the runt of its litter.
Darwinian theory
Has never been cheery.
It's bitter when others are fitter.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Have you gone to Bern, Brussels, Berlin?
Haven't seen Budapest? That's a sin!
Bucharest and Belfast
Will yield memories that last;
Add this B-list to places you've been.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Weather's balmy (it's fair); let's repair
To the expo (the fair). That is where
The displays are extensive,
And the goods inexpensive:
The prices all honest and fair.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Every Alp will be silt in the end;
Deterration's that process's friend.
And if something's interred
It could well be inferred
Deterration reverses that trend.

limerick_list.author: FitzpatrickC
limerick_list.text:
I must have the right babassu.
Buy me that one, dear papa, please do!
It's a feathery palm
And its seeds yield a balm
That is ever so healthy for you!

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Baby Jane now weighs three-point-three pounds.
She can breathe off the vent (within bounds).
So a bath basin's set
In her warm isolette
For the baby's first bath—and first sounds.

limerick_list.author: Wordmatic
limerick_list.text:
Dull green cabbage is one of those vegges
That is shredded or cut up in wedges
To be boiled with corned beef;
Then it brings on the grief
Alimentary—you'll hide behind hedges!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Michael Cohen's a fixer by trade.
At least twice when The Donald has strayed
And has two-timed his wife,
Mike forestalled wedded strife
Making sure the strayees got well-paid.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Contraception is futile for Myrtle;
Often pregnant, she's famously fertile.
Her Galapagos trip
Made us ask: "Did she flip?"
She returned and gave birth to a turtle.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
The magnets called dia- react
With repulsion, while paras attract.
Cut the field that's applied?
Most reactions subside
But persist in the ferros intact.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The Bihari procedure is owed
Due respect for the pubes cut and sewed.
But performing extrusion
To create an illusion
Must violate some penile code.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I should like to dreate a fine ode,
Containing some secretjve code.
Qerhaps it's too iard
But, in playing thf bard,
I'll be heading along the sight road.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She's a hooker but, still, I don't judge her.
Her fee I would never begrudge her.
So sweetly she hugged me,
Then her "manager" mugged me.
She's nice but watch out for her bludger.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
If it's heat that you need to acquire,
One grey rock can fulfill your desire.
Strike some steel against flint,
And you'll soon see a glint
That can flare to become blazing fire.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Her head's big enough for a group
And her curls swing around loop-de-loop.
Though she's just a cartoon
She made manly men swoon.
That's our Betty. She's boop-oop-a-doop.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Bacterial wilt is a pest
Of potatoes; it's often expressed
As a flagging by day,
Then, by night, all okay.
Best confirm with a stem-section test.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I was dead-struck last week, filled with dread,
Since a seer said I'd soon lose my head,
Meaning "head off my body",
Not head meaning "potty"—
A storm took the latter instead.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
If I'm done with the rat-race—frenetic,
And my decor's quite Spartan—ascetic,
Why this beautiful wife
At the core of my life?
For a grace that transcends the cosmetic.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The blood flower's gaudily hued,
Orange-red, but don't call the plant crude,
As this tropical shrub
Is a prime source of grub
For some insects—it's butterfly food.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A bandster was clearly the guy
Who bound wheat sheaves at harvest. That's why
If you played clarinet,
It's a pretty safe bet
This is one job you'd want to pass by.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Young Donald's maneuver was deft:
"No service for me! I'm bereft!
These spurs are a curse
On my feet—and, what's worse,
See this hangnail! Oh, darn, I'm 4-F'd."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We returned, having seen no big game,
Feeling hungry, disheartened, and lame,
Then were told we must chip
In ten bucks for a tip.
I'm ashamed and regret that I came.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Two amoebas, where once there'd been one,
Complained about how things were done.
Their own parturition
Was binary fission,
But sex would have been much more fun.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
I tried to hunt lions for sport.
Shot the face, so I had to resort
To stuffing his rear
For a trophy—oh, dear!
A catastrophe?  Yes, of a sort.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A puzzle, I'd say, at first glance is
Brought forth by a cheese known as Francis.
Do you think that some day
I'll be honored this way?
To be honest, I don't like my chances.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman and Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
A buttercup under my chin
Reflects yellow; my daughter chimes in,
"There's the proof you like butter!"
"Who doesn't?" I mutter
While flashing my cheesiest grin.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
He's anaemic and lean, skin and bone.
"I am mean, so don't ask" is his tone.
No point flashing a dagger
For cash at Mick Jagger:
One cannot get blood from a stone.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My dad always said, "Buckle down!
Be a serious student; don't clown."
I was eighteen years old
When his words would take hold,
But by then I missed out on a gown.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Baron Basil has started a hassle.
All us freemen he plans to envassal.
That would make me a serf,
Forced to work on his turf.
(Serf and turf both belong to his castle.)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
They'd bestowed on us Trojans a horse.
What was stowed in its hollow? A force:
Their most warlike and bold
Were concealed in its hold.
Would we rue that bestowal? Of course.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Kids love Cracker Jack, cheer like a claque
For that popcorny caramel snack,
But each girl and each boy
First will look for the toy
That is hidden inside of each pack.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
You can ride in all weathers, that's true,
And you've lost many kilograms too.
Your new exercycle's swell
As a bike, but do tell:
Don't you miss looking up at the view?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Electrocution is fatal, you'd say?
Quote the good folks at Oxford: "No way!"
At least not necessarily.
They define the word warily:
"Some survive severe shocks every day."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Algebraists use vectors and rings
And are facile with Boolean strings.
Though these nerds, as a rule,
Can at times seem the fool,
In a math class they're treated as kings.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I'm telling you AIDS does not kill!
It just signifies you are too ill
To repel the infections
That, based on projections,
Are ones that undoubtedly will.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I have a few musical boys,
And drums and guitars are their toys.
Their rhythm resounds
And makes terrible sounds,
But acoustic tiles deaden the noise.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
Encradle: to place in a cot
Or a cradle. But  then, like as not,
Knowing how babies are,
You won't get very far;
So you uncradle, soothing the tot.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
I'm so perfect; be glad I auditioned.
As a speaker, I'm well dispositioned:
First-rate diction, good form,
And my temperament's warm;
I'm a fit, so let's get me commissioned.

limerick_list.author: Engineer
limerick_list.text:
Said the wren to the wee cactus mouse,
"This club cholla's for me and my spouse."
But the mouse dug his den
And the poor cactus wren
Had to share the ground floor of his house.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
On display in the woods at each curve
Is our Little Red Riding Hood's verve,
As she cheerfully skips
Toward a wolf licking lips
Over Grandma—a dainty hors d'oeuvre.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Ecologically speaking, succession
Is a gradual transferred possession.
The habitat changes,
As stuff rearranges
In logical chain-like progression.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Though born to the purple (noblesse
Is my birthright), I have to confess
That this prince would bring shame
To the family name
Were it known I like wearing a dress.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I will test your diadochokinesis.
See me flipping my hand? Try mimesis.
That seemed easy to master;
Now go a bit faster.
You did fine, with no diaphoresis!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The Alsophila's larvae are loopers,
While their dads are geometrid swoopers.
They wriggle up trees
And eat leaves as they please,
These voracious herbivorous troupers.

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
A black squirrel lives up in our tree
And gobbles up birdseed with glee.
The dogs will give chase
When he enters their space,
But one jump up the tree and he's free.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren and Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Elizabeth Phelps, known as Bessie,
Was always dishevelled and messy,
But she's smart as can be
Since she went to Paree:
With a swan on her head, Bessie's dressy.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
When you speak of a feast of clerk ale
It isn't just beer in the pail.
It's a meal for the Parish
Clerk (one not too garish);
A pleasure that never will fail.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Life is hard, but he never despairs;
Sinful teddies he names in his prayers,
Making signs over some
So that blessings will come:
Thus he patiently crosses his bears.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
For colonics, we're using cologne,
Fresh and fragrant as blooms fully blown;
Sweetly perfumed, it's pure,
So it's sure to obscure
The aromas to which you are prone.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The things kids get up to today
Go beyond simple mischief at play.
Now they hack main computers
And fire grown ups' shooters;
We'd scrump pears, but real stealing? No way!

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
But your logic is stuck — it won't move
From its circular argument's groove.
Yes, the sole valid "hence..."
Is: you're lacking in sense —
You assumed what you wanted to prove!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When in light or EM radiation
The E-field describes a rotation
That's clockwise (or not),
Then the light that you've got
Shows elliptical polarization.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Polly Parrot's life wasn't so great,
When an "accident" sealed the bird's fate:
One sharp shock, and then voom!
Now she lies in her tomb.
(She'd been nibbling at cables of late.)

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Our climate's predictably dry,
And there's rarely a cloud in our sky.
But of late, it's turned zany,
Always coming on rainy.
Plan a picnic? God spits in your eye.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
After 13 March '38 came,
What was Austria wasn't the same.
For the Anschluss was made—
After that, I'm afraid
That the country shared Germany's name.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
See my pupil, my eye's roundest apple.
This window's one role is to grapple
To seize light (or a sight
That invokes my delight,
Such as one I might wed in a chapel).

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When you delegate, then you entrust
To a colleague.  What follows you must
Hope results in success
For your firm—not a mess
He'll confess, just before you go bust.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
My dear little cat lives indoors
And has claws at the ends of his paws,
While a pun that's the worst
Says a comma's reversed—
It's a pause at the end of a clause!

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
"Epithetic: of a phrase or a word
That's abusive," said Pete. "It's absurd
That some think it exciting
To use such in their writing —
In mine this has never occurred."

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Centre-stage I stand, ready to start—
Due to nerves, I let out a loud fart;
Though there isn't a smell,
They've all heard, I can tell,
So I'll just quit the stage, and depart.

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
My cuteness is certainly ample.
I wish I could give you a sample.
With a shoebutton nose
And adorable toes,
I'm of puppy a stellar example.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seems I pay for each date; that's too much,
As you're leaning on me—I'm a crutch.
Let's continue to see
One another, but, gee,
We can each pay for half; we'll go Dutch.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Alpine touring in Switzerland? Please!
Do you think I've got Superman's knees?
Why'd you think I would like
Such a strenuous hike,
Up a mountain, in snow, and on skis?

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
"The comedian wasn't amusing,"
Said the patron. "In fact, he's confusing.
I never once laughed.
All his jokes were quite daft,
And for most of the show, I was snoozing."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A coordinate some would find cryptic,
The ascending node marks the ecliptic.
A horoscope carries
The "first point of Aries"
(A synonym much more elliptic).

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
From their perches atop ladders tall,
Fathers chatted on matters quite small.
Here's what Mr. Jones penned,
Their bilateral end:
One must never dismantle the wall.

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
That shop owner's rude, and here's why:
All I said was, "I'd quite like to buy
A new twelve-sided dice:
Could you tell me the price?"
And with open disdain, he said, "Die."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Caveman Dana, you're bound to impress
Our cave-taxmen—the cave IRS—
As your profits are mounting.
You need cost accounting
To assure your continued success."

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Benzaldehyde: almondy smell
Is a thing that this ring can do well.
It's a benzene, you know,
With attached CHO—
Should you drink it, you might live to tell.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
It's your farm you don't want to destroy —
There are methods you need to employ.
You can azotize land
If rotation is planned,
With such plantings as clover and soy.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Round their neck, on a chain, soldiers wear
A small dog tag. That I. D. is there
So their names will be known,
Though what's left could be bone,
Which goes back to their loved ones who care.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dottie claims my opinions are rot.
When I say something's good, she says "Not!"
When I cheer, Dottie boos;
My reviews she pooh-poohs,
And she downplays what judgment I've got.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Her complexion was pock-marked and bloaty.
And her body? Like Truman Capote!
I awoke, with alarm,
To find her on my arm.
For her file, look up "ugly, coyote."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Cuchi cuchi!" has made her a star,
And her figure is well above par,
But what few people know:
Charo's earned lots of dough
As a pro on flamenco guitar.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said the doctor, "I won't sugarcoat.
Excess mucus will enter your throat,
Then unable to swallow,
Some gurgling will follow.
That death rattle spells 'all she wrote.'"

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Though I'd thought that the loan would be minor,
My credit eye's sporting a shiner.
The collateral angle?
Tangential, a tangle.
I'll lean on my dad as cosigner.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
The people one meets when one shoots!
Like the Major, in jodhpurs and boots—
On guns, he's a bore
(Be they twelve, ten or four),
But he's worst when discussing his roots...

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With respect from our club my incentive,
My system for filing's inventive.
I keep every last note,
Every word, every quote.
You could say that I'm annals-retentive.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
His talent is truly emerging
In the art of depuring: expurging —
The reverse of defiling.
So right now he's smiling:
Got his cleansing degree, at my urging.

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
Your loving restricts and restrains.
I feel like I'm bound up in chains.
You call me your 'wabbit',
And though we cohabit,
Cohibit's the word that pertains.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The estate agent selling our house
Behaved like an odious louse.
She both charged a large fee
And, from what I could see,
Had a torrid affair with my spouse.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Say the rosary slowly—don't blab it!
And say, "Please pass the food"—don't just grab it!
It's a shame, Sister Gabby,
You're the talk of the abbey.
You've become such a creature of habit.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Our color sarn't's wife is a nag,
And she scolds him and says he's a fag,
But he's always consoled
(What a sight to behold!)
When he leads us while bearing our flag.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
If in wood you should need a clean groove
Of which carpenters might well approve,
A new dado plane will
This requirement fulfill,
And you'll find will all problems remove.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
This is coarse linen fabric, or duck.
But do not let your mind come unstuck;
Drabbet's turned into smocks
And it isn't the flocks
Of foul waterfowl dabbling in muck.

limerick_list.author: Ellla B.
limerick_list.text:
For comic book heroes, it's true
That black hair is tinged with some blue,
But how can you say
That blue equals gray?
In dogs and cats, blue is that hue.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Mom died, but I didn't inherit
The ring I was promised (12-carat).
I snatched up my claim.
The cops came, heard my name.
Grassing up?  Sister's stool-pigeon parrot.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The 'restructuring' talk was a lie.
I've to leave, and I'm wondering why
I was placed on the list
To let go.  I'm dismissed
As redundant, and soon I shall cry.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
There are rules that I might have to break,
And some new ones I might have to make.
But let's not throw the show,
We can compromise. No?
There has gotta be some give and take.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
We're a fractured republic.  This nation,
With political polarization,
Is split: left and right,
Rich and poor, black and white.
We elect those who spur fragmentation.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
'Neath Athena's own owl, we would see—
Near the hole in the bole of her tree—
Tiny bones, here and there,
Indigestible hair,
All disgorged in the pellet debris.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"These viruses never inspire us.
They damage the liver," said Cyrus.
"When acquired with hep. B,
They add trouble, you see.
Incomplete—but no treat—delta virus!"

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Science once thought the leaf hopper mute,
But we know now, past any dispute,
You can hear the faint melody
Of wee Cicadellidae:
Just use instruments very acute.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Many vectors are usefully split
By components on axes: to wit,
We can chart, to be smart,
Both a vertical part
And a flat left-to-right-running bit.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Spaniard, whose name is Ramona,
Cheers the Cards from her home, Barcelona.
As a Cardinal fan, she
Hopes to travel to be
There to see them in south Arizona.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Near St Austell, a plasticine dwarf
Sits and twiddles his toes on the wharf.
For his substance, he'd own
He'd prefer china stone:
Cease your longing for kaolin, Morph!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
This condition is truly severe —
A colliquative fever, I fear.
See her flesh melt away,
Wasting day after day,
As if liquified. Pray for my dear.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The repairman had taken a call
For a job: a large hole in a wall.
"For a house made of bricks,
You can't call that a fix!"
Cried the owner. "Just duct tape? What gall!"

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Our divan, with no back, is so firm
Any visitor seated will squirm.
Not a lounge for a rest
That its form would suggest,
Every nap taken there is short term.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Said the vicar, "Our church is expanding,
So everyone's started demanding
A chapel of ease,
And I'm hearing the pleas
Of parishioners weary of standing."

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
Old acquaintance should not be forgot,
Especially if you are a Scot.
Auld lang syne, you may know,
Stands for "times long ago"
Whether sung by a Scotsman or not.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
A good family man, thinking he could,
Sought a noun fit for rhyming with wood,
Asked for help from his brood:
"No! We're NOT in the mood."
(Food for thought) — Things got left where they stood.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
An arcanist knows lore on ceramics,
Whereas I know how sauces and Spam mix.
I'll carve you a morsel an'
Serve it on porcelain,
Topped with a garlic-and-jam mix.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Of my stride (one part glide, one part bounce),
There are widely discrepant accounts.
The walkologists say
It's a textbook sashay,
While the laymen insist it's a flounce.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Since I know that I mustn't blaspheme,
My lesson in law made me beam
With faithful elation.
There is no damnation
In damage. "Ad damnum!" I scream.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Running brightly and sweetly along,
This river is singing its song:
"Painted rock may enthrall,
Through the valleys of Hall,
But the sea's call is ever more strong."

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Though your very best writing of all
Is your autobiography, small
Consolation that is:
In the publishing biz,
Adoxographies seldom enthral.

limerick_list.author: Tom Strobel
limerick_list.text:
My attending said, "Peter, don't wait
To check out her heart sounds — they're great!"
'Twas a med student blessed
Auscultating that chest.
"I feel thrills!" But she didn't. No date.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Aquarelle's watercolor to you,
A drawing, transparent in hue.
A wash for the sky
Doesn't take long to dry,
But I'm adding a touch more dark blue.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
My bunny lies over the ocean.
My bunny drank rat-killing potion.
No more will it fidget:
My rabbit is rigid.
Oh, bring back my bunny to motion!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Would it be an ungodly disgrace
If I caricature Sister Ann's face:
Draw her brow pimple-prone
And her schnozz overblown?
Dare I mock the old crone? Watch this space.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The censor whose job's antiporn
Must review books and pictures. He's torn.
Though he really hates smut,
He's exposed to a glut
That submerges him noon, night and morn.

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
Just behind a great clock of renown
Are some works weighted down with a crown.
It's in London we find
Bells well-known by mankind,
Where Big Ben is the tock of the town.

limerick_list.author: Damian Hey
limerick_list.text:
Though you once were a wonderful melon,
Sweet and yummy beyond any tellin',
Now no beauty I find
In your rough, rotting rind.
Sorry, cantaloupe!  (Also, you're smellin'...)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Adfenestration's a burglar's technique:
Through your window he'll quietly sneak.
If you're not at home now
There's a chance, I avow,
You are being ripped off as we speak.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The archbishop was firm, unassailable.
"There's no sickness to cure? That's bewailable!"
Yes, within his archdiocese,
The pain of psoriasis
Was the only disease still available.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Captain Bottoms has now been promoted
To an admiralcy. Others were quoted
As saying: "He stinks."
"Any ship he's on sinks."
"Dropped the anchor himself once: it floated."

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
With this beer that's all fruity and lambic
(Unyeasted), my steady iambic
Turns jagged and free
And it says "I love thee"
In a frenzy of verse dithyrambic.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I consider myself a wise man
So I don't make an ex ante plan
(Based on what I predict)
Because that might conflict
With ex post (based on how it began).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
After sickness, there comes analepsis,
Which may bring acute pseudoblepsis.
If no aberration
Brings instant elation,
It's a good time for omphaloskepsis.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mel Brooks, king of comical arts,
In his films plays remarkable parts;
But his face isn't seen
On the great silver screen
In that scene of the famed cowboy farts.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Muslim gals in burqinis can swim
Or just sit on a beach looking prim.
What's the chance they won't go
By the dress code and show
More than face, hands, and feet?  Very slim.

limerick_list.author: MattMonitto
limerick_list.text:
On a diet they tell you, "Beware
Of the fattier foods." But I swear
That it's just OCD
Re what goes into me,
So I'm having fried goose — I don't care!

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Antonio ventured beyond
Friendship's usual charge to respond
To Bassanio's request,
For, at Shylock's behest,
He committed his flesh to a bond.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cryptologists take diverse roads
Of approach—mathematical modes—
To solve many a mystery.
They even make history
By cracking the world's toughest codes.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
By abstriction this fungus makes spores:
The sporophore coyly ignores
The septum, whose growing
(Like biblical knowing)
Shears spores, then rolls over and snores.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
When a fellow's described as clean cut,
He's well-scrubbed and a tidiness nut —
A fastidious boy,
Clearly Mom's pride and joy.
In short, he's a pain in the butt.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Like a moccasin, maybe; Mom knew:
Shield the foot from the dust and the dew.
With a soft leather sole
(Needs no heel to be whole),
A cack is, for Baby, a shoe.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Former Celtics coach Red had just died.
"A relation?" friends asked. "Why dry-eyed?"
"Though my brother once claimed
He's our uncle (both famed
For their sports skill and red hair)—he lied."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Post cardiac surgery, Kim
Expressed love to her doc on a whim.
Now she says with despair,
"Guess he just doesn't care...
And I opened my heart out to him!"

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
I would willingly tend to combine
With a lady who gave me a sign.
Now my dreams have come true—
She's combinative, too:
We recline and align on cloud nine.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
HD video can't match its thrills;
Megapixels aren't Beverly Hills.
Cine cameras boast
Far more glamour — a toast:
"Cecil B of the 16-de-mils!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
What's a dinner dress? Think of this noun
As an outfit you won't wear to town
In the daytime; but later
When you're served by a waiter—
Yet it's not quite a formal ball gown.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"I've no daddy," she'd sighed, with chagrin;
Being baseborn was reckoned a sin.
The admissions committee
(Whose pretext was pity)
Thought "Yummy," and welcomed her in.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Though your diaphragm sure fits the bill
To ensure your lungs empty and fill,
You poor ignorant gal, you
Just learned that its value
Preventing conception is nil.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
When the breeze stops and temp'rature's climbing,
Air conditioning's great. It's good timing
To go shop where it's cool,
Maybe swim in a pool,
Or get naked and do dirty rhyming.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
A scarred carcass is all that remains
Of a couch left behind on the plains.
Its upholstery gone,
The oak frame lingers on,
Stripped by heat and by cold, soaking rains.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All his chapters display continuity,
Each describing extreme promiscuity—
All his Kristies and Katies,
From his teens to his eighties,
In detail and without ambiguity.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Exanimation: "a misprint for test"?
Not at all! Then, "when life lacks all zest"?
Well, that is partly right —
When life's day's more like night:
"Deprivation of life" says it best.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't want to complain or be whiny,
But my date turned out not to be tiny.
She's a good-sized young lass
Whom I will not give sass
Out of fear she'll be kicking my heinie.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace
limerick_list.text:
If a stock once was high, then it's low,
It's a blow-off top.  Now you should go
Out to buy it! It's true
That a spike's overdue;
Sell it right and you'll make lots of dough.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My brush in my hand, at my bench,
I am painting the face of a wench.
As the subject is me
A self-portrait 'twill be,
Or an autoportrait, said in French.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
To design and to build a good dryer
You'll need education in higher
Maths, physics and more—
You will have to explore
The stuff to be dried by a buyer.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
Linda, Denny and Paul's record spun.
It's the Wings album Band on the Run.
They jammed such a hot set.
Fans love "Bluebird" and "Jet",
And the title track hit number one.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
On display among knick-knacks, the vases,
Spied by shoppers, brought 'oohs-es' and 'ahs-es'.
In this fancy goods store
We'll buy nice things galore
(Not just vases!) for mas-es and pas-es.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The attainment of physical beauty,
To Greeks, was each citizen's duty.
Callipygian is what
They considered a butt
Like Beyoncé's bodacious patootie.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
Ancient Greek knew some dialects: Doric
Was one of 'em (I'm not euphoric!
Plus Ionic, Aeolic
Do not make me frolic,
For I hate all these lingos historic.)

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Federation of far-flung isle states
In the western Pacific awaits.
They've a code, it's "fm",
Which will show us it's them
(Or their Internet radio mates).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Big Brother, a blues and rock breed,
Scored their highest when Janis sang lead.
Joplin played a big part
Making "Piece of My Heart" —
Their sole hit — a true beauty indeed.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
This limerick would have been longer,
With content much deeper and stronger,
But though much has been missed
What comes next gives the gist—
There are none like the maidens of Tonga!

More than anything I think a date
With a young Tongan girl would be great,
For, when said to her beau,
"Oly-ma-kitty-luca-chi-chi-chi" means "No".
(By the time that's been said it's too late!)

limerick_list.author: Matt Barber
limerick_list.text:
My washing machine is sensational!
Its method is quite agitational.
It spins, scrubs, and cleans
Dirty socks, shirts, and jeans.
I find staring inside inspirational!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Jack was handsome, a popular stud
When his face got a rash: creeping crud,
Which soon grew down his chest
Past his waist, where the pest
Green-festooned, you might guess, his poor pud.

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
A caper is my kinda fun
(Which explains why I'm still on the run).
It ain't just the mob
That can pull off a job,
Living large at the point of a gun.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
My sheer nonsense and twaddle are blah
(Like painting a flat latex bra).
Also, blah means depressed;
I just can't be my best
When I'm blah speaking blah in patois.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
But Ptolemy's hand-winning ace
Was, to Kepler, a kludgey disgrace:
From the equant, a place
In the middle of space,
Planets move at a uniform pace.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
In competitive sports, it's defeating
Opponents that matters (no cheating!).
But partaking for leisure
Can still be a pleasure
For people not up for competing.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Take Fleetwood and both the McVies.
Pair with Buckingham, Nicks, and then ease
Into rock that's sublime,
From a band in its prime—
Fleetwood Mac's never-ending reprise.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That's my CEO's face on my shield,
So my bootlicking's bold, unconcealed:
Gave the bloated old thief
The top spot, in the chief.
My return? When his will is revealed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are antinoise statutes and laws
That have silenced the chain-driven saws.
Now the neighborhood's quiet;
