We've ended the riot,
To modest and muffled applause.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
Some Greeks and Egyptians were spoiled
And they wore their hair scented and oiled.
Their unguents of spice
Would be kept in a nice
Alabastron, bejewelled and foiled.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
Since mandrite is translated monk,
Archimandrite, as we might have thunk,
Means the Peter or Paul
Who's in charge of them all
And unorthodox views must debunk.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
(If you'll pardon the pun) Bob, from Prague,
Was a barker who worked like a dog.
There his job was a pip:
They would pay him to strip
All the bark off of log after log.

limerick_list.author: William Bryce George
limerick_list.text:
Break a leg doesn't mean "get a fracture";
To make up doesn't mean "manufacture."
Many green rooms are gray,
And our work's called a play.
With theatrical vocab, you'll act sure.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I surmise, watching stars from a hill,
That the cosmos has spirit and will.
Cosmozoism teaches
That life moves the reaches
Of space.  I feel suddenly chill.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She was caught in a tough situation,
Far from home, in an alien nation,
And was charged with a crime.
"I don't want to do time,"
She implored, "I'd prefer deportation."

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A blue Scandinavian cross
Upon white? No, I'm quite at a loss.
But this flag's in Helsinki,
Where winters are inky,
And Santa, they say, is the boss.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Dr No's evil schemes meant to kill
Agent 007? A thrill!
Has he never yet thought
That his plans are as naught,
When the dauntless James Bond's on the bill?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All my studies combine the technology
Of chemistry, physics, biology.
And my treatise on worms
In molecular terms
Sheds new light on our planet's ecology.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My son Sean is a convict, a felon;
Sure, 'twas dangerous drugs he was sellin'.
I said, "Don't be a failure.
Write some tales while in jail; yer
Good at writin', inventin', and spellin'."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
The will of my now defunct aunt
Issued this, a most menacing taunt:
"Though I once called you niece,
You'll no longer find peace—
You're the one I have chosen to haunt."

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
So alert, I'm all eyes and all ears,
Like an animal sees and it hears.
Paranoia makes sense—
It's my best self-defense—
Don't you dare make a mock of my fears.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
Those new t-shirts on which I'd been banking?
Their desirableness has been tanking.
"Vote Obama for Prez,"
All my merchandise says.
Now I'm losing my high credit ranking.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Now that Trump's long-time bro has been burned,
Will this pal be embraced or be spurned?
Is slick Roger's pledge real?
Will this guy cut a deal,
And will Mueller leave no Stone unturned?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
A water well simply won't flow
If an aquiclude's lying below.
Insufficiently holey,
Its role is quite lowly:
A region where water won't go.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
When my workweek's been overly taxing,
I blow off some steam with a waxing,
Get my hair and nails done,
And then soak in the sun
At my beauty salon — quite relaxing.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Young Agnes, a martyr and saint,
Thought marriage had too great a taint,
And on heavenly urgin'
Remained as a virgin:
Your patron, if bonking you ain't.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"It furnishes light: this is glim,
No matter if that's bright or dim.
It was shortened from glimmer,
Whose light can be dimmer,"
Said slim Tim to trim Kim in the gym.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
At each end of a windshield you'll find
(Or a windscreen, if you're so inclined)
The A-pillar.  Most
Of its function's a post
Used for keeping the roof out of mind.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
King Henry the Fifth, Shakespeare teaches,
Made most inspirational speeches.
Once he urged Princess Kate,
Who was young and sedate,
"Once more, dear friend, into the breeches!"

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Exposed publicly, feeling the heat,
His shame grows as he stares at his feet.
Misdemeanors are trounced
By the press. He's denounced
As a liar, a rogue and a cheat.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
She is known for her blistering wit.
With a viperous tongue she will spit,
Out of anger or spite,
Petty words that will bite—
If you vex her, you're sure to get bit.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a small piece of luggage—a case
For cosmetics you put on your face.
Take a break from the rush,
Grab your lipstick and blush,
Pretty up, and get back in the race.

limerick_list.author: Workshop and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I'm in Bocholt, in Belgium. It's here
That I market my Belgian-style beer.
This excellent tipple
Is classed as a tripel,
But it's actually brewed in Tangier.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The Demiurge, spirit creative,
Was to Plato's philosophy native.
By this god, Plato stated,
The world was created
From chaos, and made integrative.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The debt crunch has worsened, we see,
Yet the president claims he's fault-free.
Asked if he's to account
For the rising amount,
He will blamelessly answer, "Who, me?"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A celebrated new-age musician,
Renowned for expressive rendition,
His air barely started,
Prodigiously farted.
There followed a long intermission.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
In a girl, there's no cause to bemoan,
Nor in flower, nor spirit, nor stone,
This particular plan.
But to say that a man
Is anorchid elicits a groan.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Most apocryphal tales aren't true,
Like some emails friends forward to you.
Full of warnings most dire,
They just rouse your ire—
Urban legends, recycled, not new.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
As the sun sets in old Amarillo,
I lay my head down on my pillow,
And there from my room
See the purplish bloom
Of my evergreen tree, desert willow.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A greedy art therapist, Moffett,
Was told by the Board to come off it:
"Please stick to remissions
Of mental conditions —
Stop selling the paintings for profit!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Just had coffee and banoffee pie!"
"Made of what?" asks my wife, with raised eye.
"Bananas and cream
And some toffee — a dream
Of a pie!" is my happy reply.

limerick_list.author: PaperSpock
limerick_list.text:
"When carbon chains have in their troops
Precisely two CH3 groups,
You call them dimethyl,"
Said Lucy to Ethel,
As Ricky helped Fred try on toups.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Double-charged, thanks to you, and I'm burning.
I suspect that you're new, and I'm yearning
For times past and still  hope
That I'll die by the rope,
'Cause this chair is no place for your learning!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Pilgrims walking to Spain (Santiago)
Proceed less allegro, more largo
(They walk, and don't gallop).
Each takes an escalop
(The wayfarer's shell) in their cargo.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The students are getting unruly
And clogging up halls in a truly
Unprincipled way,
Leading teachers to stay
In their rooms—even Mr. Bernoulli.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
As an oldentimes female domestic,
A handmaiden, I was transvestic.
My wife cried, "My spouse
Is a maid keeping house!"
I pretended that I was amnestic.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I broggle from here on a log:
I sniggle, or fish with a brog
(That's a branch) with a baited,
Fixed hook. I'm eel-ated
When snigs take my bait — I'm agog.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brenda Sue is now pregnant, alas,
And I feel like a dummy, first class.
"When you're having your fun,
Use a condom, my son,"
Said my dad. "Always cover your ass!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A cone of uncertainty shows
A best guess where a hurricane goes.
Each spaghetti-type line
In a group helps define
A storm's path — where it moseys, who knows.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Why this limerick? Mainly to learn
Of a plant called the curly grass fern.
Although ferns of this kind
Are quite small, hard to find,
Here's a photo—'twill make your head turn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Their activity level? Intense!
They have covered our town with a dense
Grid of trained volunteers
Who would cover our rears
In a crisis—our civil defense.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A DF can find out the direction
Of incoming waves in connection
With radio-receiving
Antennas, achieving
Its task to the highest perfection.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Your Schrödinger's Limerick waits:
Ambiguity's one of its traits.
Is it funny? Perhaps.
We won't know 'til collapse
Of its superposition of states.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
"Does this stew taste a little too lambish?"
Asked Mom.  Answered Dad, "I'd say...'hammish'."
I cried, "Gimme me that pot—
I'll eat all that you've got!
I'm so hungry I'm ready to famish!"

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Disappointment upon him descended
When his mother said, "Isn't this splendid?
Here's your first big-boy suit!
Don't you think that it's cute?"
There his birthday essentially ended.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Add lim in a lexicon? Sure.
Ad limina: go to the door
Of Apostles' tombs (Rome);
To the Pope, in his home,
Give a prelate's report. That's the score.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Into words like bilobate Sam probes:
"That's a word meaning 'having two lobes'
Like those oft found on leaves."
It's not used, he perceives,
To describe women's mammary globes.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
One Aix is a genus of duck,
That dabbles for goodies to suck.
Eight Aixes, perchance,
If you're traveling in France
Are supplied with hot springs: you're in luck!

limerick_list.author: Esther Spurrill Jones
limerick_list.text:
Got some eyelets you need reinforced?
A grommet is often endorsed.
It's a round metal ring,
Or a pipe-sealing thing,
Or a skateboarder newbie (slang sourced).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Stations covered the whole dang extent
Of the gavel-to-gavel event.
Many watched all the while
From the start of the trial
To the verdict, which still we resent.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Take my boat out to sea—you be driver,
And I'll jump right in—deep-sea diver.
I'll find pearls, and give thanks
To my oxygen tanks,
Which will help me to be a survivor.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A crime in this Roman-style villa?
Poirot said, "I smell no vanilla—
The stinkin' effluvium
From the impluvium
'Elps to convict the vile killa!"

limerick_list.author: Morphiend
limerick_list.text:
Once, you'd fussily prod me and poke me,
Yet your analness did not provoke me.
Then I started to care
When you got in my hair,
And your nitpicking finally broke me.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Easygoing, I'm calm and relaxed.
With stress, I'm not overly taxed.
I'm without undue worry.
My pace shows no hurry.
If rigors arise, they get axed.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
I was hunting for birds for my pot.
If I spied one, I squeezed off a shot.
Every last one I missed!
So, while shaking my fist,
I aimlessly trudged 'round the lot.

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If a glance or a brief conversation
Should engender intense fascination,
But you each have a spouse
And two kids in the house,
Meet to cheat: a discreet assignation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Genus Corvus, the raven or crow,
Is a bird we're all likely to know;
And a warm salutation
To the crow's constellation
I offer from those down below.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Some friends who talk funnily say
What they say in a curious way.
They're from Brooklyn, "Noo Yawk";
Perhaps that's why they talk
Much more strange than we dudes from LA.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Archaeology: study of old stuff,
Conducted by those who behold stuff
Made by Romans or Greeks.
When the Ancient World speaks,
You should listen, 'cause some of it's gold stuff.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
Alpha hydroxy, an acid,
May help your face not to go flaccid.
If your skin looks like leather,
You can fight age and weather—
If not to feel young, at least placid.

limerick_list.author: Giri
limerick_list.text:
In a video conference call,
He forgot that his webcam so small
Was uncovered and streaming
Him nude. "Is he dreaming?"
His co-workers wondered in thrall.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
While I used to give freely for alms,
I admit I've been having some qualms
Since each outlay of bucks
Brings an influx of schmucks
Who are mooching and holding out palms.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
With her mother, she often proceeds
To the smotherweed trees, where she weeds
All the Bassia palms
And gets buttery balms
From the hearts of their five-legged seeds.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My wife is renowned as a cook,
While her husband's the consummate schnook.
It was anise I sought for her,
Fennel I've bought for her.
"But that smell, Hon." "It's labelled. Here, look."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Conservatory? Conservatoire?
I would favor the latter by far.
The word's less fuddy-duddy
To describe where I study
To become next year's opera star.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
You're a doll, and the size of a mouse,
But you still want to live in a house,
With miniature chairs,
Six inches of stairs,
And some tiny doll-children and spouse.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In the old Mississippi's domain,
One might hear the words by the mark twain.
It meant "safe to sail through",
And in literature too,
Samuel Clemens would use it again.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When our marriage was young, you were bridal,
And you cooked and you baked, never idle.
Now we're married ten years;
All you do is drink beers
And your cooking's become biocidal.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
Hiding lights under bushels has shown
That your talents will seldom be known.
You will have to be bold
If your work's to be sold—
But your cover from then will be blown.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pomeranian, terrier, spitz?
Get a bomb and let's blow them to bits!
Collie, Pekingese, beagle?
Let's make them illegal.
(Cynophobic, my life is the pits.)

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm empassionate, strongly affected,
And gripped by the fact I've detected
The opposite word —
And yes, this is absurd —
Is impassionate.  How unexpected!

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Since the gnathostomata have jaws,
They earn plaudits, hurrahs, and applause.
If you're jawless, your bite
Will be mushy and slight
With those weird, cartilaginous maws.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
If you think that we're nude, you're excused.
In that scene, body doubles were used:
Not my co-star nor me
The neck down.  What you see
Are two stand-ins.  We're seamlessly fused.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Acropachyderma will thicken your scalp,
Face and fingers; no more will you palp
(Touch or feel) — that's the word.
And I thought it referred
To an elephant crossing an Alp.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Pulmonologists use—with compunctions—
Caffeine citrate; although this drug functions
As a cardio- (heart)
-acceleratory (quick start),
It prompts breathing and calms bronchial junctions.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
So funny's the joke that you told,
I died laughing.  The floor's where I rolled.
I guffawed so damn much
And so hard, it was such
That my bladder could not be controlled.

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
It's been snowing outside for a day.
Six-foot banks are now blocking my way,
So the bike's not much use;
But I'm not a recluse,
So I'm  now off to play on my sleigh.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
An ecologist said, "I'm real keen
On the Spartans, that fighting machine.
Every time they appear
On TV, you can hear
My support with my cheers of Go green!"

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The internet world's cybersquatter
Takes trademarks and then, as a plotter,
Makes fraudulent gain
As he sells the domain
For big profits — the act of a rotter!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Entomologists, speaking of flies,
Can apprise why they rise to the skies.
They are dipterous, soar
On two wings, never four.
One or three, I surmise, means demise.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My grandmother's eighty and loves
To wear none but the finest of gloves.
In her box she has several,
Made of kid that's called cheveril,
With the color and softness of doves.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I said, "Ethyl's the fuel for my tank."
But the pump jockey just drew a blank.
"That means 'high-test,' you clown."
Then he said, with a frown,
"So who's Ethel, you muddled old crank?"

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
A limerick can be fresh and sweet,
With beautiful pictures replete.
See love bloom per God's plan
Between woman and man.
(Overlook his hand rubbing her seat.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Some air heading down to your lung,
Once it's passed right in back of your tongue,
Will remain in that place,
And be stuck in dead space
Till you exhale, when out it is flung.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Before marriage, you'd always behave
Like an angel—my perfect love slave.
But now with a ring on,
You act like a Klingon.
You're brusque, you don't hug, you don't shave!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The Craniad: Epic in scope,
It describes how our skulls gave us hope
By protecting our brains
From the sun, winds and rains.
Izzan adverb. Means "headward," ya dope.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lady from Leek,
Who persuaded a crumhorn to speak.
As she blew this curved pipe
Of the double reed type,
The oboe's old uncle went "squeak".

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Am I going to die?"  "Goodness no, Gram!
Now the meat wagon's here—in you go, Gram."
EMTs on the scene
Launched their rescue routine:
Their advanced trauma life support program.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Like a punch (solar plexus) to vex us,
Rhetorical jabbing injects us
With fire in the belly:
"You're Romans, or jelly?
Too cowed to attack?" — epiplexis.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
See that horse over there? Yes, that dapple-
Grey, flanks curving round like an apple.
He's an old-fashioned hack,
With a name from way back—
My old dad always calls him a capel.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Amentiferae, some people say,
Are the plants that bear catkins—but hey!
Quite a few disagree.
Gee, it's OK with me;
If you argue, it won't spoil my day.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
My great-grandpa, a hundred and three,
Lives actively; won't watch TV,
Started tennis and crew
At a hundred and two,
And credits his brand-new fake knee.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Ray, that's flummadiddle — nonsense, I say!
That Trump will be POTUS? No way!
I have bet all along
That the polls can't be wrong!
On Election Day, Ray, you shall pay!

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
In days coming you'll maybe collapse.
You can never be sure, but perhaps.
You're found prone at the scene
Wearing underwear clean?
I can see your mom smile as she claps.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
In China (and long before Mao),
An immortal, his name Chang Kuo Lao,
Fond of wine and jocundity,
 "Comprehended profundity",
But no one has yet found out how.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"These potatoes are fingerlings, friend—
Just as thick as your thumb end to end.
Oiled, seasoned and roasted,
They're superb," the chef boasted.
"Even spuds, in my hands, can transcend."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Back in college, they called them "The Keg Men."
They're rich now, two butter-and-egg men.
Close as two guys can get,
Bosom buddies?  You bet!
(Which is odd since they're clearly both leg men.)

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
If adrift with hot babes on a raft,
Don't attempt to do anything daft:
Just stare at the sky,
Watch the seagulls go by,
And daydream of President Taft.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ted remarked, "I don't know about you,
But I'll tell you what I'm gonna do.
Before our next killing,
If, Boss, you are willing,
I'm going to learn some kung fu."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Exossation's removal of bone
Or depriving a fruit of its stone.
That is all, but I still
Have to fill (which I will)
Twenty-one bloody syllables (groan).

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
GPS; VOR; DME;
INS; PAR; NDB.
Avigation today
Means the ol' FAA
Will hear less VFR ELT.

limerick_list.author: Shelby Forrest
limerick_list.text:
Their wedding is over and done with.
Camilla is firmly at one with
Prince Charles, her new spouse,
Since he's man, and no mouse,
But a husband a wife can have fun with.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Please don't ask me to offer or say,
Come tomorrow, what's promised today.
Yes, I do want your vote,
And I hope you will note
I'm on everyone's side, come what may.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
I fake "ancient Greek wine" for my kicks.
Strength of sucrose solution I fix,
Weight for weight, in percent;
Add some yeast; then ferment.
Just like Plato, I'm in with the Bx.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I received a harsh ass-chewing — wow!
Got dressed down for refusing to bow
To our nasty old Queen.
Plus got banged on the bean
'Cause I snarled, "What a mean, wrinkled cow!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A high priest of science, named Herschel,
Thought religion was too controversial,
So he mixed physics in
With discussions of sin,
And thanked God that his Mass is inertial.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
Cried the lizards, "That butcherbird's seen us!
Flee the scourge of the Cracticus genus!
With deadly hooked bill
He'll swoop in for the kill,
And on thorns he will skewer and clean us!"

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A meal? No, it's more like a feast!
There are twenty four platters, at least.
It's an ambigu. Why?
Comes the whole food supply
In the blink of an eye (word's deceased).

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
First he climbed up the cliff (it was tough!),
Then he called in a voice rather gruff,
"Hey, you're easy as pie!
You're not steep, it's a lie!"
(As you see, he was calling its bluff.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
You've drawn down our troops overseas,
Mr. President.  Now, if you please,
You should draw down our debt,
'Cause if not, then I'll bet
That we'll all soon be speaking Chinese.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To protect my small village from harm,
Should disaster engender alarm,
I have joined the brigade
That provides us first aid.
Now I wear a brassard on my arm.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I make gowns and I feel double-crossed;
I'm appalled by the money I've lost.
For my fabrics and staff
Outlays rise—off the graph—
And they add to my high direct cost.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
One girl shows more skin over there
Than elsewhere whole families dare
To expose. In Brazil,
On the beach, men are still
Just amazed, and such sights make 'em stare!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An Ozian Cheese Hall of Fame
Is the place for Black Pearl, I proclaim.
The rind is all wrinkled
And lovingly sprinkled
With vine ash, which gives it its name.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
I gaze at a peach with its thin,
Fuzzy epicarp, i.e., its skin...
I really don't care
For this outermost layer,
But I bite it and eat what's within.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Camarasaurus: Jurassic-aged beast
On which sauropod-eaters would feast.
A herbivorous hulk
Bearing chambered-boned bulk,
It was rife; now its era has ceased.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"Eschew obfuscation," it's said,
But avoidance is something I dread.
Muddle up, but with grace,
With a smile on your face,
Then, untroubled, go blithely to bed.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Though at first he cried out "O Fortuna!",
In France he became a kahuna.
He deserves our acclaim,
So in Arago's name
There are craters on Mars and on Luna.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
Algae allergy makes my face mottle.
My algologist date I will throttle:
Our picnic was fine
Till he said we must dine
On six seaweed pills, straight from the  bottle.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
When leaving the scene, you should maybe
Say something, though trite the cliché be:
 "Au revoir" or "Farewell"
Or  "Goodbye, it's been swell,"
Even "Hasta la vista there, baby."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I find Beavis and Butt-Head retarded.
And offensive? Lord, don't get me started!
As cartoons, they are brash
And just part of the trash
With which children are daily bombarded.

limerick_list.author: quartus
limerick_list.text:
Good limericks have to combine
More than humorous words in each line:
With rhythm and meter
The scansion's much sweeter —
And it helps if you make the thing rhyme!

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
To the back of the bus you must go.
You are not one of us, don't you know?
And it's not 'cause your skin
Is too dark to be "in".
It's because you won't go with the flow.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I've got cage biter syndrome, it's true,
From the bars that I constantly chew.
Since the day I was shipped,
All my teeth have been chipped,
Yet a day or two more and I'm through!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Ima Ball, a young comic from Bristol
Whose routine was as hot as a pistol,
Became pregnant—what girth!
"If," said she, "I give birth
To a girl, I'll be naming her Crystal."

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
When Napoleon beat a retreat
After Waterloo, tattered and beat,
Both his boots were removed,
And it quickly was proved
That Napoleon stunk of defeat.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Her eye-catching sign made me stray:
"Free pussy! — Great service!  — I'm May!"
So I beckoned her near,
And she leaned near my ear:
"We've both Persians and Manxes today."

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Amarthritis is truly a pain;
If your multiple bone joints  contain
An enormously great
Inflammation, of late,
Take two Vioxx, then see me again.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A nimrod named Rollo went solo
To capture a wild colocolo.
He returned bearing batches
Of bruises and scratches.
"I'm safer," he said, "playing polo."

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
"Don't cremate me but freeze me," I said,
"Liquid nitrogen over my head.
Cryomation, my friend,
Is the green way to end.
You can use me as compost when dead."

limerick_list.author: Morimando and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
A brown creeper loves snacking on all
Tiny spiders and insects that crawl
On the tree he ascends
(With the bark his coat blends).
He's a bird that is threatened (and small).

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
I envision him locked up, in chains —
It's the least he deserves for his pains;
For the carnage he's brought
And destruction he's wrought.
He's a fool with much power, no brains.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Depression-type storage is rain
That ditches or holes might retain
Until lost to the sun —
Smallish pools that don't run
To a river or sea; there's no drain.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When Clint Eastwood's the star of a show,
You can bet that he'll give blow for blow.
What's the name of the flick
Where he plays a slick trick
And he's killed by a gang? Do you know?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
One of many forms thought of by man,
The drop arch, according to plan,
Will appear short and squat
(Tall and lofty it's not),
With its radii shorter than span.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Self-denial! We've fasted three days!
Now we'll bellycheer: meats and beignets,
Cakes and ale for three weeks;
Must restock our physiques,
Singing lusty and genuine praise.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
Let me demonstrate physics acuity:
The equation we call continuity
States momentum and mass
Are conserved as they pass
Through a boxlet throughout perpetuity.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
A crevasse is a deep glacial crack,
Where a ladder's required, as a track,
So you're able to cross,
Between sides, without loss
Of your life (or the pack on your back).

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
Let's start with your language: too crude.
Then your manners: disgusting with food.
But to break the news briefly,
I'm leaving you chiefly
'Cause when were you last in the mood?

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Colugo: a mammal of night,
With extra long skin flaps for flight.
The trees have been banished,
His habitat's vanished;
Endangerment now is his plight.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
A man ate the plant we call artichoke.
Was this to be some kind of party joke?
First he bit off the leaves,
Then complained of the heaves!
Good clue! We then knew from the heart he spoke.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
To cover a spare is to make
A conversion. You bragged, "Piece of cake!"
Then you choked and your shot
Didn't hit the right spot,
Since the tournament crown was at stake.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
On the wing of the skull's sphenoid bone
(Just in front of your ear — and your phone),
Should you batter Gaddafi on
This, the crotaphion,
He'd fall to the ground with a groan.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
Quentin Cox is a true foppish dandy:
Tailored suit, polished shoes, cane held handy.
But on Saturday nights
He strips off under lights:
Oiled-up pecs, biceps flexed, renamed Randy.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
This statement should serve to refute
What the lady has claimed in her suit.
She's pregnant, okay,
But I'm sterile—no way
I'm the father: it's blanks that I shoot.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
When a film's called a chick flick, it's meant
To appeal to most women.  How bent!
I'm a gal through and through,
But those flicks make me boo,
While my husband applauds. What a gent!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Two side walls and one in the back
Form a box set; that's something we lack.
If it's not built today,"
The director said, "pray
Our careers won't be fading to black."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"We're proud mountain goats, kid, so don't mumble,
Or bumble or fumble or tumble.
In its place you must put (sure)
Each hoof.  We are footsure —
No stumbles!" (Old goat sure ain't humble.)

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Anadipsia's quite a large thirst,
Though it comes on quite slowly at first.
Don't be counted a fool:
Stay away from that pool,
Or you'll drink so much water you'll burst.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
No admirer will seek to be chums
With a female whose dress disbecomes
Her and looks like a sack
Taken right off the rack,
So such girls have to settle for crumbs.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lee and I cured four cats that were pee-less—
We are vets, though self-taught and degreeless.
When, for dogs, cures we've made,
We've sent bills and been paid,
But we don't charge for cats, as they're Felis.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
We crazed customers lined up at four,
Then at six we all crashed through the door.
For deep discounts we came —
Played the doorbuster game:
A low price, a short time — shoppers score!

limerick_list.author: Carlos M
limerick_list.text:
There once was a clerk from Bangkok
Whose whole life was controlled by the clock.
Every morning at six
He'd ......................
Oh my gosh! I've developed a block.

limerick_list.author: Allison C. Liddell
limerick_list.text:
Wearing contacts to see is no fun,
But Dot Parker has nailed it in one
With her girls wearing glasses
And men who are asses —
It looks like my vanity's won.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
It weighs 24 grams, kind of light.
But this golf ball, the Cayman's, just right.
It doesn't  have dimples,
Instead there are pimples.
Jack's design made it slower in flight.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
I'm asexual—don't feel a thing.
I don't mind a romantic-type fling,
And I do enjoy kissing,
But don't feel I'm missing
The stuff that a sex drive would bring.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
What's the meaning of bimanous? Jiminy!
Try "having two hands", dummy. Criminy!
It's so easy to tell
(If you know how to spell)
That it doesn't mean "one of the Bimini"!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
On his doubters, the Wiz stole a march,
As he sawed through the box made of larch.
"My assistant," he said,
"Was already half-dead."
(As magicians go, this one was arch.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Sinusitis is prone to produce
A copious discharge, profuse.
We'll control Buck's defluxion
By using this suction.
Should he choke, we would have no excuse.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Old vehicles used the drum brake,
Whose action would usually make
The vehicle slow
Quite smoothly, although
Used with vigour its linings could bake.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Yes, Draconian's meaning's "severe,"
And from Athens it came—that is clear—
From the lawmaker Draco.
He, fierce as a mako,
Wrote laws that made everyone fear.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
SheilaB
Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Cinnamomum, or cassias, are trees,
Grown in lands where they also grow teas.
They're a chemical source:
Camphor, spices of course.
So, your cinnamon rolls? They're Chinese.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Extempore speech is unplanned,
Unprepared, unrehearsed and offhand—
A species of blurtin'
Of which I am certain
Supply is exceeding demand.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You'd described your blind date in esthetic
Detail, using language poetic;
But to me she seemed gross
And was so grandiose.
My reaction, I fear, was emetic.

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
My rock-loving son has now found
How to blast me with rhythms that pound;
Despite the cacophony,
He'll never turn off any
Part of his system of sound.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Wearing ribbons in shimmering bows,
She bedazzles wherever she goes,
They're her joy and her pride,
But they won't come untied,
So her sparkling collection just grows.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Hey! I've joined that elite congregation
Called OEDILF; that means 'limerick nation'.
Got to write lots of lims
Now before the spark dims —
This calls for some real cerebration!

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Granny Phelps has a rickety back,
So she's finding it tricky to hack.
Her false teeth are a bit
Of a terrible fit—
You can hear them go clickety-clack.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In planning our wedding, Joe's idle,
Thinking all the expense should be bridal.
But I fear with a chill
If my dad foots the bill,
Then the banquet will be barmecidal.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Back to driving school Grandma must go.
Her insurance claims ran up some dough
When she mowed down pedestrians,
A troupe of equestrians,
And two elderly hookers I know.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
George Poulton composed "Aura Lee,"
With words by Bill Fosdick. But me,
"Love me tender," I croon
When I sing that old tune,
Because florid just isn't my key.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"This letter is great! Where'd you find it?"
"It's a forgery. Still, I don't mind it.
See? The signature says:
'John F. Kennedy, Prez.'
It was really my uncle who signed it."

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
It appears I'm of file space bereft,
Though at miniature writing I'm deft.
I've amassed many reams
Over time. So it seems
I've no shelving for paperwork left.

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
Good things come, so they say, if you wait
And forbear to complain of your fate.
Although one such abider
Said, after she died, her
Own patience ran out far too late.

limerick_list.author: kandabongo
limerick_list.text:
Awry is when upset impedes
Like a beautiful putt (into weeds).
It's when A's turn to D's,
Or (forgive me now, please)
It's a loaf filled with caraway seeds.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
His new diet, drawn up,  puts a ban
On all fat-laden food, like cheese flan.
While his doc's drawn on skill,
He'll need will to fulfil
Such a long-term, drawn out sort of plan.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
A man and a plan, a canal!
Is not quite a palindrome, pal.
But a way to let ships
Make the shortest of trips
And a route to your eardrum's locale.

limerick_list.author: bestswanbird
limerick_list.text:
Better swab him from chin down to shin,
In advance of the knife going in.
Use that Betadine, nurse,
'Cos infection is worse
Than the stain the stuff leaves on the skin.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
My backache's not caused by sciatica,
Inflammation, or spasms rheumatic-a.
Blame my spinal condition
On a yogic position
I tried on a trip to Karnataka.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a costule, a ridge or a knurl
On a shell, like this mother-of-pearl:
That's a beautiful pattern,
Like rings around Saturn,
And certain to win you the girl.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
A cig-hating fellow from Sweden
Sued a gal cause she smoked during weedin'.
Now smoking's been banned
On much of her land.
What's next? Litigation o'er readin'?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Firsthand knowledge is crucial in war.
That's what spies are essentially for.
"Al told Kate who told Mike
Who told Max," and the like,
Will yield info you're wise to ignore.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
With slander or libel or worse,
His good name I don't want to asperse.
He has brains like an ox
Or a box full of rocks—
But on that you won't hear me converse.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Whether found on a leaf or a shoot,
Our galls are distinctive, and cute.
We are busy, wee flies
(Think mosquito in size)
Rarely seen, but well known by repute.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
With exploitable resources here,
We'll extract them for many a year.
There is oil in the ground,
Plus the iron we found.
We'll deplete them and then disappear.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For Edison Lighthouse, a bit
Of success came.  This band had a hit
With the single "Love Grows
(Where My Rosemary Goes),"
But as far as hits go, that was it.

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
You're trying to write every day
But you really have nothing to say.
To suit the occasion?
A simple erasion—
That's rub it all out; walk away.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I saw my new roommate, I freaked.
Her nose was enormous and beaked.
That immense hooked proboscis
Would grace a colossus;
When she started to sneeze, out I sneaked.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
In Chaucer's time, one who was scratching
Was said to be busily craching—
"I kenth not what thou hath,"
Saith the goodwyf of Bath,
"But I certaignely hope 'tis not catching."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Once the 22, then 33,
Sought on global reform to agree.
Will the systems financial
Face changes substantial?
I doubt so, we'll just have to see.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Grab a seat, boys, some grub and a beer;
We eat collar and shoulder in here.
Meat is fresh off the grill.
Don't be shy, eat your fill.
Dinners family style ring with good cheer.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
A czar is a tzar is a tsar —
It's the plum job in Russia by far.
At the top of the tree,
Decked in purple, is he
Who commands proto-U.S.S.R.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I'd been ostracised, shunned, left to brood:
In three words, "sent to Coventry". Who'd
Ever link this condition
With naked ambition?
(Where Lady Godiva rode — nude!)

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The slopes of the walls of a fort,
If they're steep, help to cumber or thwart
Your attackers or foes.
Such a counterscarp slows
Their ascent while you marshal support.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
His command center's suddenly failing.
His whole psyche is quickly derailing.
With frontal lobes battered,
His character's shattered.
Attempts at repair?  Unavailing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Your freedom of speech? Exercisable!
You can use it. To stop you's despisable.
Write "HEADMASTER'S A FOOL"
On the walls of the school.
(I'm assuming your printing's disguisable.)

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
All hail Lakers great, Kobe Bryant!
As a backcourtman, truly he's giant.
Points per game?  Gosh, two dozen!
All the fans are a-buzzin'.
Want an autograph?  He'll be compliant.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Consequentialist: that's what I'll be.
No rigid decrees shackle me.
So if good comes of action,
Ignore the infraction.
My maxim: I think and live free.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dear reader: in scanning this copy,
Don't conclude that it's—sad to say—sloppy.
It's undoubted: my pashes
Are: colons—and dashes—
And, yes—they make limericks choppy.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A wee child puffs a dandelion head,
And its seeds are dispersed, widely spread.
From this same basic word,
A dispersal's occurred
When a shooting-range target is read.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
My ex-wives all like lazing around.
The best form of employment they've found
Is collecting from me
What I pay by decree.
To support them, I'm legally bound.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Sometimes barriers slow down the pace
That gets people and things place to place.
Bridges, detours, and tunnels
Are trafficking funnels
A transporter's likely to face.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A struggling young actor from Tripoli
At auditions read speeches too drippily.
While he strove to seem hawkish,
He was maudlin and mawkish,
And was often dismissed rather snippily.

limerick_list.author: Dave Jermy
limerick_list.text:
When you've spent all night acting the lush,
And you dress, half asleep, in a rush,
Give the barnet a comb
Before you leave home
Or your head will resemble a brush.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At Agincourt, longbows embarrass
(As Henry's proud Englishmen harass)
The French and their armor,
Thus forcing each farmer
In Arras to flee into Paris.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Ed Long sends the kitchenware crashing,
Keenly dashing to take on the mashing
Of potato for lunch—
While his wife packs a punch
With her usual "Ed, dear, you're Smashing!"

limerick_list.author: CruzerX and Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My stitchery art on the wall
Runs from A (five feet high) to z (small).
Most letters I'll do;
The thirteenth I eschew
'Cause I will not M broider at all.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The elves at the North Pole colluded
To make many kids feel deluded
When they opened a toy.
Yes, it lessened their joy
To read, "Batteries (dry) not included."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Folks, meet Snead.  I suggest that you heed 'er —
She's our ammeter/voltmeter reader.
She's the best; no deterrent
Slows her measuring current
And voltage with speed — Snead's the leader!

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I am tortured by blistering heat,
With no shoes, in a world of concrete.
There's no victory won
In this harsh noon-day sun—
Just the agony felt in defeat.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Treating children with autism through
ABA's what we therapists do.
Reinforcement and chaining,
Your work can be draining,
But the child will behave as per you!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Said Tommy to Bob and to Paul
(While watching the rope—and a fall
Thus avoiding by grabs), "I'll
Continue to abseil!"
They rappelled down the cliff's steepest wall.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A groupie is often a pest,
Not allowing a rock star to rest.
Not permitting much joy,
One will always annoy,
Yet the problem is rarely addressed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
It's a mix-up, a cock-up: a mess
Which you carelessly failed to address.
It's a plan gone awry.
It's a kite that won't fly.
Do I think it's a balls-up? Oh, yes!

limerick_list.author: birdbarf
limerick_list.text:
My fictional wife is not real,
Which is part of her charm and appeal.
First she's here, then she's not.
When I miss her a lot,
I await her return with great zeal.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Has the charter school seal been embossed
By the new Sec of Ed.? What's the cost
To the kids left behind?
Will she pay them no mind?
Have the public school kids been DeVos'd?

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
The dry spell, prolonged and extreme,
Imperilled the shaman's esteem,
So he danced in a trance
On the chance he'd enhance
The small base flow sustaining his stream.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
By the gate we impatiently wait
To attend all the shows on the slate.
We can hardly stay still,
Since this theater's bill
Isn't double or triple, but eight!

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
As the Limerick Enlightenment grew,
Dostoevsky was versified too.
There was venting of spleen.
Strolin should have foreseen
Rhyme and Pun-ishment's acrid review.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
"Watch that crotchety crank!" warned the nurse.
But he heard, and to make matters worse,
Threw his bedpan and tray
In a colourful spray,
And his specs and his teeth, with a curse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To my son, half asleep on the floor:
"All day long it's been chore after chore.
I have cooked.  I have cleaned.
I have worked like a fiend.
Would it kill you to answer the door?!"

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A hard-hearted hunter named Hackett
Spied a stag and decided to whack it.
You can tell that it's dead
Because of its head,
Which now stares down his hall on a bracket.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The winner, with laurels enwreathed,
Stood and smiled—my how deeply he breathed!
While the crowd loudly cheered,
For his safety I feared,
As the athletes who lost cursed and seethed.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
'Complimentary Leisure Facilities'.
This freebie had great possibilities.
But from service to showers,
'Twas like Fawlty Towers:
Only go if you want to feel ill-at-ease.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This is farmable land: we can till it.
Fertile earth we can plough and then fill it
With grain in the fields,
And see what it yields,
Such as wheat, barley, oats, rye or millet.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though he first had to float several loans,
Now he's paid the full price, and Dad owns
His own cemetery plot,
So he's sure that he's got
A good spot made for resting his bones.

limerick_list.author: Type A
limerick_list.text:
My future ex-wife did avouch,
"I'll make no bones about it — don't slouch! —
I think you're perverse,
Gross, aversive, and worse —
You don't listen…Hey, feet off the couch!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The young man had been weaned off his drug.
He was no longer viewed as a thug.
But a flashback — so bad —
Made him see his poor dad
As a vampire — the kill took one slug.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The fascist thinks nothing of crushing
Political enemies, brushing
Aside all conventions
And laws. His intentions
Are clear: do his worst, without blushing.

limerick_list.author: Blind Pig
limerick_list.text:
Abaft the beam: nautical phrase
From the long ago wooden ship days;
A phrase you might spy in
Some work by O'Brian,
"To the rear," is the thought it conveys.

limerick_list.author: BobfromThirsk
limerick_list.text:
Said the elderly farmer, "It's fine,
It's repaired to my own grand design—
Nailed together and bound
And held well off the ground
By the finest of old binder twine."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new headmaster's really a stranger
To our school, and I fear there's a danger:
As the man hates to dance,
We may forfeit our chance
For a prom. He's a dog in the manger.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Dentalism: noun, obsolete.
Definition: "dentality." Neat.
What is that? "Dental quality."
Stop this frivolity!
Tell me its meaning tout de suite.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Every time we go walking, he'll pee
On some hydrants and many a tree.
So wherever we roam,
He will know the way home
By his calling card.  "Dad, follow me!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The teacher said Bradley had fabulated
Too many stories. She'd tabulated
Tales in her log —
Dubbed Brad's Homework v. Dog —
Which explains how Brad's labrador Abdul ate it.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am certainly not feeling fine
Since I fell, coming out of the mine.
Could that fall manufacture
A compression-type fracture—
A collapse of a bone in my spine?

limerick_list.author: Cuttlefish
limerick_list.text:
It takes more than a simple disguise
When you're hiding from predators' eyes,
So some cephalopods
Try improving their odds;
They change hues: they chameleonize.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the Pyrenees, snow-capped and piney,
Lies Andorra, a nation quite tiny.
You say countries so small
Are worth nothing at all?
You're a dope and can go kiss my heinie!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a wine vessel, baked shiny black:
True bucchero, from quite a while back —
A pre-Roman antique.
(Are your knees getting weak?)
And that doubter? An ignorant quack.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Should Ms Barnes have been driving? "No way!"
Is the message I want to convey.
Was she able to show
A good license? Hell, no.
The court pulled it the previous day!

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
Randolph, a boondoggler clerk,
Wrote limericks, pretending to work.
His boss, late one night,
Saw the times on the site;
The next morning he fired the jerk!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A chin-wag is simply a chat:
A slang word for gossip, one that
Invites a quick grin
As we picture the chin
Of each speaker who's chewing the fat.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Baccivorous birds biting berries
Could cheerfully choke chewing cherries,
But detest the idea
Of "Cherry Garcia",
That deadly ice cream (Ben and Jerry's).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
While you wait, on a surfboard astraddle,
Some surfer chick, scantily clad'll
Appear close behind,
So what plan comes to mind?
Backpaddle!  Backpaddle!  Backpaddle!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You really are snake-in-the-grass-ing —
It's optical junk that you're passing!
Your sin is omission.
This camera's condition
Is worn, and with obvious brassing.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A gopher, exceedingly thorough,
Finds a field's most felicitous furrow.
It's a suitable start;
Time to practice his art —
To claw through the earth and to burrow.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A suspension of rights is conceivable.
A complete fascist state is believable.
While the mood is intense,
Call it "Homeland Defense"
And then any corruption's achievable.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bearing tree sits in a stand,
And upon it is noted what's planned.
The surveyors have left,
And we'll soon be bereft
'Cause they won't leave a tree on this land.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Shh!  Now I know how we can get
That avocet home as our pet:
As we're nearing the shore,
You brandish your oar,
And I'll capture the bird with my net.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In my school was a boy who'd harass
Every girl in our self-defense class.
He was sassy and crass,
And made passes en masse
Till a lass in a sling put his ass.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Young George was determined to rock
The whole church, and all priests to unfrock.
His zeal sacrilegious
Was really egregious:
In fact he stood out from the flock.

limerick_list.author: Lawrence A. Herman
limerick_list.text:
To solve some equations, apply
Mathematics, and use it to try
To find x; but bivariate
Ones can be hairy; it
Seems they have both x and y.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The pickets who plan to protest
Against management make me depressed,
So I'll counter their strike
With this sign: "Take a Hike!"
(After donning a bulletproof vest).

limerick_list.author: Nathan Howe
limerick_list.text:
Crippleware, demoware, baitware
Are programs that run, but what ain't there
Is the key or the code
Or the printable mode;
'Til you pay, it's annoying not-greatware.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
There's a judge in the news who forgot
To be fair, as he'd promised; he got
Sent to prison, which shows
Often that's how it goes:
Some who swear to be balanced are not.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An aptonym, Ringo had guessed,
Was a name where one's job is addressed.
Had this been the case
For the guy he'd replace,
You'd have known him as Pete Second-Best.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Beam me up, Scotty, now!" yelled Jim Kirk,
"From this Klingon convenience store clerk
Who insists that I pay
For my own Milky Way;
You must get me away from this jerk!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you've lost lots of blood, as a rule
(So they taught me in medical school),
For immediate gain,
To send blood to your brain,
You'll reduce your abdominal pool.

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
Do you celebrate holidays? Fewish.
Do you never say prayers? Yes, that's trueish.
An acediast, I
Just explain with a sigh,
"See, I don't need to practice—I'm Jewish."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Use dry masonry building this wall;
Fill the spaces twixt large rocks with small."
It is clear in Mort's order:
"In building this border,
Don't use any mortar at all!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are women who hope to impress
When they add this or that to their dress.
They're accessorized then,
Even though they know men
Like it more when they wear even less.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
A cartilage cancer is known
As a chondrosarcoma. When shown
To a doc with a 'scope
(A pathologist, dope),
He will grade this rare tumor of bone.

limerick_list.author: johng
limerick_list.text:
The burbot, a mottled green fish,
When cooked is a very nice dish.
It's a freshwater cod,
Which is really quite odd.
Lota lota it's called, if you wish.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
To blend is to mix; here's a "viz.":
Variations on missus 'n' miz,
And in many a word
That from strangers is heard—
So, from blending, yore dialect's riz.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Because Gabe suffers grave alcolasia,
His gait will resemble abasia.
He's constantly plastered.
Says Mom: "Jail the bastard!"
His brother suggests euthanasia.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Anthotyro? Yes, have a piece
Of traditional whey cheese from Greece.
Dietetic? Not quite,
Though eat tons and you might
Be surprised it won't make you obese.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An accessory apartment is where
You might give old Aunt Harriet care
(Her own place, in your home,
With your Uncle Jerome),
Or keep teenagers out of your hair.

limerick_list.author: Ardub23
limerick_list.text:
I'm an esper. Though destiny's kittle,
I can scry future crises a little.
The good news: it's not
What you think. But the plot
Has a twist, and you're caught in the middle.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"I am Hypno the Great. I stand tall.
I astonish, amaze, I enthrall,
Spellbind all and astound
With my magic renowned."
"I assist him. I'm Schlomo the Small."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The names of some plants may sound silly.
A shrub that is found down in Chile
Produces a nut
That is edible, but
Don't just cut off its fruit  willy-nilly.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Your due credits, unless you decline,
Will appear in a courtesy line.
You produced it, you own it.
Now it's apt that fact's known. It
Attributes a name to design.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
Your belching and farting and grunts
Are insulting. I tire of your stunts.
  You're a rude and crude dude
  Who eats food in the nude!
I find many and sundry affronts.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I will back you each step of the way
And confirm that your statement's okay.
To your words I'll attest,
Any doubts lay to rest
And corroborate all that you say.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They look luscious placed there on the table:
Dessert grapes, or so reads the label.
Though wine grapes are sweeter,
These, seedless, are neater.
As to hue, grapes range sunny to sable.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
The closing tick's down: that's bad news.
Frugal living the Greeks do not choose.
 Every market is tumbling;
Investors are grumbling.
Will ouzo abolish their blues?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Cystinuria's cystine in pee.
Sister Gloria happens to be
Born (nay, cursed!) with that ill
For which docs have no pill;
Best drink water daylong, all agree.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
In the Great War, the British-led nations
Looked poorly on Deutsch appellations,
Renaming their pets
With staunch epithets:
German Shepherds turned into Alsatians.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A byname is something you take
When your parents have made a mistake,
Like the dancer named Gay
Who informed us today
That his nom de ballet will be Jake.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This will surely be solvable. Still,
Decidability's currently nil.
But be patient, okay?
I get closer each day,
Using doggedness, genius and will.

limerick_list.author: Tom Foolery
limerick_list.text:
Though hardly a word that's opaque
(It means "of an aunt," for Pete's sake!),
The adjective auntly
Is used very scantly
And always appears a mistake.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Alameda: a walkway with trees.
It's where folks in the town shoot the breeze,
Where mothers can stroll
While their offspring cajole,
And where teens are transmitting disease.

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
An assassin was sent to Stonehenge
To give justice (or dole out revenge).
As he fingered the trigger,
Came a voice that got bigger:
"It is My role—not yours—to avenge."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Meditation will help you unwind,
But in order to do it, you'll find,
You must shut out all sorts
Of extraneous thoughts.
That is, you must empty your mind.

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
I used to have beautiful abs,
Which developed like hard-as-rock slabs.
But as aging came on
My ab muscles, long gone,
Left instead just the ugliest flabs.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cenozoic: its years total, oh,
Maybe 65 million or so.
All the creatures and plants
Now alive got their chance
To arise in this era and grow.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Not the most insignificant moon
In our system, it's still picayune.
Dysmonia's the one
Farthest off from the sun.
I'm not planning on visiting soon.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Minnesota and Waller: a pair
Of large guys with a name they both share.
Navarro and Domino
Have that same nom—we know
Each sported waistline to spare.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our country's no longer so great;
Unseen hands are controlling our fate.
I have rightly suspected
That those we've elected
Are ruled by a secret deep state.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Here's a mind-teasing riddle for you—
You can ride it and learn from it, too.
Verb or noun it can be
(It's confusing, you see).
Did you guess that it's coach from the clue?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We respected our new civic leader,
An intelligent chap, quite a reader.
Our esteem soon was tested
When we saw him arrested—
An unlicensed driver, a speeder!

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
I'm back, though it makes me feel low.
I've returned, shaking off every blow.
You exclaimed, "Go to hell!"
When I said my farewell,
So I'm back in the hell that I know.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
My mem'ry's a fleeting illusion,
Tossed about on a sea of confusion.
I'm upset, and regret
That I'm apt to forget
What I'd planned for this limerick's ending.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
A dghaisa will keep you afloat;
It's a gondola sort of a boat
For the people of Malta.
Its use will not falter—
See its shiny and bright painted coat.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
We are sundews (the Drosera genus).
"Quite striking!" say folk who have seen us.
On leaves, quite like hands,
Mucilaginous glands
Make short work of the insects between us.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
With the candidates straddling the fence,
And the voters incurably dense,
Our election looms, ominous,
For lack of more commonness
In misleadingly named common sense.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
It was wrong from the start, and he knew it.
He succumbed to an urge, and he blew it.
Robbed a Holiday Inn
To take care of his kin.
Could it be that his genes made him do it?

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
From a Benz with a bulletproof body,
The Pope blesses massed glitterati.
Some accept papal bull
Till their bellies are full,
While the bull-proof instead think he's dotty.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
There was a wee bairn they called Hamish
(A name that's quite rare and not same-ish).
His parents, once wild,
With the birth of their child
Became ever-so-slightly more tame-ish.

limerick_list.author: Mr E S
limerick_list.text:
Said young Dilbert, "I'll make an assertion:
This manager wastes my exertion.
He's so out of touch—
Then, one doesn't see much
With a cranial rectal insertion."

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
"She appeared like a blonde apparition.
Now my heart is," sighed Art, "in remission."
Wearing awe on his sleeve,
He may nevermore leave
Bedazzlement's heightened condition.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"In these six feet of dirt lies his bed
Evermore," the priest solemnly said
Of my friend, who's now not
In his burial plot —
The departed became the undead.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The lymphocyte granules retaining
Blue aniline dyes, we're explaining,
Have a name that's arcane,
Like the cells with that grain:
Both are azurophilic in staining.

limerick_list.author: Mr. Davis
limerick_list.text:
A fugue has a musical theme,
And voices an intricate scheme.
Like Joyce's rich phrases,
Bach wrote wondrous mazes —
His gift to us all is supreme!

The theme is repeated by voices,
A stream ruled by consonant choices.
At times hard to swallow,
Yet if one can follow,
Then teeming with awe, one rejoices!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here at work, there's a co-op that buys,
In great bulk, all our office supplies.
Ballpoint pens by the ton
When you only need one
May be cheap but, gee whiz, is it wise?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
She centers her life on her son.
He's her focus, her favorite—the one
She attends to and favors.
I bet that this shaver's
A self-centered kid when she's done.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Hear the clanking and rumbles of cogs
As the barking drum tumbles the logs.
All the billets are stripped
Of their bark, which is shipped
To the chipper (along with the frogs).

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When babies aren't hungry or wet;
No colic, not teething, and yet
They still scream, then some mummies
Apply soothing dummies:
They're a godsend? Said one mum, "You bet!"

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
Doctors say that what sickened Aunt Phyllis
Were the spores of the anthrax bacillus.
They survive in her clothes;
Should we choose to wear those,
I'm afraid those damned bugs might just kill us.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
You wanted to set an example,
Row spacing and water were ample.
Your chickens won't grow?
It's obvious! (Though,
To be safe, you should send a soil sample.)

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The dumbstruck young man was un-grounded,
Bewildered, confused, and confounded,
Astonished, amazed,
Flabbergasted, and dazed—
Stunned speechless, appalled, and astounded.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This is Dimetane, allergy med
That can ease your rose fever, it's said.
Brompheniramine maleate
Is likely to palliate
Those symptoms that yearly you dread.

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
In physics, his work's at the core,
But, please, I can't take any more!
This Dane might be smart,
But I only read part,
'Cause I think he is simply a Bohr.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If you're going to travel by sewer,
Don't swim.  Be instead a canoer.
While within your canoe
You've a much better view,
And the times that you puke will be fewer.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The Three Stooges? My friends thought them great,
An opinion I'd often debate.
Tell me, how did they ever
Believe themselves clever?
I enjoyed them, but then I turned eight.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Your mom's an exceptor," screamed Heather,
"Objecting to me! She's your tether!
Our wedding, let's skip!
You're attached at her hip!
I just know you'll be happy together!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was sweating so hard I was soaked;
Then I looked at the tube, and I choked.
The bronchoscopy stung
As it checked out my lung—
Now I deeply regret that I smoked!

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Birdie sweetly sings songs—pretty thing
Flies around on (chirp) feathery wing
(Chirp, chirp) spreading its cheer
And that bird flu, we hear.
(Chirp) "Beware, folks, beware!" it'll sing.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Her cadging she wears like a badge.
She's a moocher, my dear cousin Madge.
Now she's "borrowed" my sable,
My laptop, my table,
And she also taught me how to cadge!

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Brought a cake for my folks' special day,
But then learned that, in this town café,
We could not cut a slice
Without paying the price:
There was cakeage (like corkage) to pay.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If you bring in the latest technology
So that folks can control their ecology,
Like helping crops sprout
After battling drought,
That's the field of applied anthropology.

limerick_list.author: Reia Light
limerick_list.text:
The woes of life leave me so stressed
That I never can get any rest.
But I know why I'm blue—
I have bipolar II,
Which mostly just means I'm depressed.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Are reduced costs for health now in sight,
Or will riskier care cause some fright?
Will those charges decline
When we're no longer fine?
Will "no mandate" prove Price is quite right?

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When you proffer an offer of proof
That includes a conceptual goof,
Then your chances fall off
For a job as a prof.
They will think that it proves you're a doof.

limerick_list.author: Val
Val
limerick_list.text:
Not specifically known as a speaker,
Archimedes, alert with his beaker,
Taking breaths long and deep
Near a smelly old sheep,
Might have commented drily, "Eureka."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
She was drawn to him right from the start,
And she longs for him when they're apart.
Now, throughout every day
That her love is away,
She is holding him close, in her heart.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Said the peasant, 'Oi, Thomas, could you
Lend a hand with this water I drew?'
As I shouldered one end
Of his stick, he said, 'Friend,
A stout colstaff swings burdens twixt two.'

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
To judge by its sound, avenaceous
Must mean "venal, avenging, audacious."
But no, it denotes
Only "of or like oats."
The impression, it seems, was fallacious.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jesus nailed to a cross made of wood
Made a scene the boy misunderstood:
"If Good Friday," he sighed,
"Is the day Jesus died,
Can you tell me just why that day's good?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With each haircut I get, I will hear
This dumb riddle my barber holds dear.
Quite succinctly composed:
"When we're open, we're closed!"
Then he laughs and near cuts off an ear.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
A weatherman, Wally, from Welly
Had pockets of gas in his belly.
"It's breezy today,"
He managed to say
Through wind gusts that turned him to jelly.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Becky Sue, with the 40-inch chest,
Was no-sex-until-marriage obsessed.
What I felt then when she
Turned out flat as could be?
Disillusionment sums it up best.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
To protest higher tolls, I've a sly way
That beats angry emails since my way
Backs up traffic for miles,
As it generates smiles:
I recline fully nude by the highway.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
That old gownsman's the talk of the town.
After preaching, he went to sit down,
But his balance gave way,
Putting all on display—
He had nothing on under his gown.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
In reflection, an object, we find,
May be twinned, of identical kind;
But you're needing to know
That when that isn't so
They're enantiomorphously designed.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
He forgot about placing the bets
And then ran up incredible debts.
But this new aide-mémoire
Is a boon for Babar;
Now the elephant never forgets.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
If you want to disrobe with finesse,
A string vest is no route to success.
Y-fronts, too, are quite wrong.
Never ponder a thong!
Wear CKs and undress to impress.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
When I winked at a brassy-skinned lass,
She spoke brassily, hand on her ass:
"Baby, this costs a lot.
How much brass have you got?" —
I was brassed off: the girl was a brass!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
An Emmanuel student, Darius,
Disported an aulary bias.
All things apropos
Of his hall made him glow:
His devotion to Emma was pious.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Through a rotating drum, heated air
Will evaporate moisture.  It's rare,
After clothes-dryer tumbling,
To find me not grumbling
'Cause one of my socks lost its pair.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Though it's glaringly obvious that
You're in love with that hideous hat,
Your conspicuous dress
Tells the world you're a mess—
And it sure doesn't help that you're fat!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Self-government gives me the hots,
Since the people are calling the shots.
This autonomist knows
That's how liberty grows,
Even though there'll be haves and have-nots.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I'm entitled to not have to work.
I'm deserving of perk upon perk.
Should I slave, make a living,
When everyone's giving
Me dough?  It's my right — I'm no jerk!

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
This tailoring school is a farce:
Haute couture that they're teaching? My arse!
Yes, they've sold us a pup;
We've been neatly stitched up.
I am cutting today's cutting class.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Building curb cuts and ramps helps to ease
The use of a wheelchair, and please
Those who ride about town,
Going up, round, and down,
Making each change of level a breeze.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Sammy Davis, named after his pa
(And tagged 'Junior'), remarked, "There's no bar—
If a one-eyed, black Jew
Makes it, why shouldn't you?
Sing like me, and you oughta go far."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Code White: patients coming like mad,
Close the curtains—the weather's real bad,
A bellicose lout,
The lights have gone out,
Or some crunch pediatrics has had.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
To a terrorist wearing a smirk, a
Fanatic who's turning berserk, a
Big jerk named Osama:
We noticed your mama
Wears combat boots under her burqa.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm afraid I've bad news for you, Bud.
See this slide that we made from your blood?
Every red cell's a crescent.
Though your pain's now quiescent,
You've drepanocytes, Bud, in a flood.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
You behave like I'm only a load,
Like a burden, like goods to be stowed.
Excess baggage, am I?
Well, hello and goodbye —
So are you babe, like one for the road.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Brightly flowered, my favorite trees
Sway red in the tropical breeze;
Not scarlet, but nicely
Near crimson — precisely,
The French word for cherry, cerise.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Daisy broke Randy's heart when he found
That the bitch had been sleeping around.
He wept tears of disgust
And of pain, saying just,
"It is time you went back to the pound."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When one of her pipes sprang a leak,
The plumber who called took a peek.
He said, "Pipework gets wrecked
If not frequently checked,"
So it is, when he comes (twice a week).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Bemoaned Prudence, "Oh, my!  Goodness gracious!
What's now commonplace once was salacious."
She was clutching her pearls.
"No respectable girls
Would show cleavage in efforts flirtatious."

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
As a teen I faced utter disgrace
With my torso confined in a brace.
It was meant to align
My misshapen young spine—
Now it's back in its natural place.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
What honor it is to illuminate
The pivotal role of albuminate.
It's of the same ilk
As casein in milk:
Two proteins upon which to ruminate.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
In our thumb wars, your thumb won't be found,
And at arm wrestling, I'm more renowned.
But don't stare at me, please—
I'll blink first, ill at ease—
Staring contests I lose, every round.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a number of shares of a stock,
Or a cubical section of rock;
An obstruction you dread,
Or a toy, or your head.
These are five of the meanings of block.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In martinis, a nice dry vermouth
Is the greatest thing going, in truth.
Pour a fine dry champagne
And I'll never complain,
But dry milk? Serving that stuff's uncouth!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My lawyer just called on the phone,
And he's summoning me to depone
With my husband. We both
Will be grilled, under oath.
Well, I'd hate to depone all alone!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The animal liberationists say
That our four-legged kin we betray.
In defense of their cause,
They may break many laws:
"It's a higher command we obey."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Storing data was always a breeze
On diskettes used with early PCs.
Small-capacity based,
They would soon be replaced
By the product used now—DVDs.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
Quickbeam
limerick_list.text:
There's an Irishman down in the quarry
Who manoeuvres the twenty-ton lorry.
His head is quite bare
For he hasn't a hair.
His name? Al O'Pecia. [I'm sorry....]

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Seeking swifts' nests in caves: what a pastime!
Lost my hand-hold in bird turds the last time.
All those slimy walls climbed
Leave me fouled and begrimed.
The soup's great. So far, no plaster cast time.
