limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
How eludible, dear, is thy heart —
Evading sweet grasp from the start.
With your love never won,
Do you know what you've done?
You've upended my life's apple cart.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
When the feedback's aversive, it's meant
As a punishment. There's no descent
  Into rancor or bile....
  Oh, you like it?  You smile?
That was certainly not my intent.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Here's a secret I keep under wraps:
Through the daytime I sneak little naps.
Then I get home to life
With my partying wife —
I'll make midnight before I collapse.

limerick_list.author: R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
Proper diallel mating dictates
That each female gets two or more mates.
Then offspring are tested;
An answer requested:
Which parent is transmitting traits?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though his blade's edge was covered in rust,
He was challenged, and felt that he must,
At the risk of his life, fight
His foe in a knife fight,
Accepting the man's cut-and-thrust.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I'm sorry if this is too strong,
But how didya get it so wrong?
Yer never that dense—
Ya got commonsense—
So don't be a drongo, ya nong.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Call waiting?  I hate it!  And why?
Seems I'm always the number two guy.
I'll be talking with Lynne,
Someone else will beep in,
Then: "I'll call ya tomorrow.  G'bye."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
With confusables, here is my stance:
Entomology, seen at a glance,
Can resemble, you know,
Etymology, so
Just remember, it's "Nuts, we've got ants!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said Dean Martin, "I'll take a chablis."
Dino's friend told the barkeep. "Let's see.
My preferred drink is pale.
Make it lager or ale
For this little ole beer drinker, me."

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
That was naughty, young Fanny Ann Phelps,
Attacking your granny with skelps!
Her old eyes became wild
As she chided the child—
(You don't have to be mad, but it helps).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This is smokable stuff, guaranteed,
Which could get you as high as you need.
But you're fresh out of cash,
So you won't score a stash.
What a drag not to drag on some weed.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle and Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Haemoglobin's the reason blood's red.
Too anaemic, you'll head for your bed.
Its four haems are the key—
Each contains an Fe.
Keep your corpuscles fed or be dead!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the North, there were Whigs who appeased
Southern states, leaving slaveholders pleased.
Cotton Whig was a name
Of contempt, not acclaim,
Ten years later when Sumter was seized.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In short, "female" is what this word means:
Your Lulus, Lucilles and Francines;
Cleos, Clementines, Emilys —
Big girly femilies!
Being femeline's all in your Jeans.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Poor Joey and Jimmy can't wed;
In their land it's illegal to bed.
But Joe's down on one knee:
"Pledge commitment to me
In a ceremony — vows must be said."

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
"A cavil," said Pete, "is evasion.
Avoid it on every occasion.
Just try to relax,
And know all your facts,
So then you'll convince by persuasion."

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Some guys have luxuriant crines
That they spike in audacious designs;
Like pompadoured poodles
They pamper their noodles
And polish their hair till it shines.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Getting shipwrecked on Lesbos was Ben,
Who learned women there don't have a yen
For the straight life, and so
Having nowhere to go,
He accepted his fate to date men.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
Bicoloured? Two colours, that's right!
Blue and green? Red and yellow? Well, quite.
Two disparate shades,
And the meaning parades
Before you in clear black and white.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Yes, I wed him without prejudicialness,
Then enjoyed married life's sweet initialness.
Thus I learned wedlock would
Produce nothing but good.
Be assured: marriage brings beneficialness.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Turning forty, I felt some remorse
When my wife, as a matter of course,
Asked, "So what would you like
For your birthday—a bike?"
And I answered with, "No, a divorce."

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
A sensitive singer is Dottie;
Her ear is attuned to Vallotti.
When she sings with the harp,
All her F's will sound sharp.
Said the harpist, "Poor Dottie, she's potty!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Could a juror be influenced, bought?
That's embracery, so I was taught.
Now this word is passé.
Make that charge and I'd say
That your efforts will all come to naught.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
In that tiny and horrible bed-sit
It was tough to see just how the bed fit.
The old mattress was flat
But the worst thing was that
All the bugs that were there in the bed bit.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
As a lad, I got bashed and assailed;
Every bully I battled prevailed.
Have you heard of the child
Who was born to be wild?
I'm the kid who was born to be whaled.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
When I left this titanic old wreck,
The cold water came up to my neck.
Would my desperate swimming
Come up to a brimming
Performance? I simply must check!

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
My A levels bore no success,
I'm humbly obliged to confess.
It's not hard to determine
I failed Maths and German—
And no credits for cricket and chess!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Herpetologists chewing the fat
Note that rattlers are constant, in that,
When sunning on soil,
They favor a coil —
Why do snakes always wind up like that?

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
In a series of ancient migrations,
Certain Celts put down roots in locations
That used to be Phrygian.
Aggressive? A smidgen!
These bullies were called the Galatians.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The big cities?  More liberal.  It's true.
Liberal counties?  The relative few
Are just islands, it's said,
In a vast sea of red,
Making Democrats bluer than blue.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
She perched, without pants, on my blotter;
I imagined the scene would get hotter.
It was not what you think:
She had sat in some ink,
And was hoping the pad would de-spot her.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Before we have plighted our troth
And have sought out a man of the cloth,
I expect you to bring
Me a large diamond ring,
Not this pitiful diamondback moth.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Her boredom was eye-glazing.  Weary,
She yawned and her vision grew bleary.
Before leaving, my date
Made it known how I rate.
"I'm so sorry.  You're dreadfully dreary."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
When Ferdinand Phelps had the flu,
His temperature soared, and he grew
Quite delirious — he
Spied the queen up a tree,
And found mice rolling dice in the loo.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
It's a box, with a catch, and what's more, a
Pair of locks by the latch — and I'm sure a
Tiny peek is no sin;
Just a glimpse — what's within?
Click it open and show me, Pandora.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Robin's outlaws were having such fun.
Into thickets of trees they would run,
With the Sheriff behind 'em,
Unable to find 'em—
Copse and robbers combined into one.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Creationary ("tied to Creation"):
The belief that the whole world's formation
Was done by some god,
Which seems wrong and quite odd,
I would say from my own observation.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A farmer, unfailingly perky,
As biltong preserved all his turkey
From buttock to tongue.
So he salted and hung
It to dry in the sun—it was jerky.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
Susan Boyle said she'd never been kissed,
And she knew that she could have been hissed;
But she blew them away —
All the judges said, "Yay!"
So she ended up totally blissed.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
Rocky outcrops and sand in the spray
Of the sea always brighten my day.
Here the coastline's stark grace
Is a magical place,
Where the water and land interplay.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
When the topic's expense, bear in mind
Bluefin tuna is one of a kind.
Per pound pay three C's,
So with prices like these,
I'm to albacore tuna resigned.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
At the sight of a dental syringe,
I bite down on my teeth and I cringe,
With a hope it goes quick,
Cuz I can't take the prick
When that needle begins to impinge.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Behind the bead curtain she lies,
Barely clad, batting dark bedroom eyes.
Through its strands snatch a glimpse
Of the curves that her pimp's
Vied to sell (and it keeps out the flies).

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
As Darwin made note, way back when:
Apes are closely related to men.
They often are better
Than any jet setter—
Why keep them in zoo cages, then?

limerick_list.author: Virge
limerick_list.text:
You can tell that he's animatronic,
Just a puppet with mumblings moronic.
To provoke an attack,
See the box on his back —
Press the button that's marked "histrionic."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I had tipped her, a pretty but dumb thing,
A fifty, which may seem a rum thing.
Why so generous? Well,
Though the service was hell,
She was topless, and that counts for something.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Descartes asked a surfer dude, "Bro,
With certainty what can we know?"
"Fer sure we can say
Your brain's gnarly, René.
Grab a board and just go with the flow."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm embarrassed to have to report
That my phone is the old-fashioned sort.
It's so far from 3G,
There's no caller ID,
And my number?  Three longs and a short.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A thing that's designed to be used
With a second keeps people amused.
When my software gets old,
I buy add-ins—behold!
I'm enthused where before I just snoozed.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The direction from you to the Sun?
Antisolar's the opposite one.
On a dark, moonless night,
Ghostly Gegenschein light
Can be seen there, if cities you shun.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I embarked on a quest in pursuit
Of listening to Eskimo-Aleut.
Thus I gamely set forth
To the lands of the north:
From Great Sitkin to Greenland, my route.

limerick_list.author: Meps Schulte
limerick_list.text:
Said the millionaire, "I'd never steal,"
But I watched as he cadged a free meal.
Then he took some gal's beer,
Saying, "Thanks, you're a dear."
What a cheapskate! Is this guy for real?

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
Our sensitive doves have stopped preening.
"Conditions in here are demeaning,"
They'd say, could they speak.
"What a sickening reek!"
Yes, the culverhouse needs a good cleaning.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pierre Alamire: a guy
Who gave sundry professions a try.
He was copyist, singer,
And document bringer,
Engineer, merchant, diplomat, spy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My vet said it's painful to tell,
But my horses are not doing well;
And my mare, he believes,
Broken-winded, has heaves.
Hey, what is that malodorous smell?

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Come closer, chérie, chimed Carl Clautsch,
Choose cat's cradle (called Charlie's cool couch)!
Chew caramel crakes,
Char conker crap cakes,
Cease crying cantankerously — crouch!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
The dread dogs of war are set free!
That means havoc's unleashed, all agree.
There'll be pain; the young dying,
Their mourning kin crying;
Oh, what death and destruction we'll see!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
I've been altered—it's worse than I feared!
My new finger wave's seriously weird.
Will I pass as a rapper
With hair like a flapper?
Well, perhaps it goes well with my beard.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Say it "FIRST-string" or say it "first-STRING,"
They're the tops, and each player's a king.
If the first string they're in,
Most games they begin,
And they're known from New York to Beijing.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
About 38 weeks from creation
Of life until birth is gestation;
And some people like you
Can live all their lives through
And yet never achieve separation.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A dirt bike is what you'll be craving
If your spirit is jaded by paving.
As the motor goes VROOM!
You'll be shouting, "Make room!
See me now, Mom, I'm really close-shaving!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When leukemia's deep in the bone
As a chronic disease, it's been shown
That busulfan prevents
Many growths—your defense
Till your marrow can go it alone.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A cold-cathode device, as we know,
Gets unbonded electrons to flow.
A small voltage potential
Is all that's essential
To make your oscilloscope glow.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
He stands in his gloomy patch now,
With thistles, his only known chow.
Poor old Eeyore's depressed,
He's unhappy, distressed,
As he cheerlessly beats his own brow.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
A half measures guy? That he is not.
All or nothing's the label he's got.
His response to threats stuns.
He reacts, goes great guns,
Pulls out all of the stops like a shot!

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The prospect of ending up dead
Is something a lot of us dread.
But why all the fear?
You're clearly still here,
And possibly years lie ahead.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Dr. Norman Bethune's expertise
Was deployed against wounds and disease.
All those burdens he bore
In a far distant war:
He's an icon to many Chinese.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
This delicious cake makes a great team
With strong coffee that's topped with fresh cream—
Just single, not double,
But real ('cos the trouble
Is fake stuff will ruin the dream).

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
After Bamberg in Northern Bavaria,
Or Franken, as we call that area,
See Würzburg's fine sights.
For cuisine that delights,
Take my tour (so I'll get honoraria)!

limerick_list.author: pkwooster
limerick_list.text:
That diatribe aimed at the king
Is a very regrettable thing.
The orator wails,
And his speaking assails
The privileges monarchies bring.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The Blue Riband event can be gruelling
And forbids transatlantic refuelling.
Higher average speed
(Not the time), now agreed,
Is the target of nautical duelling.

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
I'm amused by a transient notion
About  chickens that show such devotion
They crowd one another
And follow their mother:
It's lyrical —  poultry in motion!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Dilly Phelps has a candlewick spread,
From which shapes have been cut, on her bed,
Oh, but wait, I can guess,
By the look of her dress,
She's a seamstress who's weak in the head.

limerick_list.author: TheBlackBandit
limerick_list.text:
Aconitic's a word that refers
To a poisonous plant that occurs
In our mountainous places,
And only small traces
Will work pretty well in liqueurs.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Let me teach you advanced DTP —
Desktop publishing — on your PC.
Pimp that church magazine...
What? Don't Tipp-Ex the screen!!!
Shall we start at the basics, Aunt Bea?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A performer on stage may earn hordes
Of admirers, Tony Awards,
And great fame if he's hot.
Then again, if he's not,
It's still sweet to live life on the boards.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
The dustman, 'e founded a brewery.
'E thought 'e would try something newer:  'E
Fermented 'is beer
In the can, but we fear
The result is deplorably sewery.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
"Well hello! Who said dreams don't come true?!
And that dress! Bet you've modelled a few.
Here's my Jag, climb aboard,
Without you it's a Ford."
Clunk and click! (That's what chat-up lines do.)

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Why was Little Boy Blue found supine?
He was indolent, lacked rise-and-shine.
"Idle, faineant kid,
Blow your horn as you're bid!"
"Nah, I'm resting. I'll have to decline."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I penned a diglottic romance
In German and French. By some chance,
It was praised in Berlin;
But in France, I can't win:
Their critics won't give it a glance.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Astrometers measure each star
And catalog where they all are.
These reticle-sighters
May follow all-nighters
By raising a glass at the bar.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Sandwort rootlets clutch sand in their ravel.
Turnstones hunt for their lunch under gravel.
Arenaria places
Them all in sand spaces.
Stay put, herbs! The shorebirds must travel.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
In the French class, he took his last test.
To be first in the class was his quest.
But an accent mark placed
On the wrong word disgraced
The poor boy.  He came out second best.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Though a greatly distinguished professor,
Rob wasn't that much of a guesser,
So he dithered and blanched
When the woodland path branched —
Then he took the one travelled the lesser.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
We must act, there is no time to lose.
House will win. Senate's thin. They'll refuse.
His weak skills ain't worth tuppence.
Will he get his comeuppance?
Let's impeach! Vote him out! Dems must choose.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lady from Dallas
Who referred to her glass as a chalice.
Said her father, "Look here—
That's a tumbler, my dear,
Not a goblet." She shrieked, "You're so callous!"

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
It's like handball (a fast indoor game),
Where the venue (a court) is the same.
Served an ace, watched in awe
When it stuck in her bra.
That's how racketball first got its name.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Isn't chrematophobia funny?
You might wish this complaint on your honey,
And rejoice if your dearest
Recoiled from the merest
Suggestion of spending your money.

limerick_list.author: Amergin
limerick_list.text:
Robert Ballard explores undersea.
There he tracked the Titanic's debris
To the site of the wreck,
Where, now, looters he'd check
By decree — if the world could agree.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Your philosophy's pallid and weak,
Self-impressed and obsessed with technique—
No conviction, no muscle,
It's so… Bertrand Russell.
Its etiolated voice is a squeak.

limerick_list.author: rusty
johng
limerick_list.text:
This omnibus type has  two floors,
And quite often has two or more doors.
It is known as a double-
(Two) decker—no trouble.
 It's handy for going on tours.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I have dozens and dozens of plants
From my dozens of uncles and aunts,
And it's true I have dozens
And dozens of cousins
With dozens of rips in their pants.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas and MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Solar times have a difference between
The apparent (the true) and the mean.
It is called the equation
Of time.  On occasion,
Agreement of both of them's seen.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Seen with Ed, a gamine, just fourteen?
That's 'n image, I 'magine, obscene.
Is my mea(n)ing unclear?
Soldier, join in game here!
What's that thing Elgar wrote, GI, mean?

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Whenever acerbic in tone,
You'll find yourself left all alone;
When verbally sneering,
You're hardly endearing
(You'll never be called on the phone).

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They're adjusting; I'll not be judgmental.
Still, the Times has gone all continental:
Daily feuilleton pages?
Our press dies in stages.
Light fiction—the death should be gentle.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
At dead ends, with no choice but to stop,
Facing bollards, a wall, or a drop,
Wild boy racers will find,
When the law's close behind,
That it's no place to outrun a cop.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An eating utensil, you dork,
Is a spoon or a knife or a fork
That you use to eat cake
Or some chicken-fried steak—
Or it's chopsticks for fried rice with pork.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
When Ellen was going with Anne,
The tabloids said, "Stick with a man!"
Degenerously, they
Had base words for the gay
Living style in the stories they ran.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
A nicely turned ankle — a pose
In a pretty, trimmed hat — it was those
That would turn a man on
In those days now long gone:
As they say, "autres temps, autres choses."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Move the cattle gate, let them proceed.
Once they've dunged, they're not likely to feed
Where they've dropped their manure;
They've no need to endure
Such conditions. Fresh pastures they need.

limerick_list.author: nevadaace and Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
He'll cursorily glance in her bag
And hope it holds big-ticket swag.
She's not really his type
For there's nothing to swipe,
Just used tissues, old mints, and a rag!

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
In a Brooklynite's heart there's a void
Ever since Ebbets Field was destroyed.
Though it's just us old codgers
Who remember our Dodgers,
To tear down a temple's absoid.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
From the woman I love I get flak
And am constantly under attack,
'Cause I don't like to dance,
Though I'd jump at the chance
If my wife had a breast on her back.

limerick_list.author: equinox
limerick_list.text:
"In bitwise arithmetic, why's a
Right shift sometimes used as divisor?"
"I thought it was clear. No?
Right-shift one-one-zero.
You've halved it. Now you're a bit wiser."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
As he fills up with food at a deli-land,
He daydreams he's starring in telly-land,
So I have to explain,
"When you're flying your plane,
Stay alert or you may have to belly-land."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If I want to continue to thrive
As I'm nearing age seventy-five,
I must give up red meats,
Sugar, salt, and all treats;
Just on breadstuff I'll have to survive.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In a bar, a bear comes through the door,
Orders gin, is charged $12.94.
The barkeeper stares,
Says, "We seldom see bears."
"At this price, you won't see many more!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
There's no deity — God is a ghost!
The material world is the most!
Drink a beer, eat some meat,
Fool around — life's a treat!
Laid-back earthly-minded fellows, a toast!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
He's a broomtail, all fire and esprit—
Wild and worthless—you'd best set him free.
All these mustangs, these ponies,
Should run with their cronies.
They belong to the land, can't you see?

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
My Toro mows short down below,
Sickles guiding the grass; watch it go:
As the lawn gets a new cut
From the bed-knife, a crewcut,
I try not to feed it my toe.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Aged millionaire Agatha Crumm
Was a charming eccentric to some.
"As a corporate head,
She's a stitch," readers said,
Although I found her somewhat ho-hum.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This journal won't deal in brutalities,
Morality, crime or legalities.
A huge national debt?
We prefer to forget,
So we'll chronicle life's trivialities.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
First dalf me a hole in the shade;
Then dalf all around with your spade.
Now dalf into this:
Please dalf our last kiss
With me; delve into things you evade.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
We have pipes running under our street, in
A system efficient and neat. In
All roads that you roam,
Every hovel and home
Is hooked up to this fine district heatin'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A salsa musician named Mario
Became a renowned impresario.
He is famous worldwide
Where Latinos reside,
So they call him the "King of the Barrio."

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
Galactose is simple and sweet.
It's a cinch to absorb from that beet.
But it's found in your milk
(Or your cheese; that whole ilk)
Bound in lactose, which some cannot eat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She's so sexy, exceedingly hot,
And I lust for this woman a lot,
But the one time I said,
"Is there room in your bed
For yours truly?" she smiled: "Afraid not."

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
From his birth, hairy Samson eschewed
Barber's razors and drinks that were brewed.
While acersecomic,
His strength stayed technomic:
Ass jawbone his weapon most shrewd.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Bracket fungus: a shelf-like formation
That's found in a deep woods location
More often than not,
Though its name sounds a lot
Like some crap that attacks punctuation.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
For a place that impressed Jacques Cousteau,
Visit Cocos and take in the show.
It's a park not just rife
With a medley of life.
It's pristine, a dynamic tableau.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
You should stick to this face-saving rule
If you wish, in the spring, to look cool:
Don't believe in spaghetti
That falls like confetti
From trees in the Alps, April fool!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Consider the shape of a craft
Designed from the front to the aft
To float or to fly
Up above in the sky:
It's the airframe's original draft.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Billy Bunter, just one of a kind,
As a glutton at school, was maligned.
Since his parents weren't sending
Provisions unending
He pinched his pals' tuck — robbed 'em blind.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Oh, what can I ever compare
With auburn, so naturally rare?
It is brown with red highlights —
According to my lights,
The loveliest color for hair.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I'll be an asylum arranger
And offer you shelter from danger
Or hardship.  I'm here,
So just call on me, dear,
If you need me; please don't be a stranger.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
"An apricot, cherry, or peach
Is a plum," our teacher would teach.
It comes in quite handy
As apricot brandy
At a party, perhaps on the beach.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
God's a fiction, we're not His creation.
There's no Hell, folks, so fear not damnation.
To relieve faith fatigue
Join our Atheist League—
We're a non-prophet organisation.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My uncle's a hundred and one,
So of course we all ask how it's done.
"It's clean living," he claims
"No wild parties, no dames,
No excitement, no drinking, no fun."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
"I'll be rich," Van Dyke cried to the frogs,
"There's treasure" (beep-beep) "in these bogs!"
Croaked one, "Your detector
Would beep in each sector.
It's sensing the nails in your clogs."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Got no worries; my life is a breeze!
It's a gas — I can do what I please!
All the pleasures of being
Are so frickin' freeing!
I'm counting on God's guarantees.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Ow, that sure wasn't fun, being dumped,
Landing hard on my rump, getting bumped
Like a wasted old hunk
Of some thrown-away junk!
Now I'm bummed, feeling sad, grandly grumped.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A fellow with home-buyer's lust
Told his neighborhood banker, "I must
Get a place of my own.
What I need is a loan."
What he got was a nice deed of trust.

limerick_list.author: Virge and Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A throbbing of pain in your head
Recalls your consumption of red.
While you're still seeing double,
Your brats, all abubble,
Squeal, "Come on, dad! Get out of bed!"

limerick_list.author: arnie
limerick_list.text:
The stupid blonde bimbos of Gor
Love treatment that they should abhor.
They're all silly girls
Dressed only in pearls;
Too bad that it's all such a bore.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'd been beaten. My mouth had been taped.
It was clear I was gonna be raped.
I grabbed hold of his coat,
Kneed his balls to his throat,
And then broke from his grip and escaped.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
That store owner sure deserves jail.
He keeps saying his business will fail
So his stock has to go,
And he'll sell it cheap, though
It's a seven-year-long cut-rate sale.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the '60s, Don Adams had fun.
He was 86, carried a gun,
Had a phone in his shoe;
Yet today it is true:
Wouldja believe it?  He's just 81!

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Approvable though you may be,
To win approbation from me
Takes passion! Desire!
A heart filled with fire!
(It helps if you're down on one knee.)

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
George I called himself 'the August'.
Said the wits of his reign, 'Then it must
Be Augustan, our age,'
Which some mocked on the stage,
And the page, with satirical thrust.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A bisulfide, a compound, possesses
Two sulfurs, a chemist assesses.
CS2's used to shape
Things like cellophane tape
And the rayon that softens your dresses.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Young Skywalker's caught in a pother
Of feelings that fluster and bother.
He's stunned for a while
(Anagnorisis-style)
When Darth Vader says, "Luke, I'm your father."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I inherited land from maman;
The amount was a hundred arpents.
There weren't any takers
For eighty-five acres
Down-breeze from a cheese fabricant.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Deportment's behavior, demeanor,"
Said my manners instructor, Ms. Weiner.
"When you mix with society,
Perform with propriety—
Wearing clothes that are fresh from the cleaner."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
My brother just dropped me a note
And this is the message he wrote:
"I won't 'phone you this week
As I find I can't speak.
I have epiglottitis (sore throat)."

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
"Cricket players play cricket," said Paul.
"There are bowlers who bowl a small ball
To bring down the wicket
(Important in cricket),
Which a batsman protects like a wall."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Stuff that nobody wanted to buy
Fills the window and catches my eye.
Could I use a cheap lamp
With a crocodile clamp
From this clearance sale? No — but I'll try!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said my surgeon, "Here's what you'll expect o' me:
I'll  perform a good diaphysectomy.
Abscessed bone I'll remove
So your health can improve."
"Yes," I added, "I hope that's correct o' me."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
You'll be perfect in France — what d'you fear?
You have style and your French is quite clear.
Don't fly up in the boughs, Mum;
You'll fit to a cow's thumb
(A nicety). Just learn to sneer.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
Jot down words, quite a few, in a group.
Stir them up as you might in a soup.
In response to your urges
A limerick emerges
From out of a word-feedback loop.

limerick_list.author: Brian Cairns
limerick_list.text:
I am antipathetic to sea:
Its heaving and swell have to be
Disincentives to cross while
That ocean is hostile
And antipathetic to me.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
In jewelry design certain floral
Motifs use the colorful coral:
The red or pink bones
Of sea creatures (not stones);
But destroying their reefs is immoral.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
"Unto others, you always should do
Just as you'd have them do unto you,"
So the Set Theorist cried,
"Let this rule be your guide:
Asymmetric relations eschew!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Double dummy is bridge where you see
All the cards of two dummies. Marie
And I played and she beat me.
Not content to defeat me,
She sneered, "Counting you, there are three!"

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
As for ice cream, get Breyers alone,
Not the store's brand. I won't eat their clone.
If the label reads Kroger,
You'll bring out the ogre!
Generics I will not condone.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
So obscene, this new  cap on our wages.
(No more raises?) That truly enrages
The worker who's just
Trying not to go bust.
Don't be stunned if a walkout he stages.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"At conception? It's then life begins?"
Asked the maiden who's carrying twins.
"My conception is this—
That life starts with a kiss,
Then it spins, full of gin, to its sins."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"I shall no longer destinate, choose,
A life foul, filled with floozies and booze!
I'll accept wine and bread
From Lord Jesus instead —
His Good News!"  Said my wife, "That's good news."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle and Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
My inquisitive golden retriever
Killed a beaver and now has a fever.
So I'm giving the bitch
Acetanilid, which
Is a fevered retriever reliever.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"First I whittled a large number '10'
For the doretree, and stained it, and then
I attached it with screws."
(The word doorpost, I'd use.
Grandad's speaking archaic again.)

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
At first meeting, she'll often put on
A façade, her warm nature withdrawn.
She seems brittle and cool—
But have patience, and you'll
See she's sweet as a sparrow at dawn.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Creep feed does not sustain creeps.
A creep's an enclosure that keeps
Farmyard creatures inside,
Where good farmers provide
Them with feed, not on plates, but in heaps.

limerick_list.author: proof and Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
A rocket or spacecraft, I've heard,
Like a plane, can be labeled a bird.
And I guess UFOs
Could as well, although those
I must say are completely absurd.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
His candle's gone out and it's cold
At the coalface, by seams of "black gold".
The dark makes him fearful;
All day he's been tearful.
First shift—and just seven years old.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It's a genus of herbs that delights—
Showy flowers in purples and whites.
But Abronia, too,
Is a lizard that you
Can espy in arboreal heights.

limerick_list.author: Mark Mironer
limerick_list.text:
The Marine was a private named Kemper.
He complained, "What is with this word, Semper!?"
The sergeant said, "Otto,
Lay off of our motto,
Attempt to attemper your temper."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
In the midst of a nightmarish dream,
I awoke to a blood-chilling scream:
I heard my heart pump
As the voice made me jump
But the scream was my own, it would seem.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
I'm a biker, I'm fast and I'm tough;
A commuter, through traffic that's rough.
As I weave in and out,
Hear my "ding-ding" and shout —
"Coming through!" as I pedal and puff.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In a tantrum, young Thomas was steaming:
"Though my Little League coach says I'm dreaming,
I will hit, don't you fear,
Sixty homers a year!"
Tom said babishly, kicking and screaming.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
All my sisters and cousins and aunts
Wear out oodles of dresses and pants.
"New duds? Dime a dozen —
We're helped," says a cousin,
"By welfare and government grants."

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
'Round a transformer's core you will find
That both input and output wires wind.
Now an autotransformer
Is not like the former
For some of those wires are combined.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I'm an intern assigned to Crook-U,
Not the work that I'd most want to do.
I treat all kinds of scuzz
In the prison ward 'cause
Even murdering thugs get the flu.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
I'm an infidel, giaour to them:
An outsider they'd love to condemn.
ISIS hate I'll endure,
For my future's secure:
As a Christian, to Christ I'm a gem.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
Pity Holland. Each monochrome view,
Every windmill and tree — all so blue.
No, I've never been there
But my delft shows me where
My chromatic assumptions are true.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I don't want to go out with a drunk,
Or a guy who will act like a punk.
You suggest that I date
An Antonian?  Great!
The guy's an Armenian monk.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
There are those who go fishing by night
For mere perch, with a flare for a light.
When you fish for the barse
You just sit on your arse
And you wait for the bastard to bite.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
He is partially deaf, it appears,
And too lame to chase rabbits he hears.
Sense of sight?  Sense of smell?
They're not working too well.
Rocky's getting along now in years.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
Let's color-coordinate Shrek:
String some emerald jewels 'round his neck;
He should hold a green clutch.
For the finishing touch,
Make him nauseous until he goes "Eck!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Bar room darts is a game folks adore,
And most players know how to keep score.
But how high should the hub
Of the bull's-eye be, Bub?
It's just sixty-eight inches. No more.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
What's this crap on my sandwich I sniff?
Some cheap substitute spread? Take a whiff!
You have ruined my lunch!
There's no peanutty crunch—
Don't you know? Choosey choosers choose Jif!

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
These capacitors, they should behave
More like tiny, quick batteries, Dave.
We can't separate plates
With just foil. All our mates
Say: electrolytes, that's what plates crave.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
It's a lengthy expression, my dear:
Get your laughing gear 'round this drink here!
Now, this gear is your mouth
(Rhyming slang: "north and south")—
So why don't I just say, "Drink this beer"?

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
A bland-tasting hot dog, I feel,
Needs the hot stuff to make it taste "real."
Calefacient implies
A nice temperature rise;
Add some horseradish — now it's ideal!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When I'm writing a paper at home,
Through my history tomes I must comb,
As I jot down the nomen
Of each noble Roman
Whose consulship graced ancient Rome.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
He was trained to be fearless, though dread
Floods his body at what lies ahead;
He will need to be brave,
But he fears, as a slave
Chained to oars, very soon he'll be dead.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Here's a word that has gone very dead:
It's enubilate — now that it's said,
It is freed from the heap
Of old words put to sleep,
If, dear reader, you help it to spread.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You really should have no objections;
My airplane has passed all inspections.
See my new double-prop?
Its propellers, non-stop,
Spin in opposite (right, left) directions.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
The minute she walked in the door,
She was trapped by a talkative bore.
Though he thought he was deep,
She was soon deep asleep.
They should bottle this guy. What a snore!

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
The appendix: its purpose?  Unknown,
But removal I'd rather postpone.
Though without it you're fine,
While I can, I'll keep mine
For its uselessness hasn't been shown.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Moaned Catherine the Great, "Oh, ye gods!
Just look how this horse of mine plods!
He finished the Ascot race
Quite like a basket case—
This despite five-to-one odds!"

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The small room just inside the front door
Of this house was where Jack I first saw.
'You're Geoff Johnson?' he said.
I then nodded my head
In that foyer. 'I'm Johnson. And you're?'

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
Quipped the yodeling teacher, "I'm new,
And dislike it when things are askew.
So if ever I'm late,
Would you please line up straight
In an orderly, orderly, orderly, orderly queue?"

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
"Let's have merriment now, I decree,"
Orders Prospero. "Then — to the sea!"
So we'll greet his demands
With the clap of our hands —
With applause, we can now set him free.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
They butt heads every time they convene—
Their arguments cause quite a scene.
No one knows why they fight;
Neither one of them's right:
They're both buttheads—a bit dull and mean.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a technical wizard from Ipswich:
"Your computer contains a cool dip switch,
One of several switches
In a useful set which is
So hip that it seems a blue-chip switch."

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
My bench lathe, among other things,
Is old, so it rattles and sings.
But its turning's still fine.
Both of oak and of pine
I can make very nice little rings.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
I got wind of your secret: You deal
With cocaine; you're a pusher, you heel.
How I know this? Some guys
From your gang just got wise,
Called the cops and decided to squeal.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Though my love of French wine is well-known,
I would rather not drink it alone.
Come with me, my young feller,
To my Burgundy cellar;
Get your mouth round some fine vintage Beaune.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A dancing bear's "moves" you present,
Side to side with your back slightly bent,
And you shout, "It's a bear!"
Do the grizzly bear there
At your very next social event.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
I'm on Boardwalk and ready to throw
But old Vlad, my opponent's, so slow.
It's such a short dash
To collect needed cash,
But I'm sitting, awaiting Go dough.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Her bosom (the glands on her chest)
Is the part that the boys like the best.
Like two melons, a pair—
But the trouble is they're
Both completely attached to the rest.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The wound on your forearm revealed
That your doc put in stitches and sealed
The immense gaping cleft
His excision had left.
When it's cicatrized—then 'twill be healed.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
The IKEA instructions were quite
Clear to me: 'Turn the screws till they're tight.'
Anti-clockwise I turned,
But no joy. Then I learned
That's it's dextrorotation that's right.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
University boffins decree
That a doctorate's a lofty degree;
Many credits are earned,
But true wisdom is learned
In real life; it's one long Ph.D.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Need a hand or some aid for your cause?
Try assistants who work without pause.
Every day 'til Noel,
Santa's helpers excel.
Let us praise the subordinate Claus!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"I prepared my report confidentially,
Expounding each facet essentially,
Then I rapidly rose
In repute. Heaven knows
Talent shows!" declared Tom exponentially.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Debbie dillied and dallied quite dottily,
For her goal she recalled only spottily.
It was tea at the Ritz.
Her husband had fits:
She had spotted her copybook blottily.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The dance of a honeybee shows
To her sisters some info she knows:
"Here's the nectar I've found—
Watch me waggle around,"
Since a bee cannot shout, "Thar she blows!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In Biblical studies I'd dabble,
And that's where I learned about Cabul.
It was part of a gift
That left Hiram quite miffed.
Does the Bible, at times, read like babble?

limerick_list.author: Pete G.
limerick_list.text:
In Europe's dark past, the Black Plague
Killed millions from Cork to The Hague.
White-faced, swollen-gummed,
The victims succumbed,
Though some of them just became vague.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
These neurons protect us quite well.
They're the ones that sense taste and sense smell:
Our superb chemosensory
Nerves. (Reprehensory
Rants follow smells that repel.)

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
We had sailed out too far from the bay;
Murky weather increased our dismay.
There was palpable fear
As the fog horn drew near:
An adumbrative shape pierced the grey.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
This latticework's texture's a trial,
Since it's weathered from setting a while,
And the surface is rough.
Filing won't be enough.
Guess I'll claim it's a "primitive" style.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our club's newsletter's hardly first class.
We have few volunteers so, alas,
I both write it and edit,
Receiving no credit.
(Have you read it?)  I double in brass.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Francisco V. de Coronado:
Colonial adelantado.
Seven cities of gold
Made his fortune go cold.
As for Cíbola? Think "El Dorado".

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
It's element number three-three,
The metalloid arsenic. You'll see
If it's paired with old lace,
Men fall flat on their face,
Not to mention Madame Bovary.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
For my birthday I often beseech
You to spirit me off to a beach.
By your gift I'm bemused:
A chlorometer (used),
To determine the power of bleach.

limerick_list.author: John Ramos
limerick_list.text:
Said the man to a bear of great girth,
"I describe the fine creatures of Earth.
It's my job: I'm a faunist,
A naturalist—honest!
So, please, let me watch you give birth."

limerick_list.author: Michael Daws
limerick_list.text:
In the Haight you will find a café
Where Juha found work for a day.
Although he was Finnish,
He'd used Cuban spinach,
While the hippies were hitting the hay.

limerick_list.author: zqms and Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
My new bra has no breath-taking wire;
Still it's sure to ignite Mike's desire.
It's fire-retardant,
This garment. His ardent,
Full lust, not my bust, will catch fire.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A sneering young fellow called Snead
Was deprecatory indeed:
He was heard to disparage
The value of marriage.
Said his wife, "And for once we're agreed."

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
An opera singer named Queenie
Put on Turandot, sung in Chimwini;
"I do what I can to
Enlighten the Bantu,"
Said she, "And they quite like Puccini."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We'll staff this command post with workers:
This CP won't take kindly to lurkers.
Our job's to assess,
And unravel this mess.
Send us thinkers, go-getters, not shirkers.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I once cherished American Cheese;
I so wanted to put her at ease.
When she heard I'm Velveeta,
She called me excreta
And treated me like a disease.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Gearhart
limerick_list.text:
Oh, would that I could take nukes back
To a time before Hitler's attack.
I'd use a first strike
To destroy the Third Reich
Before Adolf could get it on track.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
1980: the Cold War still raged.
The U.S. and the S.U. engaged
In a face-off historic.
U.S. fans felt euphoric,
But the bronze-medal Swedes found it staged.

limerick_list.author: Jonathan Caws-Elwitt
limerick_list.text:
A cinema not-so-resplendent
Presents us with films independent.
It's a 100-seater,
This little art theater,
With only one ticket attendant.

limerick_list.author: man from tashkent
limerick_list.text:
"Drinks are additive," Megan explained.
"This imbibing cannot be sustained.
   The more you drink booze,
   The more life you'll lose."
And then calmly, all glasses were drained.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Sometimes English, to me, is bizarre,"
Said Rudolfo, a famed limbo star.
"When I limbo, it's clear
That the goals I set here
Aren't made harder by raising the bar."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Since atrament simply means "ink",
Could I use it for ink that is pink?
It's from Latin for "black".
Such enigmas will wrack
My poor brain, till it's painful to think.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Unaware he looked pretty bizarre
In a ginger wig, loaned by his Ma,
He moved close. "Come to bed
For a cuddle," he said,
As he dropped his glass eye in a jar.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"There's a bumblebee spy," said the flea,
"Watching bugs by the Caspian Sea.
He's so secretive (very!)
And cautiously wary,
He goes by the name 'Cagey Bee'!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
Have you heard the school's new concert band?
The percussion's especially grand.
The brass section's neat,
And the woodwinds are sweet.
It's the grandest school band in the land!

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
Some women are blessed with a sightly
Derriere; some men notice them, rightly.
Should one happen to pass,
You should not yell, "Nice ass!"
"Callipygian!" says it politely.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
You'll find commutativity rules
In most maths, as it's taught in our schools.
a+b doesn't change,
When its terms we arrange:
b+a (using algebra's tools).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
On behalf of the chairman and staff,
I regret all the gaffes of this daff.
His obtuseness excuses
His blowing the fuses—
Just daffing, to make people laugh.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
To accurse, let a series of zingers
Bid your object ill-wishing that lingers.
It's the voice of the bird
Which, though mute, can be heard
When set flying with raised middle fingers.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
With a forty-point margin projected,
The bottom dog wasn't selected
By one single person.
Now bettors are cursin'—
The upset was quite unexpected!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Some crooks rigged a race at the meet,
And their payoff was sure to be sweet.
But each jockey held fire
Till they all reached the wire.
"It's a tie," the judge said. "A dead heat!"

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
King Harold went out to espy
How the enemy arrows would fly.
"We've got nothing to fear,
They can't reach us back here."
And at that he got shot in the eye!

limerick_list.author: Meg Beagle
limerick_list.text:
I wanted this rhyme to appear
Very clever and full of good cheer —
But it's rainy today,
The skies are quite grey,
And the world and my verse look quite drear.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Our center, a lummox named Kline,
Has been yanked (he's now riding the pine.)
He can block shots, rebound,
But his shooting's not sound,
And he chokes  at the charity line.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
"Will we marry soon?" quacked mallard Cyrus,
But of patience Lorraine was desirous.
"We'll feather our mud nest
Right after a blood test
To make sure you don't carry that virus."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There's costusroot oil in sachets,
In perfumes, in colognes, and in sprays.
The fragrances here,
From an herb in Kashmir,
Garner praise for their lovely bouquets.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
The minuteman said, "Here's the story:
A British commander's our quarry.
Take chicken, combine
With tomatoes and wine,
And invite him to dine. Cacciatore."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Team Electrics lost always, and hence
To expect them to win made no sense.
Then by default they won;
And though shocked, I for fun
Plugged that team in June's Current Events.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Fair and famous (her daddy owns banks),
Nikki joins the celebutante ranks:
At the debutante ball,
She's the fairest of all.
This year's rivals? Designer-gowned tanks.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
For hot chocolate, evaporated milk
I use for a brew smooth as silk.
Not too bitter or sweet,
"It's my favorite treat,"
Says my grandson, "the best of its ilk."

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster and SusanL
limerick_list.text:
I'm affianced to Bess, so I still
Have to swallow the bitterest pill.
When she asked me to wed,
I was sure she said "bed",
So "I'd love to!" is now just "I will."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My mom is a frequent contestant,
Writing slogans and jingles, her best ent-
ry: (first prize it got,
Product-naming) Snot-Not,
For a nasal (you guessed) decongestant.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
She seemed delicate, graceful and pure,
And her language controlled and demure,
But she flipped, blew her cork
(Shocked a club in New York) —
Introduce her to Mom? I'm not sure.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
An elite, discreet Brahmin (Bostonian)
Married well, to a titled Etonian.
Then he lost all their wealth
And she suffered bad health.
So the change to their lifestyle? Draconian.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A case knife is one that is made
To be placed in a sheath—with a blade
That is fixed. Or it could
Be a kitchen knife—good
For the carving of beef carbonnade.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
As elected execs sometimes will,
At the party Bill buttonholed Phil.
"How dare you accost me?"
Snarled Phil. "Now you've lost me —
Let go! A 'hey, Phil!' fills the bill."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though the figure is heavily robed,
And its gender's not easily probed,
I declare it's a female.
No way can it be male!
Its chest is distinctly bilobed.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"The faithful departed? They're dead
Fellow worshippers," Parson Bray said,
"But remembered indeed
In our prayers, though we need
Their demise like a hole in the head."

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
It may take just a while till you get
Up to speed, so I'll wait and won't fret.
Though at first all may hiss,
Avantgarde works like this:
When we're dead, our work lives, you can bet.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Cow cod soup isn't fish, nor yet cow.
It is bovine, but studly — and how.
See, a johnson or rod
In Jamaica's a cod.
That's chopped choad that you're chowing down now.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
No explanative words bring relief
From our heartbreak, our sadness and grief.
Please justify why,
Lord, our child had to die;
Why you stole her brief life like a thief.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Since we live on the bank, no surprise,
Our house, when the nearby streams rise,
Bears the brunt of the flood
(Fills with water and mud),
But we always clean up once it dries.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You think limericks are nothing but smut?
Let me tell you, they're anything but!
Maybe elsewhere, but here
The OEDILF makes it clear
Smutty verses do not make the cut.

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
Out fishing one day in the moat,
I landed a fish in my boat,
But my vision went tunnel—
It slipped down the gunnel!
That butterfish sure got my goat!

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Many nations will use their great seal
To mark documents, sealing a deal
That's important — hence "great".
But not one single state
Has a walrus, though that great seal's real.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The gems were engraved (diaglyphic)
In patterns, and each was specific.
There were gardens with bowers,
And beautiful flowers,
And castles with towers—terrific!

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
In Atlantic cuisine there's a fish
Called a croaker, a delicate dish.
A hardheaded grumbler,
This small piscine rumbler
Is caught by the ton.  It's de-lish.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
Stick a Cl inside an O2.
It will bleach and kill odors, a clue
That it disinfects well,
And is toxic like hell—
That is chlorine dioxide for you.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
If a number declares what is what,
Then the opposite says what is not.
1's complement runs
Ones to noughts, noughts to ones.
Clean becomes full of dirt; cold goes hot.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Here's a job that was slightly obscure
For some long-ago entrepreneur:
Antigropelos makers
Were movers and shakers
In waterproof leggings, for sure.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The betel palm, growing in Asia,
Has nuts that will surely amaze ya.
Chew their kernels with lime
And you'll have a good time,
Though the stains on your dentures may faze ya.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
For large animals, vets use etorphine
To put them to sleep. Diprenorphine
Is needed to wake them,
So handlers can take them
To stalls, and then give them their morphine.

limerick_list.author: jexia
limerick_list.text:
The detective drove fast in the car chase.
He smoked out the infamous Scarface
By grilling the sinner
In Who Burned the Dinner?—
A difficult mystery char case.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
I think I might write of abulia,
Where strong indecision can rulia,
But quickly I find
I've again changed my mind—
That's the way that abulia can foolia.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My luck at the track is the worst.
Every horse that I bet on is cursed.
I backed nine out of ten
In the Derby, and then
Some old three-legged nag came in first!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The field geoscience is where
Dan and Dotty began their affair.
With each other? Oh, no.
Out to diggings they go.
It's a love of the Earth that they share.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the movies he's aching to star,
Though his acting is not up to par,
So he constantly hustles
To build up his muscles;
He's made it to beefcake so far.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Though my married friend's sexual plight
Was revealed, still I sensed his delight.
"I get sex once a year,
Raise an annual cheer."
Then he grinned, "And tonight is the night."

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
"Let no one say later, 'You blew it,'"
Said Abishai, "Look—nothing to it.
No need to strike twice,
Saul is dead with one slice."
Noble David said, "No, let God do it."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"There's a frog in each vase with our roses,"
The arrangement's enclosure discloses.
The spiked block is support
For all stems, long or short,
So no cause, then, to look down your noses.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The east Irish town known as Drogheda
Is close to that country's north bogheda
It's right on the Boyne
And its six bridges joyne
Both banks, keeping traffic in ogheda.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
An adventure: exciting or scary?
It depends—are you thrilled or just wary?
It implies something new,
A somebody, just who?
Have a fling, take the plunge—don't be chary.

limerick_list.author: Bob Colonna
limerick_list.text:
I knew a young lady named Mary
Whose consonants often would vary.
Her v's were like b's.
Then she got a disease.
I inquired, "Are you sick?" "Beri-beri."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though it won't tell the temp or humidity,
Acidimetrically checking acidity
Of the rain that collects
Helps us judge the effects
Of pollution, with utmost validity.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
That date stamp is old, I can see,
Since the date stamped reads nineteen-oh-three.
So this book, though brand new,
Seems to be overdue!
How I hope you won't charge me a fee!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An aspartate transaminase test
Is performed at your doctor's request.
If it shows that increased
AST's been released
In your blood, then your organs are stressed.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To identify species,  I say,
"Go the DNA barcoding way."
What a wonderful break-
through! These new techniques make
Morphological methods passé.

limerick_list.author: SusanL and Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
The concludency of the contrived
So-called "data" your partner derived
From a hoax was a crime.
Now you both will do time,
Given none of your patients survived.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
On the night they released me from jail,
I never looked back; I turned tail.
But emancipatory
Ain't quite the whole story —
I'm running again. I jumped bail.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Here's a plug for the cervical cap,
Which is snug when it's filling the gap.
It's a thimble-shaped, nice
Contraceptive device
That's the ultimate sperm-blocking trap.

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
My lawyer's persistent (unstopping);
Today for a forum she's shopping.
To put in the fix,
Find a jury whose mix
Makes for settlements prone to be whopping.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
I've fitted my lamps with a dimmer
That reduces their light to a glimmer,
To protect my weak sight;
The result is, tonight,
That I can't see to finish this limer

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It is no easy task to afford
Years of study and sacrifice toward
Attaining enlightenment,
A mystical heightenment,
But arhatship — that's the reward.

limerick_list.author: Znirk
limerick_list.text:
A suffix, from algos (that's Greek),
For a "pain that affects your physique."
Stomat-, merocox-, plant-,
Kerat-, neur-, enter-, pant-:
With these -algias, your future looks bleak.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
As a bad-indigestion corrective,
Disembowelment's highly effective;
But intestine removals
Need bank loan approvals:
The procedure's considered elective.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
If smoothies get boring, for sure,
Amazonian fruit is the cure!
Mango's so yesterday;
Pomegranate? Passé.
The açaí's the fad juice du jour.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
When museums take in a possession
They politely will speak of "accession"—
That's getting some stuff
When you've more than enough
(If a country's involved, it's "aggression").

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When cheating through crime is their aim,
Some thugs, up in court, make the claim
That the fault lies with others—
Their fathers, their mothers;
That's why they're not really to blame.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The creek should drop quickly and leap
Down the hill through the herbs we will reap.
With too gentle a slope,
We'll surrender all hope
For our pickles: dill waters run steep.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
To coagulate, there's a cascade
Of linked proteins your liver has made.
Genes deficient —  crash, THUD!
There's no clotting of blood,
But with treatment, joint bleeding's allayed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Anti-idiotypic: when they
(Certain ABs) refuse to obey,
And attack other ABs
Like dogs that have rabies;
Immunity then goes astray.

limerick_list.author: Colin Salter
limerick_list.text:
In Imperial Germany's day,
Member states sang the emperor's way
When it suited the whole.
Adlegation's the role
They'd demand in return for their "yay".

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
It's official: a girl has more feeling
Than a guy; should she therefore be reeling
From his strokes in the bed
As they lie head to head?
(For the men would find that most appealing!)

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Übermanagers offered amends
After layoffs dis-membered our friends.
To accept would be cheap:
If it rose from the deep,
My morale would expire from the bends.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Cyanamide (sounds like it's blue)
Is a crystalline acid, but who
Knows it's hueless or white
And that, when it's used right,
It may help those dependent on brew?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dana's cavedaughter deigned to remark,
"Dad, our dim, dingy  cave needs a spark!"
"It's a problem I'll handle—
I'll cook up the candle
So you won't go on cursing the dark."

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The chief master sergeant has stripes
That make casual counters go "Yipes!"
To count up all eight
Is a task that can grate,
But no airman would dare to voice gripes.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
My visage displays not a trace
Of concern as I shelter in place.
Here I sit with pajamas on,
Waiting for Amazon
To deliver new masks for my face.

limerick_list.author: Screenhog
limerick_list.text:
A couple, gourmand and gourmet,
Ordered food from a local café.
The gourmet took a bite—
Further interest was slight.
(The gourmand gobbled both plates away.)

limerick_list.author: Fleur De Lim
limerick_list.text:
Tons of bumblebees congregate here
At my bee balm—you'd best not come near!
It's a plant I endorse
And a rich natural source
Of mint thymol—for breath sweet and clear.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Eddie Eagan pulled off quite a feat
Winning golds when he chose to compete
In both Winter and Summer
Olympics. (Cue drummer.)
No one else has performed quite so neat.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Are the bubbles all gone from your beer?
Honey, sometimes they just don't appear.
Here's a process for you
To assess CO2:
Titrate alkalimetrically, dear.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
For type 2 diabetes they plug
The seducing biguanide type drug
Called metformin. But me?
From such meds I'll stay free:
Lifetime habits I'll change. Call me smug.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
C sharp's the note just above C.
In the scale of A major, it's mi.
On a keyboard, it's black,
And it suffers the lack
Of distinction from flattening D.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Anti-language, a lexicon muddled,
Begins when a fringe group is huddled
Together but needs
To express certain deeds
In a way that leaves others befuddled.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a wealthy young man from Bohemia,
"You'll stay poor if you choose academia.
My success—I've no debts—
With invertebrate pets
Is with sea monkeys, genus Artemia."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Amianthum—this plant may surprise.
It is useful for poisoning flies.
If it's mashed up and spread,
It will render flies dead;
But take care. Keep it out of your eyes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"All the cattle are penned," said my pal,
"In a very convenient locale,
Where I'll teach them harmonious
Moos, not erroneous
Lowing—a bovine chorale."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Will you stop chasing rainbows?  You try
To set goals that are pie in the sky.
Are you just masochistic?
They're unrealistic.
You know that they're not gonna fly.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The CG is a watchdog we laud
Who investigates government fraud.
His mismanagement audits
Draw taxpayers' plaudits.
His powers are properly broad.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Milk is best if it's used by the date
On the carton.  This morning at 8,
I went down for a cup,
But I nearly threw up.
Seems I made me some cafe au late.

limerick_list.author: Paul VerNooy
limerick_list.text:
I got fired from Hallmark. Boss Fred
Hated all of my cards that he read.
I just couldn't do sappy —
Instead, they were snappy,
Like: "Eat your damn cake. Now drop dead."

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
It's the meanest thing on my agenda —
I assemble my list of delenda:
This to blot, this erase,
This destroy, this replace.
Wipe them out, make them pay, no surrenda!

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
I slipped on the stairs in a store;
It left me all bruised and quite sore.
Ecchymoses broke out
(Ruptured vessels, no doubt) —
Black and blue, I could sue (that's the law).

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
His sex reassignment reveals
That while surgery easily deals
With removing his testicles
And adding some chesticles,
It can't help him walk wearing heels.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
I'll admit I'm a poor lexicographer
And I'm nobody's cinematographer;
I'm content with my prints
And their layers of tints.
I'm your neighbourhood chromolithographer.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
They've potential for great differentiation,
But stem cells have stirred trepidation.
Cells from embryos taken
Leave some people shaken.
Panacea or certain damnation?

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
On the tails, firm against foreign knaves,
Whom she sends to their watery graves
('Tis no myth, I declare;
The reverse is true) — there
Is Britannia ruling the waves.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Live on land?  A hotel is just swell.
Drive a car?  Does motel ring a bell?
Both are places to stay.
Have affairs on the bay?
Why not dock at the No-Tell Boatel?

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Just past daybreak, the sun is still low,
And the scene is suffused with a glow.
In the soft golden hour,
Each building and flower
Gains warmth, as my photos will show.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
They decided to blacktop my street,
Fill the potholes and make it look neat;
But they're using bitumen—
The odor's inhuman.
I'd rather have stones neath my feet!

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
Every good radiologist knows
How the axial plane really goes.
It's a slice front to back,
And so only a quack
Says it goes from your head to your toes.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
In the Berkshires I choose to abide,
Not in England's renowned countryside,
  But on New England's tract —
  Massachusetts, in fact.
It's a glorious place to reside.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
So he canned you, so screw him! So—shoot,
We'll take Amtrak: one long, last commute.
And I'll manage your pain
In our room on the train.
I'll make nice to you, Darlin', en route.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When the lord is on circuit, he'll stay
With his vassals—he won't have to pay.
Under corody, quarters
Are free, but our daughters
Are strictly off limits, okay?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the bungalow down by the shore,
There's a cottager living once more.
Though the cottage was bare,
Now a cotter lives there,
And a thistle wreath hangs on the door.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A dirty old sand crab (and smelly)
Had problems with filling her belly —
Lost her chely, or claw,
Said, "Well, that's the last straw!
Now I'll have to get fed at my deli."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Harvard's Child Ballads' influence spoke
Through that burgeoning song style called folk.
This scholar's collection
Changed music's complexion
As themes with tradition awoke.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Said the abbot, "I'm moving the site
Of the abbey to Wigan tonight.
They'll be mourning at dawn
When the abbeystead's gone.
Shabby treatment? You bet. Serves 'em right!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
The old chaplain addressed convict Flynn:
"I am here to absolve you of sin.
Though your crime's really base,
You've five minutes for grace."
"Please forgive me and send her right in."

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
The dish I invented tonight
Gets the random additions just right.
Secret flavorings spike it...
Oh, try it. You'll like it!
I'm calling it "Tuna Delight."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When he's making a garter, John Gaddis
Will use some elastic and caddis.
That's the woolen yarn, but
Not the fly larva. What
A relief to his ladyfriends that is!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Gerry had no I.D.—he was cardless—
Yet he seemed of good cheer, disregardless.
He was nonchalant, heedless,
Said: "Worry is needless!"
We bought drinks, but our group was Gerardless.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In Brasília, I happened to say,
"From the roof, there's an awesome display."
On the edge, several stood.
I was frightened, but good!
Cremnophobia kept me away.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Would you favor the banning of prose?"
Was the question a pollster once chose.
Of five hundred he polled
Five said no, we are told,
Eight were yesses, the rest were don't-knows.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Dear editors: Please, will you stop
Making changes?  You add, tweak and chop.
Is this poem so bendable,
Warped and emendable?
No! It's the cream of the crop.

limerick_list.author: jesserifkin
limerick_list.text:
Though Passover last left us reeling,
Next year's will be much more appealing.
The '21 Seder
Won't reach a new nadir.
Let's just say Haggadah good feeling.

limerick_list.author: Joanna Keene
limerick_list.text:
I borrowed a page from his book
As, determined, by hook or by crook,
To learn from the best
(Yes this was my quest) —
I did just what he does, see? Look!

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
"An abdominal section? I'll cut,"
Said the surgeon, "To open her gut,
Then I'll trim off some fat."
I said, "Thank you for that.
Can you please do the same to her butt?"

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
To Banbury Cross on a cock-horse
Rides baby: a toy wooden-block horse
Goes trotting along
To the tot's ringing song,
With its rider astride her white mock-horse.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I must have unbreakable surety
Of my room's unimpeachable purity.
I will not get diseased
Or infected — you sneezed!!
You just compromised biosecurity!

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
Though your life has been blessed with success,
You'll find Death will still know your address.
It's a fact, to this date,
The extent of this fate
Is one hundred percent (more or less).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"There's a crow on line two." "I'm in awe
Of your speaker on 'Crows and the Law.'
Let your listeners know
We have rights, every crow!
And I thank you for taking my caw."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Al-Buraq was Mohammed's winged steed
And enabled the prophet, with speed,
To fly to the Gate
And there meet his fate
To embrace the great faith he would lead.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The jury's delivered today
A clear verdict: he's guilty, which may,
Despite family tears,
Keep him locked up for years.
It's a heart-wrenching duty, they say.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A bitblt's a way to move bits
As fast as your hardware permits.
And here's what it stands fer:
It's bitmap block transfer.
A computer fits bits in a blitz.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
To get my stiff back back in action,
PT tortured my spine with, ugh, "traction".
When those bones moved a fraction,
Such pain! My reaction?
To curse them: "You sons of [redaction]!"

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The president often complains,
"Other nations are drains on our brains!
If a shrewd foreign neighbor
Lures all our skilled labor,
Some dolt will be all that remains!"

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Axe The Archers right now! Don't prevaricate!
Eddy Grundy's a thief! Hear him arrogate
Dug-up trove he presents
To his wife — scandal! Hence
THIS MEANS WAR! (There's a word for this: clarigate.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The chant from psychology schools?
"Abnormal psychology rules!"
Predict the expansion
Of folks like Charles Manson
And every psychologist drools!

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
Gourmet food served to toddlers who whine?
That's like casting your pearls before swine.
'Cause from lint balls to chips,
It all goes 'tween their lips.
Around nine's when their taste buds refine.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I give you permission. Feel free.
Go ahead. You can do it. You see,
I allow it. That's right:
You are granted this sight
Of a glimpse of all-powerful Me.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Disembowelment is driving me nuts!
It is quite the unkindest of cuts.
I'd write in to complain
That it's most inhumane,
But quite frankly, I don't have the guts.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Her tricoleur cake's caused a stir on
Bastille Day. As is de rigueur, on
The top's a rosette
Made of icing. I bet
It's the best you've seen yet—yes, her fleuron.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
In damp forests, you'll find devil's club.
It's a tall, leafy, spiny-stemmed shrub.
Branches dip when you trip —
Then spring back like a whip.
Watch your step.  They can give you a drub.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Vita brevis, ars longa is taught
As life's short, art is long, and that thought
Means your art will survive
When you aren't alive —
That the world will retain what you brought.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
With asthma she'll huff and she'll wheeze,
She'll cough and may grunt, but won't sneeze.
