Cosmic rays, sent from Mars.
That's why I wear a tinfoil hat.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
Should I abdicate — give up my throne
And all of the titles I own?
Should young Charles have his way
As he hopes to some day?
Bloody bollocks to that! — Let him moan.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Lawyers' Ball? It's a fete that's deluxe.
Bea's insisting I buy a new tux.
(I refer to my wife,
Who's the light of my life.)
Yes, that's right, I'm invited et ux.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
A camorra's a secret society
Which is known for its evil, not piety.
But write it Camorra
(And don your fedora)
And you mean the Italian variety.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Have your hissy fit, lose your control;
Yell and blow up, explode with your soul.
Can't you use more aplomb?
Hey, cool down! I'm your mom...
So I'm pissing you off...that's my role!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
At the side of your boat, where it's dank,
You can see that there's many a plank
That should meet end-to-end
And butt up to a friend.
To repair, get a loan from your bank.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
When covetously Susie espied
The young man by her friend Amy's side,
She decided to steal him
From Amy, and deal him
A plot using wiles she applied.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
It's a diamond, dear — don't look away.
I think pear-shaped is just so passé.
As my buck spends his money
On "cute little Bunny",
This twelve carat carrot's my pay.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This dismantling before it's begun
Delegitimizes all that we've done.
The act stands or it falls,
But at least have the balls
To allow it some time in the sun.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
When I'm speaking of basso-relievo,
I swear no intent to deceive-o;
I mean you no grief
When I say bas-relief
Means the same thing in French. Please believe-o.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When Richard the pitcher was fatter,
His splitter the hitters would splatter.
Once the score didn't matter,
Those hitters would scatter,
Since, bitter, he hit every batter!

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Great Babylon's king loosed the truss
On Jehoiachin; made quite a fuss.
But Evil-Merodach,
Named so like a toad—ack!—
Can't quite be seen kindly by us.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Round a table they clash, do-or-die,
Circumtabular, fixed eye-to-eye.
Tables don't intervene,
Though, once talk turns obscene…
Or depart when, at last, feathers fly.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On May 3rd, 1975,
I was one of just three to survive
An explosion. I say
Every year on that day:
"I was blinded but, hell, I'm alive!"

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Asked the Doc, "You have pain in your joint?
I prescribe that you (daily) anoint
It with Jack's Junction Ointment
Until your appointment;
You'll love it — it won't disappoint."

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
The sea's  cyclobranchiate critters
Have never been thought of as quitters.
Those gills 'round the edge
Of their bodies, I pledge,
Are marks of these prize boat-hull-sitters.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Gail showed photos on line, in detail,
Of this fossil she'd found in the shale,
And the pictures went viral.
Its shape (concho-spiral)
Made the ancient tooth look like a snail.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A cantankerous Scot called McMorran,
Who resembled a bear with a sporran,
Shouted, "All men are vile!"
While reserving most bile
For anyone thought to be foreign.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
With cosmetics all over your face,
You're a monster from deep outer space.
What you think looks delightful
Is scary and frightful —
I'm shielding my eyes just in case.

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Heard the grisly report about Maurie?
Torn remains were unearthed in the quarry.
Seems a foraging bear
Searched for berries in there;
That's the horrible end of the story.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Ampelography helps one refine
The efficient production of wine.
It is clear you must traipse
Through huge vineyards of grapes.
Know the fruit, yes, but first know the vine.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Its larvae reside in a tent,
Where they gather, without paying rent,
On the fork of a branch.
There they nibble, carte blanche.
As protection their thrashing is meant.

limerick_list.author: AronKuppersmith
limerick_list.text:
The lead batter's pop fly soared to right.
Though the outfielder kept it in sight,
A low cloud sailed away
And he errored that play
'Cause, like Bruce, he was blinded by light.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
They've livestock and thrill rides to spare,
But the foodstands were keeping me there:
From the sauteed papaya
To a fried jambalaya.
All manner of fare's at the fair.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Said Pussy, not given to claritude,
'Dear Owl, we have languished in tarritude.
Let's embrace conjugality,
And bind our duality
In a state of felicitous marritude.'

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
At times it's a force of attraction,
But at others, repulsion's the action.
As the distance gets large,
The effect of the charge
Of the coulombs is only a fraction.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
They were nude as they passed through the door
To a room with a "special" decor.
Though it's doubted by some,
da da DUM, da da DUM.
(A deletion's been made of Line 4.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dioxane, a solvent in paint,
Is a compound I wouldn't call "quaint."
Though it isn't corrosive,
It may be explosive.
Is this verse a complaint? No, it ain't,

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
He's a leftist, and always a gent;
It's a life of compassion he's spent.
But now that's he's old,
He is bowed, like a fold,
And he's proud of his liberal bent.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
When, at sunset, the day starts to wane,
All the daytimer stations abstain
From sending their wattage
To my little cottage
Since the FCC says to refrain.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Fine calligraphy's pencraft and stroke,
And for learners, the awe these invoke.
Our scribe Luke would instruct us
On each symbol's ductus
By example; old Luke never spoke.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A flamingo, a dove, and a hawk,
An albatross, penguin, and auk:
They're all avifauna,
Cohabiting on a
Few chunks of Galapagos rock.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
When a cracker would fail to go off
With a bang (more a dry, stifled cough)
On the fifth of November,
I fondly remember
"A fizzog!" we'd say with a scoff.

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
The cnemis, or shinbone, one skins
When one trips on low objects. Therein's
Cnemic damage or pain.
And you are, I maintain,
Not "acnemic" for having no shins.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Something sticky demands delinition,
And our children uphold that tradition:
Many smears mar the grace
Of their grandparents' place,
But there's never a trace of contrition.

limerick_list.author: Nan
limerick_list.text:
Sun-dried earth and some straw make adobe.
You can use it to build in the Gobi
Where it's hot and it's dry
But you ought not to try
To apply it at Lake Okeechobee.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
I have heard alfenide's  an alloy
Certain companies wish to employ
To make jewelry or wire—
Or melt down in a fire
If this compound they wish to destroy.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
"For an alkali, Dad," said the daughter,
With the chemistry set that he'd bought her,
"Taking sodium rocks I'd
Create a hydroxide,
Dissolving the whole thing in water."

limerick_list.author: Qermaq
limerick_list.text:
Alto saxophones (saxes) are known
To project with a wonderful tone.
But Chicago's horn section
Can't pass an inspection
Sans trumpet and Jimmy's trombone!

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
When employing this word, be specific,
For the fish has a name scientific,
And the wind blows two ways.
But Chinookans—their days
Have been spent near the U.S. Pacific.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Can we go to a play?" asked my Valerie.
She knows that I earn a low salary.
"Okay," my reply,
"But we have to sit high
In the gods.  Seats are cheap in the gallery."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Every pumpkin, tomato, and gourd
Had been sold; all the corn had been stored.
He considered the bounty
(The best in the county),
Knelt down and gave thanks to the Lord.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
His card games are totally fixed.
When he "shuffles," his cards don't get mixed.
After losing ten rounds
While his tally abounds,
I said, "Buddy, our next game is nixed."

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
There was a young lady of York
Who fell prey, on a bird-watching walk,
To a randy old twitcher
Who proceeded to ditch her:
The next bird she saw was the stork.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though Death Row's overcrowded today,
The electric chair causes delay.
With a sofa, however,
By pulling one lever
We could execute more straightaway.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This town's profligate, sinful to some,
'Cause whatever you do, we'll stay mum.
We're your Babylon, mac,
So fly in and unpack.
Here, temptation's not fought; we succumb.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles and Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
The bomber, so swiftly it flew,
After dropping that lone buckaroo.
With a wave of aplomb,
He's astraddle the bomb.
Slim-to-none are his chances. Yahoo.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
A unicorn group? I'd be guessing
The name, but then, since you are pressing
For terms called "collective,"
Let's take the perspective
That mystical sights are a blessing.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"There are times when you treat me like dirt
And accuse me of acting the flirt."
"I'm not getting at you;
I just say what seems true.
And I'm sorry if that leaves you hurt."

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
Let's discuss the urethra and anus
With a sense of mature everydayness.
For we all drink and eat
And thereafter excrete,
And it's these humble outlets that drain us.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
As the mayor, I endenizen men,
And today, I endenizened ten:
Len, Ken, Ben, Brendan, Brad,
Den, Sten, Ren, Chen and Chad—
Signed-up citizens, all by my pen.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Ah, that hay-fevered, angular Yankee!
When that Northerner, long, lean, and lanky,
Blows his nose in some cloth,
I get into a froth;
I'm all set to commence hanky-panky.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
Father, Son, Holy Ghost, coeternal,
Ever were, ever will be, supernal.
Not yet flesh, not yet flame,
There was Word all the same.
(Of incendiary books, I will burn all.)

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Abernethy's a crisp UK cookie—
Here's a warning, you touristy rookie:
If you value your teethies,
Don't crunch Abernethies,
Lest your dentist you pay, not your bookie.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The goddess of dawn—I thought, "Hey,
Any crossword fan knows right away
That it's Eos."  I do
Online puzzles. That clue
Will show up, like the sun, every day.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Two innkeeper-artists emblazon
Faux-heraldic designs, here at Days Inn,
On our walls — best of all,
What a herald might call
"Purpure puppy relievin', leg raisin'."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His job was to serve a subpoena
To the boss of the local marina.
Since the job made him sad,
He decided to add
Several jigs on his old concertina.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Rush Limbaugh is Sarah P.'s honey.
Call him out? Makes her future less sunny.
"The prez must toss out Rahm.
Saying 'retards' brings harm."
But when Rush says that word? He's just funny.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
A collyrium: bullet-shaped dose
For an orifice. Ani get most,
But some target, not rear,
But vagina, nose, ear,
Even penis. (Men chorus, "That's gross!")

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A catalyst makes things react.
My reaction was slow 'cause it lacked
That remarkable stuff—
Just a pinch is enough
To make chemistry move.  That's a fact!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A group called the DSNA
Has, for word geeks, a certain cachet.
You're a lexicon buff?
You just can't get enough?
Well then, maybe you'll join them someday.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The night-thieves sneak into your houses
While it's dark; cunning day-thieves are louses
Who defraud you or, say,
Rob at gunpoint by day.
One woman had both sorts as spouses.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My proposal has got approvability;
It is planned with finesse and agility,
But the House and the Senate
Must vote for it; then it
Won't end as unvarnished futility.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Was Atlantis impressive? You bet!
The most fabled of lost cities yet.
But its shrine to Poseidon
Went under the tide, 'n'
Its fans never let us forget.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
As I flipped a few steaks on the grill,
One thick sirloin dropped in. (That takes skill!)
So I yelled, "Sister, dear,
Free this meat from down there."
"I am not your commis, Bossy Bill!"

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Televangelist heads up my list
Of words that just shouldn't exist.
What's the use of this term
When we've con man and worm
To describe crooks who wouldn't be missed?

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
An Aussie may comment, "Fair dinkum!"
On a girl, or your house, or your income,
Or a book, or a show,
Or maybe a row
Of glasses of Foster's (then drink 'em).

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Smokey angrily cried, "No one cares!
Feckless usage of lighters and flares
Places woodlands in danger.
As the forest's top ranger,
I will fight for the right to arm bears!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
My husband's transparent. A few
Of our friends ask me, "What do you do
If he's lost in the throng?"
I just sing him "our song",
Which (of course) is "The Clearness of You".

limerick_list.author: FunkyTuba
limerick_list.text:
My son tried to affix his new sticker.
His assiduous sis is a licker.
So the sticker stuck less
'Cause sis licked to excess.
Bond was gone. Mad son smacked sis's snicker.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
They jammed me right next to a loser (large).
On my next long-haul flight I will choose a large
Seat for my ass
With champagne in first class,
And a legroomy wide-bodied fuselage.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Embryonic, within each small seed
There awaits a small wonder to heed
Nature's call and fulfill
Its own destiny. Still,
Will it be a great tree, or a weed?

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
To resolve GI system's disquiet
Folks eliminate foods from their diet.
(Patient numbers, it's noted,
Get progressively bloated.)
Food intolerance? Yield, don't defy it.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
You stepped on my plastic dog poo,
With your best, most expensive suede shoe.
Oh, the curses you cried
From that ill-fated stride —
Caca phony? Cacophony too.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
From the beacon a sharp beam of light
Marks an arc sweeping dark skies at night.
Its signal gleams bright
So we'll navigate right—
Steering safely, with guidance in sight.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I think it's a boneheaded plan.
Beat the Hessians? I don't think we can.
Yes, I know what you're thinking—
It's Christmas, they're drinking—
But they'll trounce us and kill every man!

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Highly civilised, small and bright pink;
Mouse-shaped persons, long-nosed — they can think.
Clangers talk with a whistle,
But I'm quite sure that this'll
Not stop them from getting a drink ...

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
For to be to be tickety-boo,
Say "I am" (for "I is" is non-U).
It is life's shortest sentence,
And risks no repentance
Like this one, the longest: "I do."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
My son's dormitory's really a mess.
How it got there I haven't a guess.
Fungi's starting to bloom
In that quad's dirty room.
And that bed? Most would dread, I confess.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I had spelled it C-A-J-A-N,
And it looked rather odd, even then.
Now my English prof's ragin'
At how I spelled Cajun.
I'll not spell it that way again!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A coulter's attached to a plow,
Like the plates on an icebreaker's bow.
It's a vertical blade
That is specially made
To cut soil, not the slow-moving cow.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Dotty Phelps has long held the fond wish
Of catching the world's largest fish.
Does she cast a strong line
In the Tyne? Or the Rhine?
No, her net's in the soup-serving dish.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Delectableness speaks of taste
That no gourmet could savour in haste.
It's the pleasure that lingers
While licking my fingers —
And don't ever mention my waist.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cacatuidae: family of parrots
Not often found living in garrets.
They're cockatoos, crested;
Their supremacy's vested.
They dine on fine birdseed and carrots.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Mel Allen was brilliant at fighting
Off boredom in baseball, inviting
The fans of New Yawk
To tune in—hear him talk.
Even dull games he made sound exciting.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
"Euclid wasn't obtuse, but acute;
Though this postulate here is a hoot!"
Lobachevsky did shout,
As he tossed the fifth out—
"My geometry's more absolute."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His repute in the Congress? It sunk.
He spoke nonsense, but didn't seem drunk.
Mr. Walker said, "I
Speak for Buncombe!"  (That's why
We mean balderdash when we say bunk.)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I suffer from weight loss humility.
It's useless.  I have no ability.
All day long I could run,
But the pounds melted?  None.
It's an exercise done in futility.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
With purposeful gabble and babble,
Some toddlers convened in a rabble.
Their target: the wall.
And their aim: first of all,
To besplatter, besmear and bedabble.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The beams of a ship, made of wood,
Stretch from starboard to port, understood?
I once built me a ship.
It was yar—a real pip!
They supported the decks for me good.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The seventh Pope Benedict said:
"Screw your profits! Now simony's dead!"
Then for nine peaceful years
He hung on, it appears,
As the Vatican's competent head.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Please dishaunt us, dear ghost; I'm a sight!
I can't sleep, and my bloke and I fight.
We are tired of your bells
And those musty old smells,
And strange things that go bump in the night.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
A state in northwestern U.S.?
One is Washington State, as you'll guess,
Or the Evergreen State
(That's a name très ornate,
Which I've known since today, I confess).

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A resourceful old archer named Scott
Had no arrows left; all had been shot.
"To reload is no sweat;
They're so easy to get,
Since there's ditch reed nearby I can spot."

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
It has never been known as a glam shaft,
But nor is it cursed as a damn shaft.
This valve-timing thingy
Can't make your car pingy
(No knock). So no knocking the camshaft!

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A poet is plagued with the blues;
Nothing rhymes — what calamitous news!
So he walks, lost in thought,
All the day, all for naught,
'Cause he should have gone home to his mews.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Every person with whom I must work
Is, beyond any question, a jerk.
No exceptions! Not Bill,
Not Loretta, not Phil,
Not Rudolfo, not Edna, not Kirk!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Their project's abrupt termination
Leads our contract to sad degradation.
That which once was bestowed
We are no longer owed.
Is it breach? No, just deobligation.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Good Lord, please, deliver us from
All ghoulies and ghosties" (or bomb?).
This old Cornish Litany
Was said (not in Brittany)
In Cornwall with zest and aplomb.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I pick up my shoes on the run,
And the cobbler pronounces them done.
But what once were size 8s
Are now 4s, so he states:
"Half a loafer is better than none!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"In the case of The World v. O'Connor,
I will act as attorney, Your Honor,
For myself." The judge sighed
As he calmly replied,
"You're a moron and surely a goner."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I wish that my brain had a slot
Like my laptop computer has got:
An interface space,
Where a flash drive I'd place,
As my own mem'ry's losing the plot.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
"What's the spice in this food?" diners chime,
"For the taste of it's simply sublime."
What the cook found superb
Is a long-lasting herb —
She's enjoying the life of her thyme.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The fingers you've got on one hand,
Those four guys and Dave Clark (an old band),
Or the lines in this verse,
Or the letters in curse
Each add up to just five, understand?

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I got back at my nasty old teacher:
"You attempt to appear like a preacher,
But your sermons sound false,
Like four beats in a waltz.
You are such an unsavoury creature!"

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
This telegraph pole is a large pole,
But safe, no electrical-charge pole!
That pole, though, don't touch,
Oh no, thank you so much:
That's one pole I'd not touch with a barge pole.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
I've found my old boomerang. Wow!
I shall throw it again now — but how?
As my memory's rotten,
I might have forgotten...
Ah, it's coming right back to me now!

limerick_list.author: Meps Schulte
limerick_list.text:
The ape that is called the baboon
Is hairy, and sings out of tune.
He's not very tall,
His legs are quite small,
But his arms, they could reach to the moon.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Vegetarian: that's how you wallow?
Well, here's some advice you can follow.
If tempted to slip
Off your diet, a tip:
Eschew all your meat 'fore you swallow.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
"Your dishonorableness," said the chief monk,
"Is untenable: Filthy and drunk,
And then starting a brawl,
You brought shame — on us all.
What would Buddha say now, wretched punk?"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Anosphresia's making me think:
Are you right when you claim that I stink?
If a man couldn't smell,
How the hell would he tell?
Hold your nose while I buy you a drink.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Here is boffo, a word I wrote down,
That resembles the name of a clown.
Something's boffo if it
Is a laugh or a hit.
It's an adjective; also a noun.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
With a woman you've made a connection,
And you're sensing a bedroom direction.
First things first.  Pay a call
To the store.  Above all,
It's important to buy some protection.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
"Say, 'Ah,'" says the doc. From his coat
Comes an otoscope (see author's note).
But a bronchoscope goes
As a tube through your nose,
For a look that's way down in your throat.

limerick_list.author: Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
Said the ceiling one night to the floor,
"Oh, how sweetly you lie, mon amour,
In your carpet so fine.
Let us flee!  Please be mine!"
Come the day, they'd eloped through the door.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
When a small circle's outside moves round
One (a circle) that's larger, though bound
To perform it, essentially,
Circumferentially,
Epicycle's its title, I've found.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Eye candy is often a feast.
It is beauty that brings us, at least,
Something sweet to admire;
But I'm bound to inquire
Why it's so often paired with the beast.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Said the peach to the almond, "How come
Our fine genus gets lumped with the plum?
The Prunus are plain,
While Amygdalus reign
As superior. Why should we slum?"

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
An alkalophile doesn't die
When it swims in a pool of weak lye.
"Thanks a lot!" says this germ,
"This is great for my perm.
Now my cilia sparkle.  Good-bye!"

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Is deficit financing set
To make us all paupers? You bet,
If the government borrows
To hock our tomorrows
For spending that's funded by debt.

limerick_list.author: DaveD
limerick_list.text:
If your copper's too bright in the sun
Then ammonium sulfate's the one.
For a dull, greenish cast,
Use some now; it's a blast.
(That line four's an intentional pun.)

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
When girls come together to meet
For a chat, cobbled streets may look neat;
Although concrete and tar
Are much safer, by far,
If stilettos are worn on the feet.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
I got in on OEDILF long ago
When an author I happened to know
Wrote a letter to Virge
To advise he'd an urge
To invite me as part of the show.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The landlords are out-and-out thugs,
And the bed linen's crawling with bugs.
Imagine clean faces
On these pillow cases!
To sleep in these sheets we'd be mugs.

limerick_list.author: Matt Schweizer and David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
From Hades' dark, fearsome abyss
Beckons Avarice who, with her kiss,
Seeks to scorch with the fire
Of greedy desire
And hinder your journey towards bliss.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The truck's  driver might well have been warier
When inspecting his loaded car carrier.
He drove all the way
From Detroit to L.A.,
Never seeing the peeing fox terrier.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Citronellol: its smell is like roses.
Where it comes from, one hardly supposes,
Would be grass that supplies
Oil that drives away flies.
Citronella's not sweet to our noses.

limerick_list.author: Carole Lyons
limerick_list.text:
At this lively and loud celebration—
A social affair that is Haitian
And called a bamboche—
I imagine it's gauche
Not to sing and to dance with elation.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Doc's assured me the lump is benign,
So don't fuss over me; I'll be fine.
Huge bouquets every day,
Your displays of dismay —
I'm no saint and the condo's no shrine.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The bleeding-heart libs like to show
Their compassion by how much we throw
At life's problems, then say
When results cause dismay,
"What we need is more money."  Oh, no!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In the cycle 'twixt liver and muscle,
Both lactate and glucose will hustle
Like a convoy of lorries—
Described by the Coris—
An energy source when we bustle.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mom's old letters I found in the attic,
From her ex, were dramatic, ecstatic!
And as Dad's unaware
That the letters are there,
If I cite them, I'll be diplomatic.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Pomade acne is prone to attack
Men whose foreheads and temples are black.
You can get this when you
Put that goo on your do.
Not too much now, Jack.  Cut it some slack!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A dipeptide's a chemical that
Can be hydrolyzed, right off the bat.
Amino acids you'll get.
Each dipeptide, I'll bet,
Yields two acids in one second flat.

limerick_list.author: Jean McEwen
limerick_list.text:
The next time you bake apple pie
Give a Braeburn or Cortland a try.
You will certainly savor
Their texture and flavor.
With these, you will ne'er go awry.

limerick_list.author: kponto
limerick_list.text:
An astrophotographer's place
Is capturing pictures of space.
"I'd far rather shoot stars,
Supernovae, or Mars,
Than a building, a car, or a face."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"I will gamble you out of your soul,"
Crooned the Dark One, "your spirit's my goal."
"This seems terribly fraught;
Shall I risk it?" I thought.
"Can I chance my way out of this hole?"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Democratic-Republicans gained
As support for the Federalists waned.
With states' rights, for a starter,
And a strictly read charter,
For a whole generation they reigned.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
The bindery chose a doublure
Both to signify class and endure.
As you open this book,
You will not overlook
Its leatherwork's craft and allure.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
Her deviated septum brings pain
And it won't let her sinuses drain.
I suppose this is true —
But her nose is askew,
And she's fixing it 'cause she is vain.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Through the base of my glass (it's no joke), all
My friends look quite good, in my local.
But my eye-doctor sighed,
"You're so very cross-eyed
That I've made your new glasses confocal."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
What's a birdwing? Some kind of a wing
On a bird or some similar thing?
No, as big as a bat,
It's a butterfly that
You might notice when spring's in full swing.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The new mobster was set to begin.
Said the mafia don with a grin:
"Killing's part of the job
Once you're part of the mob.
Are you ready to do someone in?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I don't mean to sound harsh, I'm your buddy;
But your thinking's incredibly muddy.
Your pet donkey, you say,
Will be mayor some day.
Pal, your cuddy is owned by a cuddy.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Would Gogol have googled if he
Were alive in this age of TV
And computers? I guess
That the answer is yes,
And that, googly-eyed, he'd agree.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
The council's epitome spoke,
Not in abstract terms, why we are broke.
It summarised debt,
And outlined: you bet,
That we'll need to take more from our folk.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
As they sat on a mat in their flat,
Kat and Pat had an intimate chat:
Talk of this and of that,
Who they are, where they're at;
They were happy just chewing the fat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In our quest to get rid of bad germs,
I've had quotes, and I feel that this firm's
Is the most advantageous—
Some were really outrageous!—
They've offered us favorable terms.

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Infarctions attack like a thug;
They act as if pulling a plug
From your energy base.
Try avoiding that case:
Take an anti-cholesterol drug!

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Before there is wine, there is must.
Before there is love, there is lust.
This logical flow
Is everywhere, so
Before there are bunnies, there's dust.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A crusty old Scrabbler named Frank
Had a game going bad, in the tank.
"Draw a 'G', 63,
50 bonus if 'P'."
On his turn he ("...Let's see...") drew a blank.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
For a cricketing vicar it pays
To bowl googlies.  My Archbishop says:
"Play as much as you can;
The Church values a man
Who's an adept at turning both ways."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Upon hearing this, Tom became cross.
(He'd a longstanding love for the sauce.)
"It's no problem," he lied,
But Ted simply replied,
"You don't like it? Then go to the boss."

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Two lenses, one flint and one crown,
Form the doublet, design of renown.
Modern achromats vie
With the trilobite eye
In the way aberration's kept down.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
"I'm all 'oarse, doc; me cough's a real rasper. It's
Bloody 'orrible — can't smoke me gasper. It's
'Ot as 'ell, is me 'ead."
Having heard what he said,
I advised him to take a few aspirates.

limerick_list.author: David Schildkret
limerick_list.text:
My publisher took a big chance
When he paid me a healthy advance.
But the work on my book
Won't advance, so I took
My advance and advanced into France.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A hog-farming buddy of mine
Is an expert at knitting with twine.
To the piggies he pitches
His fanciest stitches:
He loves casting purls before swine.

limerick_list.author: cauliflower
limerick_list.text:
Once the Sitwells, so lofty of brow,
Were all highly esteemed.  They aren't now.
Most today would agree
With Noël Coward.  Said he:
"They're two wiseacres, dear, and a cow."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My sister gave birth.  It seems Sally
Was depressed and unable to rally
When she found, from his chart,
That her newborn son's heart
Had a patent foramen ovale.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
An astonishing backflow: the lake
Swirled down to the mine.  In its wake,
The Delcambre Canal
Then rushed in. That locale
Was transformed by a backward mistake.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
There once was a hacker obsessed
With the writing of limericks that jest
About modem transmissions
And signal transitions,
'Cause a limerick that's baudy's the best.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
It's fake news, made up stories, untrue,
Pure fiction, tales out of the blue.
There's nothing that's phonier.
Source? Macedonia.
Teens publish, while fools pay to view.

limerick_list.author: splendiferous
limerick_list.text:
My events I want people to grace
With their presence (my skill to embrace).
I've no drive to appear
If there's no one to hear.
If no audients, why show my face?

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
In the dining room's where you should eat,
At the table, ensconced in your seat—
Not in front of the box
In your boxers and socks,
With the dog licking crumbs off your feet.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Will choosing that senator rate
With Floridians?  Help to create
Some excitement?  We'll see
If that pick for VP
Gives an edge and delivers the state.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A man fell in love with a kitty,
And wrote her a sweet little ditty.
She sang right along
With his amorous song,
Though her yowling was not very pretty.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Told my girl friend, 'I've partnered a pro;
Holed in one.' Then she screamed at me, 'Go!'
'No! A golf pro I mean.
And we played on the green.
He gets paid to help tyros, love.' 'Oh.'

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our new sewer inspector, Rex Hector,
Is a very intrepid expecter.
He expects that his nose,
Wherever it goes,
Will find leaks —  it's a "fecal detector".

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
"Christianity: here's a new kind,"
Said Brian McLaren. "You'll find
Core beliefs now revised."
(You need not be surprised
If young seekers are of a like mind.)

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Exaltation we know; its reverse
Is abasement, perhaps, but there's worse:
The humblest condition
Is exinanition—
Self-emptying. Just like my purse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Detective, stunt pilot, reporter,
Connie needed no man to support her.
How can heroes be girls
With such pretty blonde curls?
Every villain believed he could thwart her.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A contrivance or gadget, I learn,
May be known by this label: concern.
(Here's my firm guarantee:
Come write limericks with me
And a fine education you'll earn.)

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Said a dinosaur once to his mate,
"God intended us, p'rhaps, to frustrate
What Charles Darwin might say;
So I've done it today:
His forebear's the man I just ate."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"That's balderdash, bunkum, and crap!"
I exclaim to that blathering chap
Spouting nonsense and bosh,
As we finish our nosh
And prepare for our mid-morning nap.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Genus Biston has many a moth,
But they certainly wouldn't eat cloth.
Since the cloth is too hard,
They could well try some lard
Or perhaps something softer—like broth.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
Can you write a new ditty that's smart?
One with zing, so kids sing it by heart?
The producer said, "Yup:
I don't wanna grow up,
I'm a Toys 'R' Us kid." (Jingle art!)

limerick_list.author: mino
limerick_list.text:
Well, austere's such a good word to learn:
"Strict and sombre", with no room to turn.
But not "making crude jokes
About lesbian folks":
That's a totally separate Stern.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Liquored up, Louie's drunk as a fly
Or a badger or bat. Who knows why
For these sayings we use
Things that don't consume booze?
You could get a skunk drunk, but why try?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
It is distance in time or in space,
Or the absence from here or a place,
Like awayness from me
Sought by women who flee
After spraying my face with their mace.

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
An enthusiast loves and supports
Some person or thing, such as sports.
I just can't get enough
Of young girls in the buff —
"Are you dreaming again?" my wife snorts.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
The drug I stirred into her soup
Included an acetyl group,
To speed up the effects,
And incline her to sex;
But alas! she was thrown for a loop.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
The concepts I lodged in my book
Are beliefs that from others I took.
They wanted them spread
But were scared to embed
Them in theirs. Does this make me a crook?

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I had reckoned I could be "the Bard"
Till my progress was suddenly marred
By Shakespearience lacking.
My fans sent me packing.
At last I've succeeded: I'm barred.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
When the cock-tail beetle's upset
It opens big jaws in a threat
While it raises its rear
As a bug bombardier.
It's the devil's own coach-horse, no pet.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Motorway, autobahn, freeway;
Each one, without tolls: a no-fee way.
Drivers soon understand,
In whichever the land,
Such a highway's, expressly, a whee way!

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My  endowment to Ku Klux Klan U
Is to aid  just the lily white  few.
It's a handsome provider
For a future night rider,
But no help for a Black or a Jew.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We heard you been dealin' in booze
On our turf, so we bring you some news.
The Don don't approve,
Says he likes you should move.
That's an offer you cannot refuse.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Said the text, "I'm an affable lad,"
So I answered his personal ad.
Now I date him, but fear it's
Perverse and it's queer; it's
So weird to be dating my dad.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Are my clothes out of style?" blurted Gert.
"Donnie called me a dowdy. I'm hurt!"
I replied, "Use good sense;
You should not take offense,
As a dowdy's a tasty dessert."

limerick_list.author: mrsrev and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
For us all, Dr. Abernathy tried
To sweep segregation aside.
The civil rights movement
Brought all lives improvement,
Not just in the states, but worldwide.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
A kidnapper called me today.
Here's the message he wished to convey:
"I have here your son
At the point of a gun.
Want to see him again? Then you pay."

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
When the serious thinker dispenses
With learning, true wisdom commences;
I therefore set out
On methodical doubt,
Taking resolute leave of my senses.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I am bothered by dreams of my ex.
In my nightmares, he looks like T. rex.
First he shows me his teeth,
Then those parts down beneath;
Then he asks if I want to have sex.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
Those pesky game moles drive me mad.
I clobber their heads—ain't that sad?
This whacking obsession
Lets out my aggression.
But they're plastic—I don't feel so bad.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Seems I just can't get through to you, son:
You must not point at folks with your gun!
Don't know why you're so dull;
Getting through your thick skull
To what passes for brains isn't f—

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A grievous affliction of spirit
So bitter, it pains us to hear it!
The plight of the outcast,
When known, will no doubt cast
A pall on the rich who live near it.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
A dicast would not have a grudge
About letters that forced him to trudge
To a courthouse as juror.
Our lot is much poorer:
He wasn't just jury, but judge.

limerick_list.author: eris8x6
limerick_list.text:
I'm feeling euphoric and gay!
No, not 'cause I'm smoking a jay:
I'm taking big bites
Of chocolate delights,
And anandamide's making my day.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
I landed a freshwater cheven
(Or chavender) after eleven.
This luckless young chub
Made delectable grub:
Down the little red lane to fish heaven.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
"It's the Devil who sent him to me.
I've been punished," says Ma. "Golly gee!
I committed some sin.
Now I'm blamed by my kin
For a son who deprives me of glee."

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
Pretty pink are its salts, like a rose,
And in Contact its  use, we suppose,
Was to control  a machine
So that earthlings might glean
The ETs' objective. Who knows?

limerick_list.author: old dad
limerick_list.text:
With the science of region surveying,
I suppose that it goes without saying
That it comes with a price.
Yes, chorometry's nice,
But the Arctic? How much are you paying?

limerick_list.author: TIGER and David Roberts
limerick_list.text:
Tasty bird, sitting proud on my wall,
Soon discovered that pride precedes fall.
It is sad and all that,
But you can't blame the cat —
To the carnivore, meat conquers all.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The oil from East Indian trees
Called chaulmoogras once treated disease
Of the skin.  It's still used
If one's sprained or is bruised
Or has sores, so discomfort will ease.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
